loans.name: Geoffrey Mwaura

texts.en:
Geoffrey Mwaura is 36 years old and married to Ann Wanjiru. They have three children who are all in school. Geoffrey has been in the motorcycle transport business for four years and, on the side, has a small household goods shop in Naivasha town that is managed by his wife.

This is Geoffrey's second loan with KADET. He would like to buy more goods to restock his small retail store. He has plans to expand both his businesses and increase his income to a level where he can easily send all of his children through school and have a financially stable future.

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to empowering its clients economically by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To restock his household goods shop.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en la casa de sus suegros.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al bordado de fustanes (tipo de falda regional) y paralelamente vende quesos de forma ambulante por las calles de su ciudad. Vilma acondicionó en su casa un pequeño espacio donde realiza los bordados, los cuales son solicitados generalmente durante las festividades del pueblo. En ocasiones, sus hijas la apoyan en esta tarea, la cual es un negocio rentable, porque debido al detalle del bordado, puede obtener buenas ganancias por cada falda. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, Vilma es una socia muy comprometida con su banco comunal y también una mujer perseverante en el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de telas e hilos para sus bordados y mayor cantidad de quesos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales textiles

loans.name: Nelgrace

texts.en:
Nelgrace M. is 24 years old and married to Emanuel M., who is 37 and works as a technician. They have one lovely daughter, Shaina Mae, who is three years old. Emanuel provides them with the things that they need to get by day-to-day, but it is only enough income to meet expenses, with nothing for savings.

That is why Nelgrace decided to joined a Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). Her goal was to build a business that can augment her husband's income. Her first idea was to build a variety store, but after some research she discovered that raising pigs can generate much more income. So she applied for a loan to go into this line of work. Today, her business is doing well and supplementing the family's income. Nelgrace would like to increase her income further by buying more piglets to raise, along with feed for them to eat. 

Nelgrace hopes to earn enough money to build her own house, and is saving her extra income to make this dream come true. She is also saving to educate her daughter, because she wants her to have a better life.

loans.use: To expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: S., 45, has four children, one of whom is married. Another one of his children works in a factory while the other two are students. His life partner is Put, who is 42 years old. She earns a living by selling rattan cupboards in nearby villages and communes. S. makes the cupboards, a skill he began learning when he was 18 years old. He mostly goes into the deep forest and climbs mountains to get his rattan, but occasionally also buys it from other people. He is determined to improve his family's living standards, and has applied for this loan to make that possible. S. was not available when this potograph was taken, so we see his wife instead.

loans.use: to expand a small business making rattan cupboards.

loans.name: Sam-An

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-an M., 43 (shown in the picture with is wife) and his wife, Mrs. Samphor Heng, have been married since 1986 and have 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. The eldest daughter was married and lives in separated home and other three attend school. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sam-an has been a deputy school principal of college for 26 years. His wife sells meal in a school near her house. One of Sam-an’ sons is attending University in Phnom Penh, so he is asking for his first loan of $500 to pay school fees for his son.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Omar Aquilino

texts.es: El señor Omar Aquilino C. Velásquez, tiene la edad de 46 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, ubicado en La Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Masaya para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos, todos estudian y le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace ocho años se dedica a la agricultura , ya que sus padres le brindaron la oportunidad , a la vez esta muy agradecido con Afodenic , por la buena aprobación de su primer crédito , el cual lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos para inducir el cultivo de piña y poder tener una buena cosecha la cual espera vender a buen precio
texts.en:
Señor Omar Aquilino C. Velásquez is 46 and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood, which is located in La Concepción Masaya. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant in the market in Masaya to help him with their home's expenses. They have three children, who all study and support him with his agricultural work. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions. He has worked in agriculture for eight years, and his parents offered him this opportunity. He is very grateful to Afodenic for approving him for his first loan, which he is going to invest in fertilizers and supplies for his pineapple crop so he can have a good harvest, which he hopes to sell at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers to apply to his crops

loans.name: Gema Carolina

texts.es: La Señora Gema Carolina tiene 25 años, su estado civil es casada. Tiene 1 hijo y estudia para ser uno profesional. La actividad económica de Gema es la venta de ropa, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio junto a su esposo, quien le dio la idea y entonces ella comenzó a ofrecer este productos para una mejor búsqueda de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Gema son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que solicito ayuda a Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar más productos para su negocio. Sus deseos son de ampliar su establecimiento para lograr tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Gema Carolina is 25 years old and she is married. She has one child and is studying to be a professional. Her economic activity is selling clothes, and she has been running her business for 7 years. She started the business with her husband, who gave her the idea, and she started to sell these products in order to have a better income for her family. Gema intends to move forward with her business - everything that she has currently has cost her a lot of effort and she doesn't want to lose the advantage. It is for this reason that she requested help from Fundación León with the goal of buying more products for her business. Her wish is to expand her facility and to be able to run an additional business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Glanda Nuvia

texts.es:
la joven GLENDA NUVIA H. OBREGON tiene una tienda en la cual vende abarroteria, misma que opera bajo el nombre de Púlperia "LOS 4 HERMANOS" negocio que tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Doña Glenda, es una persona de principios Cristianos,  tiene 5 1/2 años de haber iniciado con su negocio, con el tiempo que tiene de administralo le ha ido muy bién, nos comento que inicio su pulpería con un capital de Lps. 500.00 y ahora su negocio ha crecido en gran manera y luce de buen surtido.- la Sra. H. se ha sabido ganar la clientela por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que ofrece.
Doña Glenda, es casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales dependen del matrimonio, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de Maíz y Frijoles.
texts.en:
Glenda Nuvia H. Obregon has a grocery store that she operates out of her home. Her business is named “Los 4 Hermanos” (The 4 Brothers).

Doña Glenda is a woman of Christian principles. She started her business 5½ years ago and has managed to do very well. With starting capital of Lps. 500.00, she says her business has grown tremendously and is well-stocked. She has managed to gain customers by providing them good service and offering the best prices. Doña Glenda is married and has 4 dependent children. Her husband is a farmer who grows corn and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un K. is a 32-year-old woman with insufficient capital who lives in the rural area of Phnom Penh city. Un K. produces and sells types of desserts to her villagers or other people who cross the street. Un K.’s husband, who is a motorbike taxi driver, also contributes to the family income. Un K.’s husband wants to replace his existing taxi because it is so small that it can only carry a few passengers and he cannot make much income. Because of that, Un K. would like to ask for a loan to allow her husband to buy a new taxi that is larger than the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new taxi

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn S., age 32, is a rice farmer. She has three children. Her eldest child is 8 years old and is currently in the elementary grades. She dreams of a very stable business and income to support their needs. She also dreams that, some day, her children will  be able to graduate from college and get better jobs. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her rice crop.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
La señora María Andrea S. es casada con el señor José de Jesús R., y son una familia joven pero muy trabajadora ella labora para una escuela privada como asistente educativa y el trabaja para una escuela del gobierno como profesor de educación artística y cuenta con un trabajo adicional para un Instituto privado.
Ellos anteriormente ya habían solicitado 2 créditos para la construcción de una recamara amplia créditos que fueron pagados siempre con puntualidad y este seria el tercer crédito para iniciar la construcción de un nuevo cuarto, para tener mayor espacio en su hogar y para que su familia este mas cómoda.
texts.en:
María Andrea S. is married to José de Jesús R.. They are a young but very hard-working family; she works as a teaching assistant at a private school and he is an art teacher at a public school; he also has a second job at a private institute. They have received two prior loans to build a large bedroom; they repaid them both on time. This would be their third loan, which will be used to add a new room, so that the family will have more space and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo F. R. es un señor de 44 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura mayormente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 

Don Ubaldo se dedica a la producción de leche desde hace aproximadamente 3 años  y en estos momentos desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢600.000(seiscientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar a su familia adelante y brindarles todo lo necesario  tiene que esforzarse en producir más ya que la producción de leche es la que le genera mayores  ingresos a su familia.

Don Ubaldo es socio de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ubaldo F. R. is a 44-year-old gentleman that lives with his wife and 4 children in a community called San Ramón de SantaTeresita de Turrialba, Province of Carttago. It is a small rural community. Its settlers are dedicated to the production of milk, agriculture especially of coffee and bananas and also the raising of hogs. It has an irregular terrain and a lot of the land is preserved as a humid tropical forest. Don Ubaldo has been dedicated to the production of milk for approximately 3 years and at this time desires to obtain a micro-loan of 600,000 colones (six hundred thousand Costa Rican currency) to buy another dairy cow and thus to enlarge his production. He knows that to add one more cow is a greater sacrifice and will demand more work, but he says that, if he wants his family to get ahead and to offer them all that is needed, he has to be hard-working in producing more, since the production of milk is the thing that generates greater income for his family. Don Ubaldo is an associate of the Association of Agricultural Producers of Ramón , one of the 100 associate organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and with it he expects to continue growing on an economic and personal level, besides participating actively in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy another milk cow

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita J. is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in Nabantu-an 1, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating an auto repair shop.

Elenita’s husband, Elmer, is also 51.  He manages a junk shop business.  Together they have 4 children aged between 10 and 23.  Three of the children go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.  The oldest is currently working.

Elenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by operating the auto repair business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Elenita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used to fund operations of her auto repair shop business. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 20th loan of Php 17,000, which she intends to use on the junk shop business. Elenita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen M. C., tiene la edad de 35 años, está casada, y vive con el esposo  y sus 3 hijos. Ellos tienen 17,11 y 7 años.El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una maquina de coser y materiales para la confección de prendas de vestir. Desea aumentar su capacidad para fabricar la ropa de vestir. Tiene bastante tiempo y experiencia en la costura y cuenta con una máquina y local adecuado para realizar su trabajo. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Carmen M. C., 35, is married and lives with her husband and three children. They are 17, 11 and 7 years old. She wants funding to buy a sewing machine and dressmaking supplies. She wants to increase her production capabilities for making articles of clothing. She has been a seamstress for quite some time and she has both the experience and the proper space to do her work. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the loan terms offered. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future as well as to continue developing as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana, de 38 años, vive con Julio (42), ellos tuvieron 5 hijos pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos, pues el resto se ha independizado.Junto a su esposo, se dedica a cultivar café, achiote, palta y maíz (productos naturales de la selva peruana) en sus terrenos que son propios, esta actividad  la  realiza desde hace varios años, con mucha dedicación. Lo que más le gusta es el macheteado de las malezas, ya que no le agrada  ver sucios y descuidados sus terrenos, mensualmente fumiga y abona sus plantaciones para evitar que las plagas las contaminen. Este oficio le ha permitido construir su casa, comprar varias hectáreas de terrenos productivos, además de  cubrir la educación de sus hijos. En el futuro tiene proyectado plantar mayor cantidad de café, también guarda la esperanza de contar con otro capital de trabajo que le permitirá producir y comercializar más productos oriundos de su zona.Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le permitirá seguir trabajando.El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el acopio de café que pronto iniciará, para lo cuál necesita mil quinientos nuevos soles. De esta manera  espera seguir progresando para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 38 years old and lives with Julio who is 42. They have 5 children and live with 3 of them; the rest have become independent. She and her husband cultivate coffee, anatta, alligator-pears and corn (natural products of the Peruvian rain forest) on her own lands. She has done this for many years with much dedication. What she likes most is cutting back the growth of weeds, since it doesn't agree with her to see her terrain in a disordered state. Monthly, she spreads manure and fumigates her fields to avoid disease infestations. This work has permitted her to build a house, to buy various hectares of productive land, and in addition, to pay for the education of her children. In the future, she plans to plant more coffee and, also, hopes to acquire the working capital that will permit her to produce and sell more products native to her zone. This is Emiliana's 2nd loan with MFP and she is very grateful for all the people who have made possible the loan that will keep her working. The money she requests will be invested in the harvesting of coffee, which begins soon. She will need 1,500 New Sols for that. She hopes to continue progressing in this manner, offering her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVING THE PRODUCTION OF HER CROPS AND HARVESTING COFFEE

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Norma M. vende verduras en el Mercado Mayoreo todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana destacándose como una dama muy trabajadora que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su negocio en su localidad.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de algunas verduras como tamarindo, ayote, yuca, quequisque y otros. Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado para a lo inmediato comprar dichos productos para beneficio de ella y su negocio.
texts.en:
Every day, starting very early in the morning, Norma M. sells vegetables in the Mayoreo Market. She is known as a hardworking woman who is always dedicated to the success of her business. Currently, she is seeking a loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of vegetables, such as tamarind, squash, cassava (yuca), yautia and others. She hopes that the loan would be granted so that she could quickly purchase the aforementioned products in order to improve her business and her livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia B., 46, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Manuel B., a watch technician, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her variety store while also selling halo-halo (native Filipino dessert, made up of shaved ice, sweetened milk, a variety of sweet beans, shredded coconut, palm nuts, topped with sweetened jackfruit and caramel flan) peanut butter and charcoal. Her main customers are her neighbors who still are using the old ways of cooking.

Ofelia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her peanut butter. She also will invest some of the loan into her other businesses as additional capital to maintain operations of her store and her halo-halo stall.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be a stable source of income for her and her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying raw ingredients needed to produce peanut butter, etc.

loans.name: Epimaque

texts.en:
Epimaque is 40 years old and is married with four children who are 2, 4, 6 and 11 years old. He is a self-employed businessman in the business of selling clothes, mainly jeans trousers. He has been in this business for about eight years and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., every day except Sunday.

Epimaque is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing different styles of jeans as well as shirts. With the use of this loan, he hopes that his profits will increase. These additional profits will be used in paying school fees for his children and in renovating his house.

loans.use: To purchase different styles of jeans as well as shirts

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia A. buys bags of onions to sell at Takoradi. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader. She has received junior high education.

Emelia has been selling onions in small and large quantities for about two years now and supports her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of onions to be able to supply her customers.

Emelia hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children's education.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of onions to be able to supply her customers

loans.name: Zeburiatu

texts.en: Zeburiatu Y. buys fresh fish from the fishermen at sea to fry for sell at Abura. She is a married woman who has not received any form of education. Her husband is a carpenter. Zeburiatu uses her income to help  her husband take care of the family. She will use this loan to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. Zeburiatu plans to invest the new profits from her expanded business into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Rosita Sinodevilla's Group

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old, married, and has four adult children. Rosita is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosita S.’s Group. 

To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $45 a month from this activity.
 
In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (20201060042) is a 38-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  B. owns and operates a butcher shop. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling pork in the local community. B. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3.600.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to expand her business. B. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to renovate her business. The loan will be the 3rd loan she has taken from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


B. Nguyễn Thị (20201060042) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, B. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  B. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  B. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To renovate business

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 23 years old and single. He is a farmer from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for the last year and sells his bananas to the local market. His biggest challenges in this business have been lack of fertilizers and insufficient water supply.

Amos has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 46,800KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his income will increase through the sale of milk and this will enable him to expand his business.

In future, he plans to construct a better grazing shed and purchase two more dairy cows and employ one farm-hand. He is grateful to Juhudi for giving loans to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: God Blessing #2 Group

texts.en:
Tamey Q., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Blessing #2. Tamey is 34 years old, single, and has three children who range from 6 to 18 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to a lack of financial support. She cares for two siblings.

For 6 years, she has been operating a tailoring shop in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 34,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cloth.

She describes herself as a quiet person.

Her goal is to improve her business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, William F. is inset because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora Maria tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Esta actividad inicio con la idea de sufragar los gastos del hogar, para ella esto es muy importante Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad comprar frutas, hielo, bolsas, pajillas y azúcar esto debido a que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Ella desea tener un negocio muchos más grandes.
texts.en:
Dora Maria is 30 years old and sells soft drinks for a living. She has had this business for more than 3 years and has worked very hard and carefully to to keep it running. Her business activity started with the idea of wanting to meet household costs, as this is very important for her. She is requesting a loan which will enable her to buy fruit, ice, bags, drinking straws and sugar, since she doesn't have enough money to buy these things herself. It is very important to make these purchases because this business allows her to cover all her living costs. She wants to have a much bigger business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Carmita Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora Carmita Maricela Z. es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por la cultura que encierra cada rincón de su centro histórico, es cuna de grandes atletas y escritores, cuenta con una gran variedad de platos típicos y es la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador.

Este es el tercer año que nuestra socia realiza los créditos en la fundación junto al banco comunal. Se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos de Avon, Yanbal y  L´bel, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a viernes desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. y los sábados se dedica a la venta de frutas actividad que la realiza hace 7 años.

Doña Carmita tiene 28 años,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja en una fabrica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas para tener una gran variedad de la misma.

Su mayor sueño es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmita Maricela Z. is a member of the San Pablo Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the culture that envelops each corner of its historical center. It is the cradle of great athletes and writers, and it has a great variety of typical dishes. It is the third most important city in Ecuador. This is the third year that she has had loans with the Fundación together with her communal bank. She sells clothes and Avon, Yanbal, and L´bel cosmetics. She does this Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. On Saturdays she sells fruit, which she has been doing for seven years. Carmita, age 28, is married and has three children. The children are nine, seven, and four years old. The first two go to school in the city. Her husband works in a factory. They do not have their own house; they rent where they live. The new loan is to buy fruit in order to have a greater variety. Her biggest dream is to come to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy papayas, pineapples, bananas, cantaloupes, and watermelons, etc.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mrs. Khiev S. is a married woman who lives in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Tha Ouch, is a duck breeder who earns some money from selling ducks eggs to support his family. Her problem is that her family does not have a motorcycle to support business transportation. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Khiev S. is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is a cloth seller, another one is helping in the father’s duck breeding, two are students, and the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El señor Alcides R. es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycui específicamente del barrio San Francisco de ésta ciudad, está casado hace 7 años con  Gladys Olmedo Gimenez con quien tiene un hijo.
         El señor Alcides empezó vendiendo en su local tarjetas para teléfonos celulares, luego viendo la necesidad que tenían sus clientes de hablar a sus parientes, amigos o a cualquier otra persona que se encontraban en cualquier punto del país, montó una cabina telefónica el cual le resulto muy bien.
              Hace poco montó también un cyber, el cual le resulto muy beneficioso ya que cuenta con muchísimos clientes, los cuales que en ocasiones ya se quedaban sin poder usar una maquina ya que estaban todas ocupadas.
         En busca de ampliar su negocio y en consecuencia sus ganancias se acercó a nuestra oficina con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar más computadoras. Agradece a la Fundación el crédito otorgado ya que con eso pudo ampliar su negocio y comprar más máquinas.
texts.en:
Alcides R. is a native of the city of Ybycui, and specifically from the San Francisco neighborhood.  He's been married for seven years to Gladys Olmedo Gimenez, with whom he has one son.

Alcides began selling telephone cards for cell phones.  Later, seeing his clients' need to speak with their relatives, friends and others throughout the country, he installed a telephone booth, which has been very successful.  He also recently set up internet access, which is very popular and attracts many clients.  Occasionally, there are more customers than there are machines.

Looking to expand his business and thereby his earnings, Alcides came to our office requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more computers.  He extends thanks to the Foundation for the authorized loan with which he will be able to expand his business and buy more machines.

loans.use: Purchase of computers.

loans.name: Paul Kiprop

texts.en:
Paul Kiprop N. is 45 years old and married to Jane Kurgat, a housewife. They have three children aged 2, 5 and 8. They live in Nyeny-Kwen, Eldoret, Kenya. Paul operates a dairy farm and has been in this business for ten years. He earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES.
Paul learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through marketing awareness done in the area. He is applying for his third loan, of 35,000 KES, from KADET, which he intends to use to buy two dairy cows. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy a motorbike for another business.
In the future, Paul wishes to have a pick-up to transport animal feed. His deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Tô

texts.en: Vụ Tô Thị is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vụ owns and operates a business primarily raising chickens for sale. Vụ has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, Vụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Vụ is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. Vụ plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213050027. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== Vụ Tô Thị (20213050027) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, Vụ Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. Vụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Vụ kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, Vụ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Vụ đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Vụ dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hurtoji's Group

texts.en:
Hurtoji Z. is a resident of Aravan. She is the leader of this group. Hurtoji is a 67-year old widow. She has raised three sons and all of them are working in Russia. In order to make money, Hurtoji has been breeding cattle for 30 years. Reselling some cattle after fattening, she makes 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding.  In the future, she wants to increase the number of cattle, provide her grandchild a good education and be able to support him financially.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make a bakery in her house and support her husband

loans.name: Viridiana

texts.es:
La señora Viridiana O. Tello, es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, muy conocido por sus aguas termales. Doña Viri como es conocida por sus amistades tiene 23 años de edad, estudio hasta el primer año de preparatoria por que se casó y ya no pudo seguir estudiando por que se embarazo, ella se dedica a la venta de bisutería en plata y pedrería, ella lleva con este negocio mas de 2 años, ella surte sus accesorios en Zitacuaro y en Tuxpan Michoacán ya que le dan buen precio, ella empezó con este tipo de negocio ya que le gusta la decoración y le gusta armar y hacer sus propios diseños y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende su bisutería con las maestras de la escuela y con sus conocidas, con gente que sea segura de pagar como dice ella. 
Doña Viri quiere un préstamo para comprar los materiales necesarios para la bisutería, piedrería, plata fina, swarovskies,etc.
La Señora Viridiana esta casada con el señor Miguel el cual es Taxista, ellos tienen dos hijos de nombres Guadalupe de 4 años de edad y Andrea de 3 años las cuales estudian el jardín de niños. La meta que tiene para su negocio es tener mas clientes y mas adelante poner un negocio de bisutería fina y también invertir en zapatos por catalogo, ropa para dama y niños.
texts.en:
Viridiana O. Tello is from San Jose Purua, located in the state of Michoacan, well known for its hot springs. Viri (how friends call her) is 23, went to first year of high school, got married and was not able to continue her studies because she got pregnant, she sells silver and stone jewelry, has done this for more than two years, she buys them in Zitacuaro and Tuxpan, Michoacan, she is given good prices there.  She started this business because she likes to decorate, create and make her own designs, also because she could help her husband with the home expenses.  She sells jewelry to the school teachers and acquaintances,  and to people that she considers will pay for sure.

Viri wants a loan to buy the necessary materials for jewelry, such as stones, fine silver, swarovskies, etc.  Viridiana is married to Miguel, a taxi driver, they have two children named Guadalupe, 4 and Andrea, 3, they go to preschool.  The goal for her business is to have more clients and later on open a store and also invest in catalog sold shoes, kids and women clothing.

loans.use: Buy fine silver jewelry and stone jewelry

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad L. is from Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Trinidad owns & operates a transportation services business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be Trinidad’s eleventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
El señor, José María D. R. trabaja como fontanero en una empresa aguadora desde 2 años. Vive en la ciudad de Managua Carretera vieja a León comunidad los cedros.

Es soltero de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 personas a su cargo dos de ellas son menores en edad escolar

Agradece a CEPRODEL, ya que le permite con este préstamo comprar los materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlínes, piedra cantera que tanto lo necesita para invertir en la mejora de su casa ya que después viene el invierno y no podrá construir. Este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL y espera pagar en tiempo y forma para poder seguir siendo cliente.
texts.en:
Señor, José María D. R. has worked as a plumber in a water company for 2 years.  He lives in the city of Managua on the old road to León, community of the cedars.  

He is a single 43-year-old who has 3 people in his care, two of whom are of school age.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL, since with this loan they permit him to buy building materials such as cement, iron, perlínes (roof supports), and quarry stone that he needs so much to invest in the improvement of his house since winter is coming and he will not be able to build then.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL and he expects to repay on time in order to continue as a client.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Shaymaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. 

Shaymaa has been a seamstress for a long time. In 2008, she opened her own sewing business for women and baby clothes. She is well known in her local area and has an excellent reputation.

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a sewing machine and a generator. She is planning to expand her business and open her own sewing factory in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and a generator

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak L. resides with her family in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. L. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband  is a play instructor, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 83 on food and USD 85 on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase an generator to light the stage when her husband has a show. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a L. standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Antolin

texts.en:
Antolin L., from the village of Balide, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur, is 36 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Antolin owns and operates a business venture providing tricycle transport services. Engaged in his business for over 11 years, he earns approximately 5360 PHP a month.

In 2007, Antolin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service, he is now requesting his seventh loan of 40000 PHP to purchase tires and other accessories. Antolin plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 35 years old, married and has two children. He is able to support his family with the income he earns from selling groundnuts. He also runs a retail shop. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business, which has enabled him to improve his standard of living. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES. He will use the loan to buy two sacks of groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of groundnuts

loans.name: María Uvaldina

texts.es:
La Señora María V. es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la comunidad de San Francisco que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas muy trabajadoras y siempre están en la lucha para sacar  adelante a sus familias.
 
Doña María tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 22, 21, 15, 12, y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas e independientes, su tercera hija estudia en el colegio y también trabaja para ayudar a la economía del hogar, su cuarta hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su penúltimo hijo esta en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de chanchos, esta actividad que la realiza hace 12 años. En sus tiempos libres también se dedica a lavar ropa ajena, arregla casas y a  tejer sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos.
 
Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
María V. is a member of "El Cisne" (The Swan) community bank.  She lives in San Francisco community, which is located in El Valle parish.  This is a cold climate parish whose people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.  They are very hard-working people who are always striving to get their families ahead in life.

María is 46 years old, married, and has six children aged 24, 22, 21, 15, 12 and 5.  Her two eldest daughters are married and live independently.  Her third daughter is in high school and also works to help with their household expenses.  Her fourth daughter is in high school.  Her penultimate child (a son) attends a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker and, through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

María's business is selling pigs.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  In her spare time she also washes other people's clothes, cleans houses and weaves Panama hats.

This is María's fifth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying pigs.

María's goal is to extend her home.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María, reside en San Miguel, tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas, ella está viviendo con su esposo y un hijo de 11 años de edad, su trabajo es elaborar tortillas, tiene una persona que le ayuda a prepararlas, trabaja de 10:00am a 2:00pm, también vende pupusas estas las prepara de 5:00pm a 8:00pm.
Por el momento necesita comprar maíz en cantidad abundante, pues debido al alto costo que tiene en el mercado, ella quiere comprar y almacenarlo en su vivienda, por esta situación solicita un préstamo que cubra este gasto y que le ayude a tener en su casa una buena cantidad de maíz.
Su aspiración es administrar dos negocios de pupusas, dar trabajo a más mujeres, que como ella, se esfuerzan cada día por llevar el sustento diario a sus hogares.
texts.en:
Maria resides in San Miguel, is 35 years old, and sells 'pupusas' (a popular Salvadoran snack) and tortillas. She lives with her husband and a son, aged 11. Her work is to make tortillas. She has a person who helps her to prepare them. Maria labors from  10:00 am until 2:00 pm making tortillas, then from 5:00 until 8:00 pm, she sells 'pupusas'.

At present, she needs to buy corn in an abundant quantity. Due to the current high market price, she wants to buy corn and store it in her home. Due to the current situation, Maria is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a good quantity of corn for storage.

Her ambition is to administer 2 businesses selling 'pupusas', providing work for 2 women, who like her, struggle every day to provide daily sustenance in their homes.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas and 'pupusas'.

loans.name: Jhanet

texts.es: Jhanet tiene 19  años, vive con sus padres en la propiedad que tienen. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a elaborar bordados típicos de su zona, trabaja todos los días en su misma casa en donde tiene su taller, ahí diseña y elabora las prendas que luego terminadas los lleva a vender en las ferias comerciales de su localidad. Es así que los fines de semana vende en cantidad, asimismo ofrece de manera particular a los negociantes que tiene sus puestos. Al final lo ganado lo invierte nuevamente en la compra de materiales como hilos para continuar con la elaboración de más prendas. Ahora se ha propuesto duplicar su producción,  para lo cual seguirá esforzándose. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, para ella es una buena experiencia que ha tenido de trabajar de manera grupal y en esta ocasión se compromete a seguir trabajando por la unidad de su equipo  y ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de telas al por mayor que le permitirán  tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Jhanet is 19 years old and lives with her parents in their home.  For more than two years she has been making embroidered items which are traditional to her area.  She works every day at home where her workshop is located.  There she designs and makes the items which, once they are finished, she takes to sell in street markets in her town.  On weekends she sells a lot of her products and also sells privately to traders who have sales stalls.  Afterwards, she re-invests what she has earned in buying materials such as threads so that she can continue making more items.  Jhanet has decided to double her production and will continue working hard to achieve this.

This is Jhanet's second loan from MFP.  It has been good experience for her to work as part of a group and she pledges to continue working for the unity of her team and to be punctual in making her repayments.  She will invest her loan in buying fabric wholesale which will allow her to achieve a better production.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 30 years old, married to George, and they have three children, aged eleven, seven, and five.

She operates a retail shop in the Nairobi city center.  She has been in this business for the last twelve years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.10,000.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to add more stock, like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and other food items and grow the business substantially.  Her future dreams are to open a supermarket and give her family a decent life.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, rice and other food items.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Rosario

texts.es: Vicenta is a 60 year-old married mother of one child.  Over fifteen years ago when her husband was out of work, Vicenta went door-to-door selling fish and other seafood.  As her business as grown over the years, she has been able to buy her own boat and motor.  Vicenta is very proud of how her hard work has helped maintain her family, and her hope is to continue to do be able to do so.  The loan will be used to buy additional shrimp, lobsters, and other seafood to help maintain and grow her business.
texts.en: Vicenta is a 60 year-old married mother of one child.  Over fifteen years ago when her husband was out of work, Vicenta went door-to-door selling fish and other seafood.  As her business as grown over the years, she has been able to buy her own boat and motor.  Vicenta is very proud of how her hard work has helped maintain her family, and her hope is to continue to do be able to do so.  The loan will be used to buy additional shrimp, lobsters, and other seafood to help maintain and grow her business.

loans.use: buy additional shrimp, lobsters, and other seafood to help maintain and grow her business

loans.name: Jhony Santos

texts.es:
Jhony de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en la casa de sus suegros, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Reque que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona donde tienen como actividad la agricultura y ganadería.

Jhony brinda el servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de bicicletas y motos, desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene en un local donde hay afluencia de clientes, cuenta con su propia clientela.  Para poder ampliar su negocio a creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa de 1300 para comprar herramientas y algunos repuestos para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, al aumentar sus ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El deseo de Jhony es tener un loca propio y un negocio más grande para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y darles otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhony de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en la casa de sus suegros, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Reque que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona donde tienen como actividad la agricultura y ganadería.

Jhony brinda el servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de bicicletas y motos, desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene en un local donde hay afluencia de clientes, cuenta con su propia clientela.  Para poder ampliar su negocio a creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa de 1300 para comprar herramientas y algunos repuestos para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, al aumentar sus ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El deseo de Jhony es tener un loca propio y un negocio más grande para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y darles otras oportunidades a sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de herramientas y repuestos para implementar su negocio

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing, 26 years old, is a construction worker. His wife is working in a massage shop. Their income is $10 per day. He has 3 children, one is studying and the rest are too small to be in school. 

Every month, he spends around $63 for family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a boat engine to do fishing, besides working as a construction worker. Because his current work can’t make a good enough profit, he decided to ask his wife to sell fish and groceries at the market so they could save more money. For his children, he has to send them to school, at least to finish high school.

loans.use: to by a boat engine to do fishing.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with five children who attend school. Oliva is visionary and hardworking. For the last seven years, she has worked as a tailor to provide for her family’s upkeep. 

Oliva is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a sewing machine. She has repaid a previous loan of 15,000 KES. She hopes to expand her business into a larger shop within the next five years. Along with expanding her business, Oliva’s dream is also to own a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Crecyl Jane

texts.en:
Crecyl Jane is a 23-year-old woman who is married and living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two children to care for. She is engaged in a service-based activity. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for two years of doing it. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase pedi-cab spare parts to cover the cost of repainting. Crecyl Jane has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She plans to buy one more pedi-cab for hire to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase pedi-cab spare parts and to cover repainting costs.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
La Señorita Rosa es socia del banco comunal La Florida, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, también tiene varios lugares para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de sus visitante, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señorita Rosa tiene 18 años de edad y vive con sus padres, el papá se dedica a la construcción y su mamá a la agricultura, la casa en la que habita es de propiedad de sus padres.
 
Nuestra socia trabaja en una plantación de flores, trabaja de lunes a sábados de 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la agricultura que es para su consumo y  también cría son vacas, borregos y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá, el crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de ganado y borregos.
 
Su meta es construir su casa propia.
texts.en: Rosa is a member of the communal bank of La Florida, and lives near Cuenca, a historic city known for its beauty, rich cuisine, cultural activities and traditions.   Rosa is 18 and lives at home with her parents.  Her father works in construction and her mother is a farmer.  She works on a flower plantation, working full time, 6 days a week, from 7 AM to 3 PM.  At home, she grows garden crops and also raises cows, sheep and cuyes to help her meet expenses.  This is her first credit and was invited to participate by her mother.  Rosa plans to buy cows and sheep.  In the future, she hopes to construct her own house.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep

loans.name: Sanda

texts.pt:
Nasceu  na cidade de Maputo,  provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira  e  mãe  de 3 filhos  dos  quais  todos  frequentam  a  escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou porque foi ao lar cedo e nunca mais teve oportunidade de retomar os estudos. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ambulante ha mais de 6 anos e dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( amendoim, arroz, caldo,oleo, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para mesma actividade.
Pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial, construindo um estabelecimento onde possa expor os seus produtos, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
S. was born in Maputo, a city in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has three children; two of them go to school. S. finished seventh grade and quit school because she started her own household early and never had the opportunity to go back to her studies. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never left her hometown. For more than six years S. has been a street vendor selling a variety of products, and she earns about 5,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is S.'s second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy products (peanuts, rice, broth, oil and other items) to increase her inventory. The first loan was for 10,000 meticais and was used for the same purpose.

She intends to expand her business by building a store where she can display her products, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Evelyn has sustained her business activities throughout the 18 loans she has requested and repaid from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Khuderbat

texts.en:
Khuderbat, 34, makes Mongolian traditional shoes by hand, and he lives with his wife and his son in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 14 years, he has been making shoes and has gained a lot of experience in it. He sells his hand-made shoes wholesale to sellers at a bazaar called Narantuul, an international market, and they sell to the clients. Clients always feel satisfaction to buy his shoes.
  
Now he is planning to expand his business, but first he must renovate his shoe-craft tools and equipment. Also, he needs to purchase the raw materials such as leather for making shoes. This will enable him to increase his earning further and improve his family's living conditions.

He took a loan once before and repaid it successfully on time.

loans.use: To renovate his shoe-craft tools and equipment and purchase the raw materials for shoemaking.

loans.name: Miriam De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 50 años de edad Miriam es una emprendedora que comenzó su negocio con la ilusión de salir adelante y mejorar su situación económica, inicialmente vendía ropa a sus amigos y allegados y poco a poco fue mejorando las ventas, y sus clientes fueron aumentando, actualmente Miriam tiene un almacén donde trabaja día a día con tenacidad y esmero para que éste progrese constantemente.

Con su propósito de progresar, hoy en día quiere comprar un surtido mayor de ropa y zapatos tanto para dama como para caballero, pero Miriam no cuenta con el capital para comprar esta mercancía, por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual hacer estas compras, mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente las utilidades, así su calidad de vida mejorará y sus sueños poco a poco se irán cumpliendo.
texts.en:
At the age of 50, Miriam is an entrepreneur who started out her business with the dream of moving forward and improving her financial situation. She started out selling clothing to her family acquaintances. Gradually her sales improved and her clients increased. Currently Miriam has a store where she works day after day with tenacity and care for its continual progress.

With her goal of progressing, today she wants to purchase a variety of clothing and shoes for both ladies and gentlemen. But Miriam does not have the capital to purchase this merchandise. She requests a loan with which she will make these purchases. It will improve her sales and consequently, her profits and her quality of life. Her dreams with gradually become a reality.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to add variety to her supply.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs. Maricel has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Jocelyn has a stall that sells vegetables, like tomatoes. She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8000 to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits to sell.  Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Jocelyn  hopes to improve her business as well as her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more of her products, like fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall behind his house to protect his property

loans.name: Qui

texts.en:
Qui is 43 years old. Her husband earns an income by selling ducks and chickens. They have two sons and one daughter. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Qui has been running a general store since 2001. She operates the business at home and sells rice, eggs, instant foods and spices. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food and products to stock her store and sell to her customers.

She hopes that will help her to get a higher income and give her opportunities to improve her living conditions and better provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy more food and spices to stock her general store.

loans.name: Linketto Samba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Linketto Samba est à  son cinquième cycle, il est composé 44 femmes qui s’activent dans le petit commerce : vente d’arachide, d’huile de palm et divers produits du terroir.

Madame Diadia  (debout à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, mariée  et mère de six enfants, elle prend en charge six autres membres de sa famille.

Elle est  vendeuse de l’huile de palme et de savon traditionnel dans son village et aux villages environnants à l’occasion des marchés hebdomadaires. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de l’huile palme et du savon pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’apporter un soutien à son mari sur la prise en charge sanitaire des enfants et leur scolarisation.
texts.en:
The Linketto Samba group is in its fifth loan cycle and is made up of 44 women who occupy themselves with small businesses, selling groundnuts, palm oil and various local goods.

Mrs. Diadia (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of six children. She cares for six other members of her family.

Mrs. Diadia sells palm oil and traditional soap in her village and in nearby villages during their weekly markets. Her new loan will allow her to purchase palm oil and soap for resale. The profits will allow her to help support her husband in providing for the medical care of children and their education.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and soap for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village of Atskvita in the southern part of the country. He is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife Tiniko and his 75-year-old father. David runs the family's agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where they grow potatoes and raise milk cows for producing cheese. The potatoes and cheese are sold in a grocery store Tiniko runs. She purchases grocery products in nearby towns at wholesale prices and sells them in the family's store in their village. The family's total average monthly income is 700 laris, including David’s father's monthly pension.

David has requested a loan to increase the store's stocks. A larger variety of products will attract additional clients to the store, and sales will increase, therefore increasing the family's income. David and Tiniko plan to use the additional revenue to renovate their house, which is old and in bad condition.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Magdalena; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos y cereales como quinua, trigo, maíz y cebada, ella vende al por mayor llevando a lugares como Urubamba y lo reparte en el mercado, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos secos y cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar trigo, cebada, maíz y quinua al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Maria Magdalena. She is 45 years old, lives with a partner and has 3 children. The member alternates her daily activities with her business selling dry goods and cereals such as quinoa, wheat, corn and barley. She sells wholesale travelling to places such as Urubamba and she distributes the products in the market. By means of this business the member takes care of her children. The member's dream is to have a store where she can sell her dry goods and cereals. The member is asking for the loan to bulk buy wheat, barley and quinoa.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to make the repayments.

loans.use: to bulk buy wheat, corn, barley and quinoa.

loans.name: Ruzi

texts.ru: Рузи целеустремленный и честный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Рузи занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и откармливанием крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он является владельцем бизнеса и начинал бизнес 5 лет назад. Раньше он занимался купле продажей мелкого рогатого скота, а потом постепенно начинал выращивать сельхозпродукты. Рузи запрашивает займ для покупки мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Ruzi is a goal-oriented and honest person.  He is married and is a responsible father of four children.  Ruzi is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle and small livestock.  He is the owner of this business, which he started five years ago.  Previously, he was involved in buying and selling small livestock and then gradually started to grow agricultural crops.  Ruzi is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock and cattle.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and small livestock

loans.name: Georgina Mercedez

texts.es:
Georgina Mercedez es casada, tienen 40 años de edad, cursó el tercer años de educación, tiene 6 hijos 4  de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de perfumes, cremas, lociones, pinturas faciales,shampoo, etc, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un crédito que lo utiliza para la compra de mas mercadería y mejorar sus venta y ganancias. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Georgina Mercedez is married, 40 years old, and has a third grade education.  She has 6 children, 4 of whom are studying in school.  She has a business selling perfumes, creams, lotions, face paint, shampoo, etc.  She has 10 years of experience, and she relies on the support of her husband, who works as a bricklayer.
