She requests a loan so that she can purchase more merchandise and improve her sales and earnings.  In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (cosmetics)

loans.name: Luisa Morena

texts.es:
Luisa, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lociones por catalogo, ella vive en una casa alquilada, con su hija, el negocio de Luisa nació por la necesidad de tener ingresos, ya que tiene la obligación del hogar, inicio con la empresa Avon, pero hoy en día distribuye de otros proveedores adicionales.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un pedido de cosméticos, hará el pedido a las empresas para poder revenderlo con los clientes, los productos que desea obtener son maquillajes, labiales, lociones y cremas.
Espera que con este aporte su negocio sea mejor, el sueño de ella es mejorar cada día para tener mayor estabilidad con su hija
texts.en:
Luisa has a business selling cosmetics and lotions through a catalog.  She lives in a rented home with her daughter.  Luisa started this business because she needed an income, given that she must cover the expenses for her household.  She started out selling Avon products, but now she is distributing products from other suppliers as well.

She is requesting a loan now to make a purchase for an order of cosmetics.  She will make an order from the companies for products that she will then re-sell to her customers.  The products that she wants to buy are: makeup, lipstick, lotions and creams.

She hopes that with this loan, her business will improve.  Luisa's dream is to improve every day so that she can have greater financial stability for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy makeup, lipstick, lotions and creams.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 41 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 2 years, her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Nasreen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Nasreen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his general store business

loans.name: Eli Oved Zepeda

texts.en: My line of business is selling shoes of all types, for women, men, and children.  I have a shop in the San Juan de Siguatepeque market.  My wife runs the shop.  We have been in business for three years. Right now, we need to invest in school shoes for children because we have begun the new school year and we have lots of clients asking for the shoes. Otherwise, our family also has a taxi that I drive.  With both of the businesses, both my wife and I provide for our family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory, particularly school shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy shares in the stock market.

loans.name: Sok Sa

texts.en: Sok Sa R. is 51 years old and is married with 4 children.  Three of her daughters work in a garment factory and together make $150 per month. Her fourth daughter is a student, and helps her mother sew clothes when she is not at school.  Sok Sa R. will use this loan to buy a washing machine so that she can provide cleaning services to her customers.  She also plans to buy a motorbike for her children to drive so that she can spend more time at work.  In the future, she hopes to repair her house once she has saved enough money.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine and a motorbike so her children can drive themselves to work

loans.name: Penah

texts.en: Penah H. is a glass worker in the town of Kachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. This is the 3rd loan Penah has taken from Norwegian Microcredit which means that he has proven himself to be a reliable client. Penah is looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of glass which will allow him to take on more customers at one time.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of glass

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Business Description

Daisy had 20 years experience. She started working in houses, doing domestic chores. The death of her son and brother was her main reason for starting her own business. She received help from her family. She now works weekdays selling household items and weekends she sells lunches from her front door. She gets help from her children too.

Loan Use

She will invest this money in buying merchandise for her business in order to attract more customers. She will also buy some chickens to sell them by the pound.

Personal Information

Daisy is married. She has two grown-up kids. Her husband is a fisherman and spends his time traveling and returns home every 2 weeks. This is how they cover the household costs. Their house is made of sugar cane stalks; in the future they hope to start building it of cement.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Daisy tiene una experiencia de 20 años con su actividad. Se inicio trabajando en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. La muerte de su hijo y un hermano la motivo a salir adelante con un negocio propio. Recibió la ayuda de su familia. Actualmente trabaja todos los días de la semana vendiendo artículos de hogar. Y los fines de semana se dedican a vender meriendas en el portal de su domicilio. Recibe la ayuda de uno de sus hijos en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para su negocio. Adecuara su local para mejorar su atención. Además invertirá en compra de pollos para vender por libras.

Información Personal

Daisy es casada. Tiene 2 hijos mayores. Su esposo trabaja en la pesca. Pasa viajando y regresa cada 15 días al hogar. De esta manera ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de caña. Esperando a futuro poder comenzar su construcción de cemento.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and invest in her secondary business/Comprar mercaderia y invertir en su negocio secundario

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is a farmer, she produces cow milk and sell it to wholesalers in her community. She’s a single woman who lives in the community of Huayhuasi in the Río Abajo area, two hours away from the city of La Paz. She’ll use the loan to purchase a dairy cow of an improved breed to increase the production and rise her incomes. It’s the first credit with Impro and according to the evaluation she qualifys for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes es agricultora y productora de leche de vaca, la cual vende en su comunidad, a comercializadores mayoristas. Ella es soltera y vive en la Comunidad de Huayhuasi sector Rio Abajo ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche y así mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy C., aged 26, is a housewife.  Her husband works selling ice cream, earning $10-$15 in revenue per day before expenses.  They have one child who is too young to attend school yet.  She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to build a better house to keep her family and her husband’s inventory safe and dry in the rainy season.  She anticipates having no trouble paying back this loan in 18 months.

Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To build a stronger house to keep her family and her husband's inventory dry in the rainy season.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María is 45 years old, studied through the third year of secondary school, and has 5 children, with 3 still dependent on her. She lives in the district of Salaverry in the Province of Trujillo in the Department of La Libertad. Ana works selling food at her stand to people in her neighborhood, and to all the passers-by. She also sells pasteles and desserts. Previously, she delivered food and boarded workers from different factories. For 15 years, she worked in this business. She tells us that before becoming a member of the "Las Auroras en Accion" (Daybreak in Action) Communal Bank, she sold a smaller quantity, since she did not have much capital. Now she feels very satisfied, because the loans she has received have allowed her to grow and improve her business.

At her "Las Auroras en Acción” Communal Bank, she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this, she bought the products she uses to prepare the foods she sells at wholesale, such as: oil, potatoes, noodles, rice, and soft drinks.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, with a term of four months, she will buy chairs, dishes, knives, forks and spoons to provide better service and convenience to her customers.

Ana dreams of having a large restaurant in the center of Salaverry.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana María tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria; tiene 5 hijos y 3 aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Ana se dedica a la venta de comida en su kiosco a personas de su barrio y todos los transeúntes, pero además vende pasteles y postres, anteriormente repartía comida y daba pensión a algunos trabajadores de diferentes fábricas, hace 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Nos cuenta que antes de ser socia del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” vendía en menor cantidad ya que no tenía mucho capital, ahora se siente muy contenta porque los créditos que ha recibido le han permitido crecer y mejorar su negocio. En su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción” obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 soles, con ellos compró al por mayor los productos que utiliza para la preparación de los alimentos que vende como: aceite, papa, fideo, arroz y gaseosas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará sillas, platos, cucharas, tenedores y cuchillos para brindar mejor servicio y comodidad a sus clientes. La señora Ana sueña con tener un restaurante grande en el centro de Salaverry.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Graciela's Group

texts.en:
Graciela and Hilda have both been members of the community bank “Arco Iris II” for about a year. Graciela was invited to join the bank by a friend and Hilda was invited by her mother. Through the community bank's activities, they have learned to be responsible and punctual. They have also learned about self-esteem and working together.

Graciela is 43 years old and has six children ranging from 2 to 22 years old. She is an artisan weaver. She learned the art from her husband 15 years ago and now runs her own business.

Hilda is 24 and has one daughter. She is also a weaver and runs her business with her husband. In the past, she owned a grocery store but was not able to make a profit.

They need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in thread, dyes, and other supplies needed for weaving. The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving. Graciela and Hilda both say that they are saving for emergency purposes. They are very happy with their accounts in the community bank because it would be impossible to save money otherwise. They joined the community bank to try and give their children better lives and that is why they continue to fight. Their dream is for their children to progress in life and have jobs as professionals.

loans.use: to invest in thread, dyes, and other supplies needed for weaving

loans.name: Zuwena's Nyota Group

texts.en:
Zuwena H. is 38 years old, married with three children, ages 18, 7 and 5. Zuwena owns a food vending store that she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who also has a business vending food.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés is a strong and hard-working woman whose continued efforts, at sixty years of age, are impressive. She goes on seventeen years of tending a poultry stand. She had worked previously in a chicken farm but, upon separating from her husband who did not help with the support of their seven children, she decided to work in the market. In this manner, with the passage of nearly two decades, she has worked arduously at her business in order to feed and educate her children.

Currently, she continues to work to support herself and one seventeen year old daughter as all her other children are now grown and living independently.

Little by little, she would like to increase her merchandise as she has now started to also carry personal hygiene products and cleaning supplies. In the future, her plan is to build a location where she can open a store since the market where she is currently located is experiencing legal problems and she runs the risk of losing her place.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Inés es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, a sus sesenta años su trabajo es admirable. Ella lleva diecisiete años atendiendo en su puesto D. pollos. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una avícola pero a raíz D. que separó D. su esposo y en vista D. que él no la ayudaba con la manutención D. sus siete hijos decidió trabajar en el mercado. Es así que con el paso D. estas casi dos décadas ella ha venido trabajando arduamente en su puesto para poder tener que darles D. comer a sus hijos y también brindarles educación. Actualmente ella continúa trabajando para los gastos D. ella misma y D. su menor hija que tiene 17 años y que significa su compañía D. todos los días, pues los mayores ya se independizaron. Poco a poco ella quiere ir surtiendo su puesto D. otros productos, por ahora ya comenzó con algunos artículos D. higiene personal y artículos D. limpieza. En un futuro su plan es construir un local donD. abrir una bodega, ya que el mercado en el que trabaja tiene problemas legales y corre el riesgo D. un desalojo.

loans.use: Move business to another location.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a small business owner from the city Primorsk in southern Ukraine, near the Azov Sea. She has a little space at an outdoor market in Primorsk where she sells a selection of children’s outerwear. Mariya decided to sell children’s clothing after noticing a need for good quality clothing. This has proven to be a wise business decision and even now there are not many other vendors in her market that offer the same items. Mariya is married and has three children. She makes around $1000 in profit each month from her business.

Mariya has requested a short term loan to add to her working capital and help purchase new inventory to sell. Many market vendors such as Mariya are dealing with the effects of high inflation in Ukraine. They must sell more in order to make more. This loan will help Mariya continue to operate a stable, successful business that will provide for the needs of her and her family.

loans.use: Mariya would like to add working capital and purchase inventory for her children's clothing stall.

loans.name: Rigoberto José

texts.es:
Rigoberto López is 28 years old. He is a entrepreneur that owns a small, home-based convenience store that sells basic products. He is single and has two young daughters, ages 7 and 4. The convenience store is run by his mother and it has been owned for 5 years. His future plans include converting the convenience store into a small market and remodeling his house in order to turn it into a place where he could live with dignity. The loan requested will be used to purchase basic grains and cleaning products since he has small amounts of them left.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rigoberto López es un joven de 28 años, es un pequeño comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende productos básicos. Es soltero, tiene 2 pequeñas niñas de 7 y 4 años de edad. La pulpería de Rigoberto es administrada por su madre, tiene 5 años de tenerla, y sus planes futuros es llegar a convertirla en una miscelanea, al mismo tiempo que desea remodelar su casa para llegar a tener una casa digna. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar granos básicos y productos de limpieza ya que actualemnte cuenta con poca existencia de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and cleaning products.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida, the wife of S. A. lives Kasur, Pakistan. She is a housewife and helps her husband with his business, in which he manufactures washing powder and soaps. Her husband has been in this profession for the last 15 years and now, he has become an expert in it. He is well recognized in his neighborhood, as well as in other areas. His monthly income is $250 to $300.

Zubaida successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now, she is applying for a loan for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To expand her husband's soap business

loans.name: Qimsahon

texts.ru:
Qimsahon R. lives in the Rudaki region. She is married and has two children. She embroiders fabric. Rolls of fabric are brought to her for custom orders, and Qimsahon buys beads and thread. She embroiders flowers with beads. Now she wants to get a loan to buy beads and thread. This way she can ensure that she can continue working. She will be able to pay off the loan in 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Розикова Кимсанхон жительница района Рудаки. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается вышиванием ткани. Приносят на заказ рулоны ткани , а Кимсанхон покупает бисер и нитки. Вышивает цветы бисером. Сейчас она хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить бисер и нитки. Таким образом она обеспечит себе работу. Погасить кредит смолжет в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Material

loans.name: Asha's Maendeleo B Group

texts.en:
Asha is 51 years old. She is married with 9 children. She has been a fruit seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, cafe ownership, and food shop ownership.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more fruit for re-sale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Diana L.. She is a 25-year-old married woman with a five-year-old child. Diana also supports two other dependents who live with her because they are orphans and attend school in her neighborhood. She established a business selling cosmetics to local ladies in 2005 and currently earns a monthly profit of approximately US$ 120 from her store. Diana is requesting a loan of US$ 275 in order to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics in bulk. In the future she plans to expand her business further.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that contains three members. Mrs. Saret is group leader. Mrs. Saret R., 29, is grocery seller. Normally, she sells her groceries in crowded places. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver in Battambang town. With their incomes, Saret always manages her cash carefully. She cares for two children, both of whom are attending school. To increase her family's income by satisfying her customers' requests, she would like a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. In the future, she wants all of her children to graduate from university and get good jobs.

Mr. Chamruen S. is an ice-cream seller. She requested a loan of US$300 to purchase a second hand motorcycle to sell her ice-cream by transporting it to customers' homes.

Mrs. Sarom R. is a general products seller. She requested a loan of US$300 to purchase more of a variety of products to sell.

They are all people who are living in Svay Por Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more groceries

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia Traoré est agée de 43 ans mariée et mère de 7 enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec son mari, ses coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier Koulikoro de la préfecture de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune age elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce. C’est son mari qui lui a donné l’idée de se  spécialiser dans la l’achat vente des fruits et cela depuis 20 ans. 
Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement bien remboursés..  
Avec ce prêt Madame  Rokia Traoré compte acheter, 10 paniers de bananes,  30 sacs d’orange et autres fruits auprès des paysans producteurs de Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 70.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et aider son mari à subvenir aux  dépenses scolaires des enfants. Madame Rokia souhaite recevoir des formations sur la technique de conservation des fruits et légumes afin de mieux rentabiliser son entreprise.
texts.en:
Madame Rokia Traoré is 43 years old, married, and the mother of seven. She lives in a traditional extended family with her husband, her co-wives, and their children in the Koulikoro district of Koutiala Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). From an early age, she got interested in income-generating work, notably commerce. It was her husband who gave her the idea to specialize in buying and selling fruit, which she has been doing for twenty years.

Ms. Traoré is on her second individual loan after having correctly repaid four solidarity loans (group loans). With this loan, she intends to buy 10 baskets of bananas, 30 sacks of oranges, and other fruit from peasant producers of Sikasso. She makes her sales at the grand marketplace of Koutiala, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of women and men.

Her intention is to realize a profit of 70,000 francs CFA per month that she envisions using to cover the loan interest and to assist her husband with covering the costs of schooling the children. She wishes to receive information on the techniques of preserving fruits and vegetables in order to make her enterprise more profitable.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat  des fruits et légumes .

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos Yesica de 14, Damián de 12, Diego de 10 y Adriana de 6. Se dedica a la venta de celulares, los cuales adquiere en la ciudad de Juliaca y distribuye a sus clientes en al ciudad de Puno. Ella incursionó en este negocio hace 2 años, tratando de cubrir los gastos que requerían sus pequeños hijos, afortunadamente, el negocio es muy bueno y le arroja buenas ganancias, no encontrándole dificultades. Yudy quiere seguir creciendo y aumentar su stock en estas fiestas navideñas, cuando el consumo de estos productos aumenta. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma con lo cual se compromete a ser responsable con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Yudy is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their children: 14-year-old Yesica, 12-year-old Damian, 10-year-old Diego and 6-year-old Adriana. She sells cellular phones, which she acquires in the city of Juliaca and distributes to her customers in the city of Puno. She began this business two years ago to try to meet her children's needs, and fortunately, her business is doing well and her earnings are good. Yudy would like to continue growing and increase her stock for the holiday season, when cellular sales increase. She is seeking her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and promises to be responsible with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of cell phones for sale

loans.name: Jassar

texts.en:
Jassar is a 22 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Jassar has been a carpenter for few years. He makes wooden doors, bedrooms and sitting rooms furniture. Jassar requested a loan of 650 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and machines. This is the first time that Jassar has requested a loan.
Jassar hopes that the loan will help him increase his productivity. He is special in his work because of his honesty and his good behavior with his clients. His clients are his friends and family members. When he first started his business, he faced the lack of cash. Jassar decided to do his business because for the love of his work and his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business and have more machines.

loans.use: Jassar needs the loan to tools and machines.

loans.name: Cheourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheourn N. is a villager in Porpeal Khae Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem because the soil in her field is infertile soil and is damaging her crops. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Cheourn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for the pump that waters her field. 

Her husband, Mr. Uon Arn, helps her on her farm. Mrs. Cheourn N. is 58 years old and the mother of six children. Four of her children are employed by different businesses. The others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her water pump

loans.name: Comité De Mujeres Emprendedoras De Caacupé Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 women who work in the Seminarioa neighborhood of the city of Caacupé.  The group is currently in the 10th cycle of the Women Entrepreneurs program at Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the women work in sales—running small stores, selling chipas, selling clothing, and selling paper, among other activities.  

The women are maintaining a line of credit that averages 1,243,000 Guaranís ($249.00) per member.  With the loans they have received from Fundación Paraguaya, they have invested in the purchase of products for the production of chipas, items to keep their stores stocked, men’s and women’s clothing, and food items such as sugar, cookies, beef, and oil.  

The president of the group, Mrs. Rogelia G., gave her thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for the support and confidence she has received from them.  She promised on behalf of the group to uphold the agreement they entered to make payments on time, as they have been doing since their first cycle in the program.

loans.use: The purchase of supplies for the various businesses, such as sodas, milk, cookies, men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Julio Del Transito

texts.es: Julio del Transito M. U., vive en Barrio el Santuario departamento San Vicente tiene 36 años de edad, Julio es un hombre soltero vive con su madre y él es el que lleva los gastos de la casa, Julio estudio hasta el nivel de bachillerato pero se le fue imposible continuar con la universidad, ya que no había quien cubriera los gastos familiares, allí cuando Julio comenzó aprender el oficio de la carpintería; y ahora con muchos años de experiencia tiene su propio negocio, que es una carpintería donde Julio elabora muebles y accesorios tallados en madera. Julio solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para elaboración de muebles.
texts.en:
Julio del Transito M. U. lives in the Santuario neighborhood in the department of San Vicente. He is 36, single, and lives with his mother. He is the one who is responsible for the home's expenses. Julio studied until college, but it was impossible for him to continue with university because there was no one to cover the family expenses. This is when Julio started to learn the carpentry trade. Now with many years of experience, he has his own business, which is a workshop where he makes furniture and accessories carved from wood. Julio is requesting a credit to purchase supplies to make furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for his business

location.town: Barrio el Santuario, departamento San Vicente

loans.name: Moeung

texts.en:
S. O., 28, is a good mother who cares for her two children in the family home; both of them are still young and attend the local public school. S. owns a medium-size farmland where she grows different kinds of vegetables, such as  tomato, cucumber, morning glory, and cabbage. She can grow two harvests each year. 

S. O. is married to Mr. Nara, 34, who helps her grow the vegetables. They are living in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. Each year, the family has to hire a villager's cow to plow their farm because they lack the capital to buy a cow. Therefore, S. O. has requested a loan to purchase a cow so she can raise its offspring. (S. O.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes 
Juana es conviviente tiene 43 años, cinco hijos, dos gemelos de  22 años, uno de 16, 14 y 7 años, que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Juana se dedica ala venta de productos de belleza por catalogo hace doce años y a dar menú en su casa. 
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza.
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió a ser solidaria,  a seguir creciendo en el negocio, recibe mucha motivación, de la promotora.   
El sueño de Juana es poner un salón de belleza, por que ella estudio en el colegio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. Juana, 43, is in a common law marriage. She has five children, 22 year old twins, a 16 year old, a 14 year old and a 7 year old. They go to the state school. For two years Juana has been selling beauty products by catalog. She also has been making and selling meals in her home. Juana needs a loan of 1400 PEN to buy beauty products. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to be supportive, to keep her business growing, and received a lot of motivation from her bank representative. Juana’s dream is to open a beauty salon; that is what she studied in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena has owned a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa  for 2 years. She belongs to Mbuma east group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Lena works at her business for 11 hours daily.

Lena is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her shop to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Lena is 45 years old, single, and has three children: aged 25, 18 and 12. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop, to improve her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María B. D. tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Ana tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es pulpería hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ana inicio este negocio por cuenta propia, ya que tenia que hacerse cargo de su familia. Los propósitos de Ana son de mantener activo este negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo ya si comprar mas productos a mejores precios. Los sueños de Ana son de ampliar su negocio ya que este el único medio de supervivencia que ella posee.
texts.en:
Ana María B. D. is 50 years old and married. She has 4 children in school. Her business is a bodega, which she has run for more than 10 years. Doña Ana began the business on her own, since she had to take care of her family. She intends to keep the business active. She is requesting a loan for working capital, to purchase more products at better prices. Ana's dream is to increase her business, since it is her only means of survival.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina es una madre muy dedicada y cariñosa, tiene 35 años y vive con sus 3 hijos Yeni de 17, Denis de 14 y Víctor de 13, en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vida digna. Agripina ha trabajado mucho en su vida para salir adelante, desde muy joven entró al negocio de la venta de ropa, actividad que le dio el dinero necesario para vivir. Actualmente su puesto está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus compradores con una sonrisa en los labios. Agripina disfruta de vender ropa y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse alguna prenda, anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad su mercadería y atender mejor a sus clientes. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y lo que considera más difícil de su negocio es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder ir a ningún lado. Su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales y está dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograrlo. Este es el sexto préstamo de Agripina con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa, para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Agripina is a dedicated and caring mother. She is 35 years old and lives with her 3 children: Yeni, 17; Denis, 14; and Victor, 13. They live in a house that she inherited from her parents and what she most wants in the world is to give her children a decent life. Agripina has worked hard all her life to get ahead. At a young age, she started selling clothes, work that provides the money necessary to live. She now has a space on the Explanada Laguna Temporal (where the market fairs are held in Juliaca). She's a cheerful saleswoman and always meets potential buyers with a smile on her face. Agripina enjoys selling clothing and always convinces her customers to walk away with some article of clothing or other. Her greatest wish is to own a store where she can better tend to her customers and sell her merchandise more easily. She's operated the business for 8 years and the most difficult thing for her is having to stay in one place all day without being able to venture out. She wants to see her children take up professional careers and she's ready to work hard to make that happen. This is Agripina's sixth MFP loan. She has been very punctual in repaying past loans and expects to be so now, too. She is very active in her community bank and is well-regarded by the other members. With the three-thousand soles that she's requesting, she will buy more clothing to increase the quantity of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stock for clothing business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian J. is from the town of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Lilian owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2005, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Nabichon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Набичон молодой мужчина 22 лет – холостой. Набичон водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд- Гафуров. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги и работает с раннего утро до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего автомобиля марки "Газель". Набичон накапливает деньги для свадьбы.
texts.en:
Nabichon is a young 22-year-old single man. Nabichon drives a shuttle bus on the Khujand-Gafurov route. He works according to this schedule: 2 days on and 1 day off. He tries to maximize his earnings on the workdays and works from early morning to late night. He repairs his vehicle on his off days. He wanted to use this loan for the repairs of his Gazel vehicle. Nabichon is saving money for a wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en:
Ajoke sells drinks and foodstuffs. She is happily married with four children and she is 45 years old. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. Ajoke has been able to increase her productivity and profitability and she is very happy and grateful to LAPO and Kiva for their financial support. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. 
She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Deysi Milagro

texts.es:
la sra. Deysi Milagro C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene 4 años de tener su pulperia, gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y su hogar, este negocio es el unico que la a sostenido por estos ultimos años, en estos momentos ella necesita un credito para poder inyectarle capital a su negocio ya que no lo tiene bien surtido y quiere hacerlo crecer.
uno de sus mayores sueños es ver graduados a sus hijos de la universidad y que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
Deysi nos comento que para ella sus hijos es lo mas preciado que tiene en la vida.
texts.en:
Deysi Milagro C. dedicates herself to the sale of popularly consumed products; she has owned a small convenience store for 4 years. Thanks to this business she has been able to move her family and home forward in life; this business has been her only source of financial support these past few years. Currently she needs a loan to be able to inject capital into her business, given that it is not well stocked and she would like her business to grow.

One of her biggest dreams is to see her children graduate from university, and that they become professionals and good men. Deysi comments that to her, her children are the most precious things that she has in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soaps, churros, pills, drinks, razors, toilet paper, batteries, eggs, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, sweets, play balls, gas, sanitary napkins, soups, consommés, spices, and salt.

loans.name: United Group #2

texts.en:
United Group #2 is a group of five borrowers led by Jarwolie N., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Jarwolie is 29 years old and married with three children aged 1-9. She also takes care of one child who was orphaned in the war. Her eldest is in the 3rd grade. She was unable to attend school herself because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Jarwolie’s business is retail beverages, including water, juice, soft drinks, and beer which she buys locally and also imports from nearby Guinea. She sells to the farming community from her temporary market stall in the Halapoi main market, alongside approximately one hundred other vendors of various trades. She has been running her business for three years.

Jarwolie’s dream is to grow her business until she can have a much bigger stall. Her business is successful because of “the way I treat my customers”. She is taking the loan to buy inventory, in larger quantities, to meet demand. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house and sending her children to the university which she was denied.

loans.use: To buy juice, water and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: S. is a widow mother of the four children; two of whom are married and live separately and the other two single and work as the garment workers. S. in the age of 56 years old owns a small business selling Khmer noodle from her house. She could earn for her net income $ 2.00 per day. She lives in the thatch roof and wall for years. Besides her earning, she is taking a loan of $ 350.00 to decorate the wall her house. She wants really to have a small for farming and a big house.

loans.use: to decorate the wall her house.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz has been a vegetable vendor for ten years. She sells various kinds of vegetables in their village, and she usually sells them on a house-to-house basis. For the continuous growth of her business, she is now hoping to avail of a loan of 14,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. Her loan request has the potential to benefit not only her business but also her family.  

Luz is 34 years old and married to Charlie, a hog raiser and farmer. They are living in Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela. The couple has three children: Cherry, 22 years old; Lyla, 18 years old; and Charlie, 13 years old. Of the three, Charlie is the only one who’s still studying; her older sisters just finished their secondary education and weren’t able to enter college due to lack of money. She hopes that her retail business will become more productive to be able to meet their daily needs and uplift their poor living condition.

loans.use: Additional capital for the improvement of her business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana A. is from the village of Upper Cogon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Luciana is widowed and has adult-aged children. To make a living, Luciana runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciana is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Norng R., 49 years old, owns a small shop in her village where she sells food to people at lunchtime. She typically makes around $2 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a local cultivator (he appears in the picture). Norng R. has been planning to build a new house for a long time but she doesn't have enough money to begin the construction. She is taking out this loan to afford the construction of a small house for her family.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: Wendy Yamileth López P., de 21 años de edad, es una joven muy responsable e ingeniosa, con ella viven sus abuelos: Don Rafael y Niña Carmen, de 70 y 68 años respectivamente, además de ellos también se encuentra en la misma casa su hermana Fatima que recién ha dado a luz a la pequeña Fatima. Todos dependen económicamente de la tienda que Wendy ha instalado en su mismo lugar de residencia en ella distribuye productos de consumo diario, Wendy ha encontrado en éste negocio además una buena forma de cuidar a sus abuelitos. Le está yendo muy bien y por ser dedicada en la atención de sus clientes esta ganando que su negocio sea reconocido cada día. Cerca del negocio se encuentra una escuela y ve en ella oportunidad para crecer en sus ventas, pero necesita surtir su negocio para poder atraer esa demanda. Es por esto que Wendy se encuentra solicitando su primer crédito para poder abastecer de nuevos productos que están demandando sus clientes.-
texts.en:
Wendy Yamileth López P. is 21 years old. She is a very responsible and resourceful young woman who lives with her grandparents, Don Rafael and Niña Carmen, who are 70 and 68 respectively. Also living with them is her sister Fatima, who recently gave birth to a daughter also named Fatima. All of them are financially dependent on the store that Wendy established in their home.

She sells daily consumer products. Her business is doing very well and she dedicates herself to providing good service to her customers, since she is becoming more recognized each day. Wendy has discovered that her business is good way for her to look after her grandparents. Her store is located near a school, which gives her an opportunity to increase her sales. However, she needs additional merchandise in order to attract new business. For this reason, Wendy is requesting her first loan so that she can buy new products that customers are demanding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new products to attract customers

loans.name: Tameem

texts.en: Tameem runs a small chicken farm. He raises some for meat and others to sell their eggs. With the earnings from his small business, he is able to supplement his family’s income. He is 29 years old, single and lives with his parents. Tameem wants to invest in more chicks and feed and that is why he would like to borrow $3000 US. He says, "Thank you!"

loans.use: To invest in more chicks and feed

loans.name: Bolade

texts.en: F. is the owner of “Glory Bim Salon”; she is a hair stylist, and she sells wares. She has been in the business for a long time. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her businesses. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is married with one child, and she is 31 years old. She needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to expand her business and purchase more hair accessories, hair extensions, and wares to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, hair  accessories, and wares to sell

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Carla del Socorro M. se dedica a la actividad de elaboración y venta de alimentos en el mercado central de Chinandega donde a diario vende deliciosos platillos a sus clientes que le visitan por ofrecer alimentos de primera calidad. Ella es una dama muy alegre y con muchos deseos de superación en su negocio.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su actividad de comidería.
texts.en:
Carla del Socorro M. makes and sells food in the central market in Chinandega. Everyday she sells her delicious dishes to her customers who come to her because she sells top quality food. She is a very happy lady, and she has a great desire to improve in her business. She is currently asking for a loan to buy raw materials like rice, beans, oil, and others. She hopes to be granted the loan; then she will continue with her food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make food

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Sandra es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Sandra vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de las diferentes fiestas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cigarros, chicles y galletas.
Los sueños de Sandra son que sus hijos sean profesional y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Community Bank "Violeta". She is single, 23 years old and she has a son. Sandra sells snacks by travelling to the different fairs in the region, something she does every day.

Sandra requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of cigarrettes, gum and cookies.

Sandra's dreams are to see her children grow up to have good careers and to purchase a house.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cigarrettes, gum and cookies.

loans.name: Elen

texts.en:
Elen N. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Elen is single. To make a living, Elen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elen is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Magda Araceli

texts.es: La señora Magda Araceli vive sola ya que su hija ya esta casada, ella es propietaria de una estancia infantil de nombre “Camila” por parte del gobierno de la cual recibe comisión por la atención a niños de madres trabajadoras, ella es una cliente disntiguida de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se le otorgo un crédito para mejora de su estancia donde acondiciono una área de juegos para niños; y nuevamente tramita para inversión en compra de material didáctico, y así además de estar en un lugar seguro los niños pueden aprender cosas  educativas.
texts.en:
Magda Araceli lives alone because her daughter is now married. She owns a government daycare center called “Camila”. The government pays her a commission for taking care of the children of working mothers. She is a distinguished client with our institution. She previously received a loan to improve the daycare center by setting up a play area for children. She wants a new loan to buy educational material. In addition to being in a safe place, the children can learn educational things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational materials for the children in her daycare facility

loans.name: Esther Josefina

texts.es:
Esther C. es otra socia activa  del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en la parroquia Tarqui ubicada al  sur de la ciudad de Cuenca y tiene como atractivos las lagunas de Totoracocha y Condorcocha en las comunidades de Tutupali Grande, Esther tiene 53 años de edad es madre soltera y ha concebido 8 hijos que se encuentran de 37, 35, 33, 27, 25, 22, 21, 19 años, casi todos sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, solo tiene 2 hijos solteros el de 25 años pero vive en casa de su hermana y su hijo de 19 años quien le ayuda muy poco en la economía de su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
 
Esther se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado 27 de Junio en su comunidad, solo vende los días domingos laborando desde las 6 a.m. hasta terminar  sus preparaciones y su mamá fue quien la enseñó a preparar y sazonar su exquisita comida. Además se dedica a los 
quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de  animales como chanchos, gallinas, cuyes y  vacas la leche que obtiene de sus vacas a veces entrega a los comerciantes o utiliza para su consumo y sus animalitos son vendidos cuando tiene alguna necesidad de dinero.
 
 Se encuentra dos  años y medio en su banco comunal, con el  dinero  de los créditos recibidos ha logrado superarse en su negocio y hogar,  y con el nuevo crédito va a comprar aceite, sal y  quintales de arroz y azúcar  y otros productos necesarios para preparar sus platos y brindar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Tiene como meta continuar con su negocio y crecer económicamente en su vida.
texts.en:
Esther C. is an active member of the “El Arenal” communal bank. She lives in Tarqui parish, which is in the southern part of Cuenca, and is famous for Lakes Totoracocha and Condorcocha in Tutupali Grande. Esther is 53 years of age, a single mother, and has 8 children, who are 37, 35, 33, 27, 25, 22, 21 and 19 years old. Almost all of her children are married and live independently. She only has two single sons; the 25-year-old, who lives with his sister and her 19-year-old who chips in a bit for family expenses. She does not own a house; she lives in a relative’s house. Esther sells food in her community’s 27 de Julio market on Sundays. She’s open for business from 6am until she runs out of food. Her mother taught her how to cook and season her delicious food. She also does the household chores and raises small farm animals, like: pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and cows. She sometimes sells the milk she gets from her cows to merchants or she uses it for her own consumption. When she faces unexpected expenses, she sells her animals. She has been in her communal bank for two-an-a-half years. She has used the funds received to get ahead in her business and at home. She will use the new loan to buy cooking oil, salt and quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of rice and sugar as well as other ingredients for her meals so that she can offer her customers a wider variety. Her goal is to continue with her business and to grow economically in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus tres hijos en su casa propia, la cual construyó hace 4 y está hecha a base de madera. 

Ella es profesora en un colegio de su localidad, pero desde hace 5 años también vende ropa. Se inicio en este negocio vendiendo ropa interior en las reuniones de sus familiares y amigos, gracias al capital que le brindó su esposo. A pesar que a veces corre el riesgo de ser asaltada cuando va de compras sola, eso no le amilana, ya que lo que más le gusta es el comercio y su mayor preocupación es atender a sus clientes oportunamente, inclusive en sus mismos domicilios.  En adelante, quiere tener una tienda de ropa en su casa para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, donde se compromete a pagar cada una de sus cuotas oportunamente, para que pueda contar con posteriores préstamos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más prendas para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maribel, 37, lives with her life partner and father of her three children in her own, wood house that she built 4 years ago. She is a teacher at a local school but has also sold clothing for the past 5 years. She started off in this business selling underwear at social gatherings with her family and friends thanks to initial capital that her husband gave her. Despite sometimes running the risk of being robbed when she’s out shopping alone, that doesn’t discourage her. What she likes best about her work is the commerce and her greatest worry is being able to take care of her customers properly, sometimes even going to their own homes. In the future, she’d like to have a clothing store in her house so that she can improve her family’s standard of living. This is her 14th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time so that she can qualify for future loans. She will use the funds to buy more articles of clothing to fill pending orders from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rhodella

texts.en: Rhodella D. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Rhodella is married and has an infant. To make a living, Rhodella operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic load credits for cell phone calls and texts for all networks in the local community. Rhodella has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Rhodella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhodella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rhodella from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia R. is from the town of Banga. She is 57 years old. Cecilia is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gloria Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Mabel tiene 24 años de edad es viuda, tiene una niña de 5 años y ella vive con sus padres en la Maica Central es una zona rural de la ciudad de Cochabamba ella se dedica a la producción de leche.

Mabel quedo viuda hace como tres meses atrás ella sufrió mucho con la enfermedad de su esposo el tenia leucemia, lucho con él hasta el final tuvo que hacer tratamiento en los cuales ella sufría junto con él y su niña, ella sufría mas porque vivía en la casa de sus suegros que siempre estaban controlando las cosas que hacía, ella es una persona muy trabajadora a pesarse que su esposo estaba muy enfermo ella lo atendía y al mismo tiempo realizaba el trabajo de ordeñar y entregar la leche porque ella era la que pagaba los tratamientos de su esposo y la escuela de su hija, cuando el esposo falleció la madre de su esposo la saco de la casa y por esa razón ella se fue a trabajar con sus padres con los que cuentan con todo su apoyo.

Ella quiere el crédito para comprar una cabeza  de ganado lechero y de esa manera aumentar la producción de leche y poder trabajar y darle una vida mejor a su hija. Ya que ella es muy joven tiene el sueño de estudiar veterinaria y está inscrita en un instituto de la ciudad la cual se da modos para estudiar y trabajar con las vacas y darles tiempo a su hija y colaborar a sus padres en toda la producción de leche ya que ellos tienen un tanque de enfriamiento para poder echar la leche y entregar a PIL.

Ella es una persona muy responsable y dedicada al trabajo que realiza ya que sus padres desde niña le enseñaron a trabajar.
texts.en:
Mabel is 24 years old, a widow, and has a five year old daughter. She lives with her parents in Maica Central, a rural area of the city of Cochabamba. She works producing milk. Mabel has been a widow for about three months. She suffered during her husband's illness. He had leukemia, and fought to the end. He had to have treatments, which she suffered with him and her daughter. She also suffered because she lived at home with her in-laws, who were always controlling the things that she did. She is a very hard-working person. When her husband was sick, she took care of him and at the same time, worked to arrange and deliver the milk because she was the one who paid for her husband's treatments and her daughter's education. When her husband died, her mother-in-law told her to leave the house, so she went to work with her parents, who she could count on for support. She would like a loan to buy a dairy cow and increase her production of milk, so she can work and give a better life to her daughter. Since she was young, she dreamed of being a veterinarian, and she is enrolled in a school in the city that allows her to study, work with cows, spend time with her daughter, and work with her parents to produce milk, since they have a cooling tank to hold the milk and bring it to PIL. She is a very responsible person who is dedicated to the work that she does, since her parents taught her as a child how to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Florindo

texts.es: Florindo V. G., tiene la edad de 74 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y un hijo de 55 años.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales y productos para la mejoras en el área de repastos. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento  a la cercas y en poder mantener  calidad en los repastos, para que el ganado que tiene se desarrolle de la mejor manera y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área que desea mejorar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Florindo tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor
texts.en:
Florindo V. G. is 74 years old, married, and lives with his wife and a 55 year-old son. He is requesting this loan to buy materials and products to make improvements to his pastures. He would like to perform proper maintenance on the fences and to be able to maintain high-quality pastures, so that his cattle will develop as well as possible and therefore fetch the best price when he sells them. Florindo would also like to increase his number of animals and to be able to keep them in better conditions, including making improvements to a specific area. This is the first time that Florindo is taking out a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the opportunity they are providing him. Florindo has been raising cattle for several years. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements to cattle pastures

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam T. is 39 years old and has been married for many years to Mr. Seng, 36, on the left of the photo. They have three school-aged children. This couple helps each other to earn money by working together as laborers in industry. They also always take time to cultivate rice crops for their food during the farming season. Nam T. realizes that she doesn’t have enough water for her needs because her house is far from the watering system. To solve this problem, Nam T. decided to pursue a loan in order to hire a laborer to dig a well so she can pump enough water for the family's use.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to dig a well

loans.name: Bul's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Bul B. is 33 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Prey Lve Lech village, Takeo province. Each member of this village bank loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mr. Bul B. and his wife, Mrs. Yoeun Chroek, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mr. Bul B. will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

This couple has two children: one is attending in the local school while the other is a year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for his farm

loans.name: Kiran's Group

texts.en:
Kiran lives in Pakistan’s second largest city, Lahore. She is a working lady but she also manages the household chores efficiently simultaneously. She takes care of her family and does her boutique business. She takes orders from different clothes shops and provides them with finished goods in a given time and makes an income. As she is getting many orders from her customers, her work load has increased which makes her unable her to complete all of the orders on time. Therefore, she has decided to hire a helper in her boutique business. 

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her boutique business. With the loan amount she will buy items such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk and fulfill the large orders on time. She has good confidence in herself and she is sure that by increasing the working hands she can make a quite good income with her business.

loans.use: To purchase material for boutique business.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena E. sells vegetables and yams at Takoradi.  Mena has no educational background.  She is married to a butcher and living together with her three children. Mena has been selling her goods for some time. She helps her husband in the payment of school fee and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her children’s education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de llantas y servicios de vulcanización, por iniciativa propia empezó desde pequeño como aprendiz cuando creció para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar muy joven, su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para su actividad, en el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y obtener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Oscar, 30, sells tires and tire repair services. He started out by his own initiative as an apprentice when still very young. As he got older, because of lack of employment opportunities and needing to support his family, he had to go to work while still very young. His shop is located in his home and he’s always aware of what his customers are requesting from him. He will use the loan to buy raw materials for his work. In the future he’d like to make some home improvements and acquire another business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn M. is from the village of Jasmine, Sapang Dalaga. She is 21 years old, married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, she raises and sells pigs from her own farm. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Roselyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her 1st loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina is a house wife living in a city called Borewala, which is known for its shrines, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and lives in it with her family. She prefers to stay at home by managing the household chores and taking care of her family. 

Her husband's name is S. M.. He is a painter by trade and paints walls, doors and windows. People hire him by making a phone call and he gets his income after completing the work. He also has contracts with different construction companies and works for them by painting their buildings to earn an income for his family. His business is going well but he wants to buy a variety of colors of paints to start a painted boxes sales business as well. In this way, he will earn a good profit when he doesn’t receive any painting orders from his customers. 

Therefore, Nagina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for this purpose. With the loan amount her husband will buy the paint boxes of different colors and increase the income by selling them. Nagina is very supportive in nature and always willing to help her family in making their life easier. She is hopeful that her husband will get good profits by starting his paint selling business after making this investment. 

Note: “In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Nagina”.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes for paint business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 44 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 son menores y el mayor trabaja, juntos tratan de salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Siempre pensó en brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, es por esta razón que cuando se quedo sola no dudo en empezar a trabajar en lo que mejor sabía hacer, que era cocinar. Y desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de diversos platillos preparados al paso, como salchipapas (papas fritas y hot dog)  y papas rellenas (fritas con relleno de carne molida); que son muy buscados por su exquisitez y sus precios cómodos. Su jornada laboral empieza a las 4 de la tarde cuando instala una mesa con bancas en la parte de afuera de su casa; y el horario de trabajo suele prolongarse hasta la medianoche, cuando ya no le queda nada de comida para ofrecer. Esta muy satisfecha, pues sus hijos la ayudan en la atención, de es manera logra considerables ganancias diarias, que le están permitiendo salir adelante. Además como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, pues quiere un negocio más estable y tranquilo. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete que cumplirá puntualmente son el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Marcela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor como arroz, aceite y azúcar que necesita para ofrecer mayor variedad de platillos a sus comensales, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Marcela, 44, lives in her own home with her 3 children.  One of her children works and the other two are minors.  Together, with a lot of effort, they try to get ahead.  She has always thought of providing the best for her children, and for this reason when she was left alone she did not hesitate to start to work the best way that she could, which was to cook.  For the last 5 years she has been selling a variety of fast food dishes such as salchipapas (hot dog with fried potatoes) and papas rellenas (fried potato with ground meat filling), that are sought after because they are delicious and cheap.  Her working day begins at 4 in the afternoon when she puts a table with benches in an area outside her house, and her working hours usually extend until midnight when there is no food left to offer.  She is very pleased, because since her children help her to serve the customers she gets considerable daily earnings that allow her to get ahead.  In addition, as she is a very enterprising woman, she plans in the future to set up a grocery store in her house because she wants to have a business that is more stable and tranquil.  This is the 5th loan that she has taken with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time, since she does not want to disappoint the people who have made this loan possible which will allow her to continue to work and make progress.  Marcela will use the loan she requests to buy ingredients that she needs at wholesale, such as rice, cooking oil, and sugar, so that she can offer a variety of dishes to her customers.  In this way she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and products so that she can continue to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran (who we see here holding a blue book) is a housewife who is always ready to help her husband, who makes a living selling fruits.  Her husband buys his fruits in a wholesale market and sells them to people in his community from a four-wheeled cart. Sughran helps him by getting up early in the morning to arrange items on the cart. She knows that her husband works really hard to put three meals on the table for his family, and that’s why she is committed to help him and care for him.   

Sughran and her husband have three sons. The oldest makes a living selling milk and yogurt from a shop in the local market and the other two are still in school. She has applied for a loan which her husband will use to buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk from wholesale markets. She believes that this loan will help her husband earn more money and operate his business more efficiently. 

For the last nine years, Sughran and her family have lived in a two-room brick house in a small city named Khanewal. She is a member of Asasah and this is her third loan request. She paid her previous loans on time.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tô

texts.en:
C. Tô Thị (20213020006) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children.  

To make a living, C. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.
