While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling metal & metal-related products in the local community.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

C. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Tô Thị (20213020006) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, C. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm kim loại & có liên quan đến kim loại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To add inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 52 years old. Jessie is married and has 3 children aged 21, 19 and 17. Jessie is a farmer and he has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years. His wife helps him maintain their rice farm and sell their harvest to the market. Over a year ago, Jessie invested in an ice cream business. He bought his own ice cream cart and started selling around their neighborhood when he is free of farming duties. He found it enjoyable but realized he needs to hire an ice cream boy to do it for him so that he could focus on his farm.

Jessie is now requesting to loan Php16000 from CEVI, a KIVA partner. He will use the loan to purchase farm supplies and an additional ice cream tub. Jessie is hopeful that this loan will help him pursue his plans in his business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and an additional ice cream tub

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is 38 years old and single. He takes photographs for a living and also owns a men's salon. He has been in this business for seven years. He says that his business is successful because he has managed to build a house from his business. He has requested this loan to buy more equipment for his business. With the profits, he plans to improve the quality of his photos.

loans.use: to buy more cameras and salon equipment

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Víctor Hugo C. Michel, comenta que su cuñada fue quien lo invito a formar parte de FRAC, el dice “me siento muy contento y muy dichoso de pertenecer a FRAC todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras y también me ciento bendito entre tanta mujer" (riendo). Él es originario de la localidad de San José Purua estado de Michoacán,  el tiene 35 años de edad estudio hasta la preparatoria, comenta que ya no siguió estudiando porque no le gusto la escuela y decidió mejor ayudarle con el negocio a sus padres. Don Hugo como es conocido en su localidad decidió pedir su préstamo para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes el surtirá huevo, aceite, jabón, papel higiénico y otros productos de primera necesidad, el tiene con el negocio aproximadamente 15 años, comenta que primero era de sus papas y después le pasaron el negocio a el. Don Hugo dice que se surte en tiendas de Zitacuaro Michoacán, ya que es cliente de estas y le dan buen precio. El señor Hugo esta casado con la señora Isabel la cual le ayuda a atender la tienda de abarrotes, ellos tiene 3 hijos Hugo de 9 años y Julián de 6 años de edad ambos estudiantes de primaria y el menor de nombre Kevin de 4 años de edad el cual estudia el jardín de niños, la meta que tiene don Hugo para su negocio de abarrotes es hacer mas grande el local además de remodelarlo ya que esta en obra negra y surtir productos que no vende como lácteos y carnes frías.
texts.en: Mr. Víctor Hugo C. Michel relates that his sister in law was the one who invited him to be a part of FRAC. He says "I feel very happy and lucky to belong to  FRAC. All of the women are very hardworking and enterprising, I also feel blessed to be among so many women [laughing]."  He is from the community of San José Purua, state of Michoacán. He is 35 years old and went to high school. He remarks that he didn't continue his studies because he didn't like school and he decided it would be better to help his parents in business.  Don Hugo, as he is known in the area, decided to ask for a loan to invest in his grocery store. He will procure eggs, oil, soap, toilet paper and other basic necessity products. He has had his business for approximately 15 years. He remarks that it belonged to his parents first and later they passed the business on to him. Don Hugo says that he gets his supplies in the stores of Zitacuaro Michoacán, since he is their customer and they give him a good price. Hugo is married to Isabel, who helps him run the grocery store. They have 3 children: Hugo, 9, Julian, 6, both in elementary school, and the youngest, Kevin, 4. He is in nursery school. Hugo's goal for his grocery store is to make the locale bigger and remodel it, since construction has just begun. He would also like to offer products that he doesn't sell, like dairy and refrigerated meats.

loans.use: He will invest in a grocery store.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina S. is from the village of Nailon Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Felina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Felina owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing sewing services in the local community. Felina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Felina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Felina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand sewing services provided

loans.name: Violeta's Group

texts.en:
Violeta A. is from the village of Linglingay, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Violeta is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Violeta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Najmidin

texts.en:
F. Najmidin lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is 48 years old, married and has five children. Najmidin is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cows at the local market. Once every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers, raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows to local butchers. Today, Najmidin is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 7,000 Somoni. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia, a 40-year-old seamstress who also discharges her responsibilities as a housewife, lives with her family in a four-room brick house in Faisalabad, an area well known for its textile industry. Her house is located in Yaseenabad, where she has lived for 15 years. The mother of a son and three daughters, all attending a local school, Safia knows the importance of education and therefore wants them to complete it and become successful in life.

In order to financially support her husband, Safia stitches clothes for her community members. She is very good at her work, and the community ladies prefer using her services because she offers them good quality at reasonable rates.

Safia is married to M. A., who runs a grocery store in the market. Through his shop he sells daily-use items such as cooking oil, soaps, sugar, lentils, spices, etc. He charges very reasonable rates for his items, thereby generating good sales volumes every month.

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to sell. She is hopeful that he will achieve good outcomes from the loan and his income will further improve.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is Safia's fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended all meetings.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Oligario

texts.en:
Oligario L. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old. Oligario is married and has one child. To make a living, Oligario owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled) transport services. Oligario has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Oligario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oligario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Oligario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Gee

texts.en:
Gee N. is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. N. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 5 per day. One of her children is employed at a hotel in the town, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 37 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Se dedica a la venta de CDs y DVDs. Cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado San Pedro. Es muy conocido en su comunidad y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. Desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Tambien desea hacer unos arreglos a su puesto para poder brindar una presentación profesional a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Carlos is a single man of 31. He lives in the Pacasmayo district, an area with a fair amount of business located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He engages in selling CDs and DVDs. He owns a stall in the San Pedro Market, he is very well-known in his town and he can count on regular customers. He wants to improve his sales by buying more products, as well as have some repair works done to his stall in order to present himself to his customers with a professional appearance. For this reason he has though it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: To buy more products for his stall.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es:
Carlos de 52 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio como taxista gracia a un  dinero que tenía ahorrado en el banco y así se compro un vehículo.

Trabaja diariamente  desde la mañana hasta la noche. Le dificulta la delincuencia ya que la ciudad cada vez esta peligrosa. El es viudo y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. Con el préstamo desea comprarse otro vehículo y asi darle la entreda del auto para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Carlos, 52, is a hard working man who started taxi driving thanks to some money that he had saved in the bank, that is how he bought a vehicle.  He works every day from morning until night.  Crime is a difficulty, since the city is increasingly dangerous.

Carlos is a widower and has two adult children.  With the loan he wants to buy another vehicle so that he can give them the car to increase profits.

loans.use: purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Angelica; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales y también tiene una tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz y verduras como zanahorias, lechugas y cebollas y después lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba, con respecto a la crianza de animales la socia vende cuyes y chanchos y también los vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales y verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y comprar fertilizantes para mejorar la tierra de cultivo.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María Angélica, 45, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO” communal bank located in Urubamba District which belongs to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business raising livestock; she also has farmland where she grows corn and vegetables like: carrots, lettuce and onions, that she then sells in Urubamba’s market.  With respect to the animals she raises, she sells guinea pigs and pigs as a street vendor.  She wants to expand and improve her animal and vegetable sales businesses and is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and fertilizer to improve her farmland.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Laneh Kuru” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Wara is the leader of this group.  Wara is 40 yeas old and married, with three children who are no longer attending school. Wara sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Wara will invest in her business by buying gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc., in order to produce a large number of gara cloths for sale.

loans.use: to buy gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. in order to produce a large number of gara cloths for sale

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es: El señor MElaneo P.  es natural D. Chiclayo tiene  65 años y es soltero desD. muy joven se a dedicado a la pesca ya que toda su familia es pescadora.  El se dedica a pescar y luego venD.  todo su pescado es el puerto. Viaja por lo general los fines D. semana, y durante la semana se dedica a la cerrajeria realiza ventanas y puertas en fierro a pedido. Su deseo mas granD. es poder terminar D. construir su propia casa. Con su prestamo se va a comprar un bote D. segunda para poder salir a la pesca y tambien para poder alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Melaneo is a native of Chiclayo, 65 years old, and single. From a very early age, he has dedicated his time to fishing, as has all his family. He still fishes and sells his catch in the port. On weekends, he goes out to fish, and during the week, he does ironwork, fulfilling orders for customized iron gratings for windows and doors.

His greatest desire is to be able to finish constructing his own house. With this loan, he will buy a second-hand boat to fish in and, also, to rent out.

loans.use: to invest in buying a fishing boat.

loans.name: Regina Concepcion

texts.es: Regina Concepción D. cincuenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con sus dos hijos y posee un puesto en el mercado D. la localidad donD. tiene venta D. granos básicos y otros, ella se ha hecho D. mucha clientela últimamente pues siempre encuentran lo que necesitan y les da un muy buen servicio, es muy amable y da precios cómodos. Regina sabe que lo que importa es cuanto amor y esfuerzo le ponga a su trabajo y así con lo que realiza tendrá grandes éxitos, esto la impulso a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), azúcar, especies, sopas instantáneas, pastas entre otros; con esto Regina no decepcionara a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo tiene la confianza que si su negocio crece le dará a su familia una vida más plena.
texts.en: Regina Concepción, 45, lives with her 2 children and has a small stall in the market in her area where she sells staple grains and other items.  She has attracted a lot of customers lately, because they always find what they need at her stall and she gives them very good service.  She is very friendly and her prices are low.  Regina knows that what matters is to put love and effort into your work; in this way you can have great success in what you do.  This has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to purchase staple grains (rice, beans,and corn), sugar, spices, instant soups, pasta and other items.  With this inventory Regina will not disappoint her customers, and at the same time she will have confidence that her business will grow, providing her family with a fuller life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sugar, spice, instant soups, and pasta

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, 55 years of age, is married and blessed with 4 children. She has had a retail store for almost 2 years and she sells a variety of different products. Her net income is 5,000 a month. She's asking for a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase soft drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles and coffee to sell. She wanted to thank Kiva lenders for their assistance in availing the loan and hopes lenders will continue to fund her loan requests in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Sortilegio Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sortilegio lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Darling, Lesbia y Gema. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Darling de 32 años propietaria de una panadería, negocio familiar que inicio hace siete años aproximadamente. Ella se especializa en repostería e invertirá el crédito en harina, leche, mantequilla, manteca…etc.
Darling tiene cinco hijos de 17, 14, 9, 8 y 5 años los cuales estudian y los dos mayores ayudan en el negocio en su tiempo libre.
Las otras integrantes son Lesbia de 30 años quien vende verduras y sopa los fines de semana, y Gema vende ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The 'Sortilegio' group has three hard-working and entrepreneurial members: Darling, Lesbia and Gema.  The group's coordinator is 32 year-old Darling who owns a bakery.  This is a family business that she started approximately seven years ago.  Her speciality is baking pastries and desserts and she will invest her loan in buying flour, milk, butter, lard etc.  Darling has five children aged 17, 14, 9, 8 and 5.  They are all in school and her two eldest help in the business in their spare time.

The other members of this group are 30 year-old Lesbia, who sells vegetables and soup on weekends, and Gema, who sells clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, butter, lard etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 57 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with two children. Maria has a shop that sells cosmetics. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. Maria has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Mi Esperanza Group

texts.es: Yesy yolani, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Mi Esperanza, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene un hijo de 8 años que depende de ellos y una hija que es independiente. Yesi inició desde hace ocho años a vender todo tipo de golosinas. Su negocio está instalado en la Escuela José Antonio Domínguez y aun no tiene una caseta así que prepara las golosinas en su casa y luego las transporta hasta la escuela y en la hora del recreo coloca una mesita cerca de la cancha de deportes y los alumnos llegan a comprarle. Su mayor dificultad es no tener una caseta y por esa razón las autoridades de la escuela en ocasiones no la dejan vender. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras, harina, aceite, galletas, refrescos, dulces, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá mantener su negocio bien surtido y así sus clientes preferirán comprarle a ella. Su meta es conseguir una caseta y poder atender a los alumnos sin ningún problema. Yesy tiene 3 ciclos con FAMA y no ha tenido atrasos con sus pagos, y gracias a los préstamos recibidos su negocio y su casa han mejorado y ha podido apoyar a su hijo con el estudio. Sus compañeras de grupo se dedican a varias actividades económicas como ser  la venta de ropa usada, venta de abarrotería y venta de plásticos y soya.
texts.en:
Yesy Yolani is a member of the  Mi Esperanza ("My Hope") Solidarity Group. She is 38 years old, married, and her husband is a brick layer. She has an 8 year old son who depends on them and another daughter, who is independent. 

Yesy has sold all types of candies since she was eight years old. Her business is located in the José Antonio Domínguez School and even though she doesn't have a stand there she makes the candies at home and brings them to the school where she sets up a little table near the sports stadium and sells them to the students during recess. Her major concern is not having a stand and that therefore the school officials sometimes don't let her sell there. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy vegetables, flour, oil, cookies, soft drinks, sweets, etc... With the support of this loan she will be able to keep her business well stocked so that her customers will prefer to give their business to her. Her goal is to find a stand and be able to serve the students without any problem. Yesy has had three loans with this field partner and has not had any late payments. Thanks to these loans her business has improved and she has been able to support her son in his studies. Her group partners work in a variety of areas, including the sale of used clothes, hardware, plastics, and soy.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make candies and treats.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her store like eggs, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

Cresencia has been in this business for 30 years.

Cresencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store like eggs, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Sharapat's Group

texts.en:
Sharapat is the leader of this group.  She is 55, and unfortunately she is a widow.  She has raised two sons.  Her first son is married and lives separately with his family, and her second son studies at school. 

In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, Sharapat breeds livestock.  She has been in this business for a long time.  She earns 2,000 Kyrgyzstani soms per month by reselling livestock after fattening.  

With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase feed for her livestock. In the future Sharapat wishes to purchase a piece of land to start building a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 26 years old and a married woman. She is thankful because she has been blessed with two children. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for six years. 

Analiza is requesting a loan amount of P25,000 in order to purchase feed for her hogs. Her loan request  will help her to maintain a larger number of hogs and improve their weight so when she sells them, she will earn a greater profit.She hopes that she can make her business grow continually to improve the quality of their life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que es una actividad que le gusta y que viene realizándola por 10 años. Comenzó con poco capital y ayuda de su esposo realizando “Humitas” (hechas con maíz y envueltas en hojas de maíz). 

Ha trabajado por varios años desde las 08h00am hasta las 13:00 todos los días haciendo en la mañana las humitas y vendiendo a diferentes personas en la tarde con ayuda de su esposo. Una de las dificultades que presenta el negocio es cuando hay escases de maíz por eso ella reserva para no tener problemas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar sus ingresos invirtiendo un préstamo en la comprar de maíz, queso y un molino.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old and she is a very hardworking woman who has great aspirations for her business. It is something she enjoys and she has had it for 10 years. She started out with a limited capital and with her husband's help, making "humitas", a food made with corn and wrapped in corn leaves.

She has worked for several years from 8am to 1pm every day making humitas in the mornings and selling them to different people in the afternoons with her husband's help. One of the difficulties she faces with the business is when there is a shortage of corn. This is why she stockpiles to avoid problems. She has many aspirations with her business and she wants to have a better income. She will invest her loan in the purchase of corn, cheese, and a mill.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cheese, and a mill.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is 37 years old and lives in the village of Cabisera 9-11 of the province of Isabela. She is married to Jimmy who works as a furniture laborer in their village. Their eldest child is Leggie Boy, who is 19 years old. He did not pursue continuing his studies in college because he was not at all interested. Their youngest child is Gelvin, who is 18 years old and presently studying in high school. Levi wants both of them to finish their studies in college. She is trying to convince her elder son to pursue his studies, and she hopes that someday they will both have a complete education.

Levi is requesting a loan amounting to PHP21,000 to use as additional business capital in her tailoring business. She wants her business to expand and become more productive in order to improve their standard of living. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved so that she can generate more income. That would greatly benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy needles, textiles and other supplies needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sanginmurod

texts.ru: Сангинмурод женат имеет одного ребенка. Жена домохозяйка. Вот уже шесть лет он занимается грузоперевозками предпринимателей из одного города в другой. У него своя автомашина ГАЗЕЛЬ. Его работа удовлетворяет его потребности. Он получает хорошие доходы и клиенты вечно довольны им. Сангинмурод хочет получить займ для ремонта автомашины и подготовки её к зиме. Он надеется получить займ и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Sanginmurod is married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in freight services for entrepreneurs from one town to another for six years.  Sanginmurod owns a Gazel truck.  His work satisfies his needs.  He earns a good income, and clients are always satisfied with him.  Sanginmurod wants to obtain this loan to make repairs to his truck and prepare it for the winter.  He hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to make repairs to his truck

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora tomasa cuenta con la edad de 55 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Sergio tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales solo Alejandro, martín y analili estudian, primero, segundo y tercer año de prepa, ya que los demás todos están casados, se dedica a la alfarería, desde hacen mas de 34 años.
Ella dice que empezó con esta actividad, por que quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y tener una buena solvencia económica, también para empezar a ahorrar y asegurar el futuro educativo de sus hijos, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de cazuelas, vasijas, tinajas, ollas, cómales y leña, para tener un poco mas surtido su negocio. 
Una de las metas que tiene doña tomasa, es la de hacer crecer muchísimo su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner su tienda de artesanías, y así mejorar e incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que les están ofreciendo, ya que gracias a esa ayuda su negocio y vida de su familia han cambiado bastante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tomasa, 55, is married to Sergio and they have seven children, of whom only Alejandro, Martín and Analili are in school in first, second and third year of high school.  The rest are married.  She has a pottery business which she started over 34 years ago.

She began her business because she wanted to improve her family's lifestyle and gain economic stability.  She also wanted to begin saving for her children's higher education.  She plans to use the loan to buy casseroles, earthenware pots and jars, comal pans and firewood so her business will be better stocked.

One of Tomasa's goals is to grow her business so she can open a craft shop in an effort to increase sales and improve her income.

She is very grateful to FRAC and the Kiva lenders for this helpful support.  Thanks to this support her business and family life have changed greatly.

loans.use: To buy casseroles, earthenware pots and jars, comal pans.

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy has been operating a nursery and kindergarten school for the last three years in Thogoto, Kikuyu town. She is a 31-year-old single lady.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase school furniture and stationery.

In future, Bancy hopes her school will grow and become the best in the country.

loans.use: to purchase school furniture and stationery.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene 28 años de edad y viven en una aldea del municipio de La Lima, Cortes. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad.

A Gloria le gusta mucho la decoración y las manualidades. Ella dedica a la elaboración de bisutería como pulseras, aritos, collares y anillos. Tiene aproximadamente 4 años de hacer esta actividad y le dedica medio tiempo todos los días. Puso el negocio por necesidad de generar un fuente de ingreso para su familia y superar económicamente. 

Solicitó este crédito de L6,000 para invertir en la compra de materiales para elaborar aritos, pulseras, anillos y collares.  Su sueño es hacer que su negocio crezca en clientes y lograr mayores ventas de su producto. En el futuro, le gustaría impulsar otro negocio como la venta de frutas y verduras para diversificar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria, 28, lives in a village in the municipality of La Lima, Cortes.  She’s a single mother of a one-year-old son.

Gloria enjoys decorating and manual arts.  She makes costume jewelry like bracelets, hoops, necklaces and rings.  She’s been in this line of work for approximately four years and she spends half a day, every day doing it.  She opened the business because she needed a source of income for her family and to get ahead economically.

She requested this L6,000 loan to buy supplies to make hoops, necklaces, rings and bracelets.  Her dream is to make her business grow in number of customers and to increase sales of her product.  In the future, she’d like to go into another type of business like fruit and vegetables sales to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: to buy suppies to make hoops, bracelets, rings and necklaces.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia has a sari-sari (variety) store business located in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a welder.

Gorgonia sells various items like soap, vinegar and canned goods in her community. She works hard to help sustain her family. She applied for a loan to buy more items to sell such as detergent soap, canned goods and bread. 

Gorgonia hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as detergent soap, canned goods and bread.

loans.name: Ledis Esther

texts.es: Ledis desde que recibió su credikiva, su negocio se ha valorizado, tiene mas pedidos y ofrece cursos de manualidades y sus ventas se incrementaron. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva con el cual comprará insumos para elaborar productos en fomí y nuevas herramientas que le ayudan a pulir sus artesanías. Su meta mas adelante es continuar perfeccionando su arte mediante los estudios especializados y alterrnarlo con cursos de gastronomía para ofrecer al mercado,  alimentos a su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: " Muy agradecidos con los financistas y ojalá sigan apoyándonos para sacar adelante nuestros negocios y hacerlos bien bonitos en el futuro no muy lejano. "
texts.en:
Ever since Ledis got her Kiva loan her business has increased in value; she has more orders, is teaching crafts classes and her sales have increased.  

She is currently applying for her Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy supplies to make foam crafts and to buy new tools that will help her polish her crafts.  

Her goal for later on is to continue perfecting her art through specialized courses that she wants to alternate with cooking classes to offer food to her clientele.  

Her message to lenders is the following: “We are very grateful to the lenders and hope that they will continue supporting us so that we can get ahead with our businesses and make them really pretty in the not too distant future.”

loans.use: to purchase art materials and new tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy keyboards, headsets and modems.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий – из села Водяное. Он проживает там с супругой и двумя взрослыми детьми. Василий занимается выращиванием ранних овощей, помидор и редиса. Он имеет большой участок земли, на котором держит три большие теплицы и еще две теплицы для рассады. Василий занимается выращиванием овощей уже 25 лет. В хозяйство он вложил уде 65 000 гривен. Ежегодно расходы на семена и пленку составляют 30 000 гривен.  

Василий планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 8 000 гривен в покупку полиэтиленовой пленки на 3 500 гривен, семян на 3 000 гривен, а также планирует купить газ на 1 500 гривен для того, чтобы поддерживать тепло во время холодной зимы в каждой из своих теплиц. Василий с удовольствием направляет основные средства на развитие хозяйства. Он стремится развиваться и у него есть для этого неплохая перспектива. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vasiliy is from the village of Vodyanoe. He lives there with his wife and two adult children. Vasiliy grows early vegetables, tomatoes and radishes. He has a large plot of land which holds three large greenhouses and two hothouses for transplanting. Vasiliy has been growing vegetables for 25 years. He invested 65,000 hryvna in his business. Every year the expenses on seeds and plastic film are 30,000 hryvna.

Vasiliy plans to invest the 8,000 hryvna loan from Kiva to purchase polyethylene film using 3,500 hryvna, seeds for 3,000 hryvna and he also plans to buy gas at 1,500 hryvna to keep warmth during the cold winter in each of their greenhouses. Vasiliy gladly channels the financial means towards development of his business. He seeks to develop further and has a promising potential for this.

loans.use: buy plastic sheeting using 3,500 hryvnas, seeds for 3,000 hryvnas and also buy gas at 1,500 hryvnas to keep warmth in greenhouses during the cold winter.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is from the village Tabakhmela, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Lia, parents, and two sons (10 and 6 years old). The children go to school.  

The only source of the income for Zurab's family is agriculture. They have 4 milk cows and 7 calves.  Zurab and Lia produce cheese and yogurt and sell them in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Zurab requested credit to purchase a milk cow. With 5 cows, the family will be able to increase production and sales of dairy products by 25%. This will allow them to spend more on the family's daily needs in order to improve the family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Kagongi Development Association Group

texts.en: Christine is 44 years old, married, and has five children who include two dependents. Christine has a good heart as she takes good care of the two orphans as her own children. She is part of a group called Kagongi development group. This is the second time she is taking a loan through the group. This is so because she is a good paying customer. Previously she bought goats using the loan which she is grazing until they will deliver and increase in number. She also grows bananas and pineapples to sustain her family and she has been doing this for twelve years, She rears goats to earn additional income. With this loan, she will be able to pay tuition for her children and enhance her agriculture business. She mostly sells what she grows to the local people and gets tuition fees from the proceeds of the sales. She hopes to see ALL her children finishing  school and getting jobs. She is a very hard working woman and thanks Kiva through UGAFODE for the partnership.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children and enhance her agriculture business

loans.name: Taslim

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Taslim from the eastern Waterloo area in Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 7.  

In 2005, Taslim established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she decided to generate income to take care of her needs. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is being arrested by police because she is not licensed. 

Taslim requires a loan to purchase more medical drugs to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, Taslim plans to expand her business into a big pharmacy store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Alice est veuve et mère de quatre enfants. Elle est née en 1947. Elle fait le commerce d’habits pour enfants et a une cabine téléphonique. Avec nos formations elle vend aussi de l’huile de palme. Avec ce crédit elle veut  acheter 3 sac de noix de palme et 30 bidons. Elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Akodésséwa et revend aux marché d’Adamvo.Avec les revenus elle pourra faire face à l’éducation des ses enfants qui sont à sa seule charge et à leurs besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Alice is a widow and the mother of four children. She was born in 1947.

She sells children's clothing and runs a telephone booth. Following training, she has also started selling palm oil.

Alice will use this loan to buy three sacks of palm nuts and 30 containers. She buys her supplies at the Akodésséwa market and resells her goods at the Adamvo market.

She will use her income to pay for her children's education and their daily needs, for which she has sole responsibility.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of palm nuts and 30 containers.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is responsible mother and a simple housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for 2 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Sana has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Sana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Sana  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Sana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to repair his taxi

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: My business is informal because I do not have my own store, but I do pay my taxes to the town, so I am able to keep my informal spot near the general market in Danli.  I sell cosmetics, chains, flowers, gifts, and other Ã­tems.  I also go directly to Tabacco Companies where most of the employees are women and would be interested in my products.  My wife and I run this business together, together we staff the booth, do the administrative details, and make decisions about what products we will invest in.

loans.use: Invest in inventory of cosmetics, cloths and hand bags.

loans.name: Fidelia Amparo

texts.en:
My name is Fidelia Amparo, and I run a small local store from home. I have been running this business for a few years now which allows me to take care of my family, paying our expenses and other obligations. The most help I receive is the support of my childern during their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fidelia Amparo, mi actividad princial es el comercio cuento con una pequeña pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, gracias esta actividad puedo antender a mi familia y contribuir con los gastos familiares y demas compromisos, lo mas importante que cuento con el apoyo de mis hijos en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: to buy rice, lard, sugar, beans, ham, flour, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth O. is 49 years old with five (5) children. She sells cooked food for the community. She needs a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fish Monger

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shampoo, body creams and soap etc. for resale

loans.name: Melania Reyes

texts.en: Melania, aged 34, married and mother of two daughters, sells shoes for women and children. Generally, the business operates in the morning next to a public place. She started this business three years ago. Currently, she has a small local shop which she acquired with her husband´s help. She is requesting a loan to remodel the shop, and have it ready for December. This will help her sell the shoes more easily, since the customers will be able to go to her shop in the afternoon and evening too. This way, she will increase her income and improve her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: To remodel a new local shop she acquired and wholesale purchase shoes to resell in her community.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en: Mbalu is 28 years old and married with 3 children.  She is expecting a 4th one.  Mbalu’s husband is also a petty trader in a different location in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Both work together to meet their family expenses and their future plans are to educate their children and build a family home.  With her previous loans, her business increased and she was able to generate income, which she contributed to the purchase of the family land for their home.  Mbalu is a visionary and she would like to diversify her business.  She is therefore requesting a $300 loan for this purpose.

loans.use: She would like to add different types of clothing to her clothing shop to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey L., 33, works very hard with her husband on their plot of land, growing variety of vegetables, and earns collectively around $14.50/day in revenue from selling her produce to the people in her community. She has three children. Two are enrolled in school and another one is unemployed. Mrs Srey L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more seeds to expand her crops, and the leftover of the money is to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to expand her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Vazifa

texts.en: Vazifa is 38 years old and is a local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. She breeds cattle in her yard together with her husband. They have had the business since 1997 and now are quite experienced. Vazifa raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. This is the family's only source of income. It can bring a good income. Vazifa wants to develop this business, to increase the number of cows. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock.

loans.use: To increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Magamaga West D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fresta M.. She currently has a local brewing business and is requesting a loan to expand the business by adding more capital. Fresta is 38 years old and is married. Her husband sells charcoal for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 9 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Fresta makes approximately UGX 12000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Fresta has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more millet flour and the loan was paid back on time.

Fresta is joined in her small group by Harriet K., Monica B. and Irene N.. Monica B. has a retail business and wants to purchase more shop items. Harriet K. is currently operating a piggery business and wants a loan to purchase more piglets. Irene N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more food and utensils.

loans.use: To expand local brewing business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia P. C. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Mariscalence”. She lives in San Martín ,Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district. Her business is located in her home which she rents on Jr: La merced Nº 501, modified epsecially for this type of activity. And so, together with a group of women she manufactures drinks, mani and preserved sacha inchi. She started up her food business whilst in the police canteen, where she had to idea to continue selling, which then thanks to her perserverance and desire to succeed she was able to set up on her own premises. With the loan of S/ 2000.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the development of her business with new cooking utensils, such as different size pots, crockery and cutlery. She will buy a glass display cabinet to show off her products, and she will also purchase non-perishable supplies, in order to increase the variety of food which she can offer her customers. At 53 years old, she is a very charismatic woman, happy to integrate in groups with other women who are partaking in any type of productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Rogelia P. C., es socia del Banco Comunal “Mariscalence”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en la misma casa que alquila, en el Jr: La merced Nº 501, especialmente acondicionado para este tipo de actividad. Así mismo junto a un grupo de mujeres se dedica a la fabricación de frugos, mani y sacha inchi confitados. Ella se inicio en el negocio de la comida dando pensión en el comedor de la policía, a partir de ello tubo la idea de seguir vendiendo, que luego gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante logra instalar su propio establecimiento de venta de comida diario Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses ,lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio con utensilios nuevos de cocina, como ollas de diferentes tamaño, vajilla y cubiertos, comprará una vitrina de vidrio par exhibir sus productos, también comprará los insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su clientela. A sus 53 años, es una mujer muy carismática, esta contenta de integrar grupos de mujeres que desarrollen algún tipo de actividad productiva,

loans.use: To purchase utensils for her business

loans.name: Martha Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is married and has 2 children, Vicor Guadalupe who is 8 years old, and Martha Itzel 6years old. Both are students, and her husband is a construction worker. Two years ago she started selling clothing from her home to her family and friends. She started when her husband went to the United States to look for work. During that time she was in charge of the kids. Since she was successful with her business she continued it.

She is soliciting this loan for $475us that she will pay back in 5 months, because she wants to buy more inventory in order to increase her income. With your contributions Veronica will achieve her sales goals.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Verónica es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Víctor Guadalupe de 8 años y Martha Itzel de 6 estudiantes. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción. Inicio hace 2 años vendiendo ropa en su casa a sus familiares a sus amigas, cuando su esposo se fue a Estados Unidos a buscar trabajo, mientras tanto ella se hizo cargo de la manutención de sus hijos. Como le iba bien continua con esta actividad.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y así obtener mejores ingresos. Con tu contribución verónica lograra incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Ms. Rafaela Solis is a 50-year-old married mother of 7 children, who are all independent and have their own jobs. She and her husband live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband, who helps with the household expenses, is a security guard at a company. Ms. Solis is a dressmaker with 20 years of experience. She started out by making dresses for her family and neighbors. With this loan, she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rafaela habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene 50 años de edad, con 7 hijos, son independientes y todos trabajan, su esposo es Guarda de Seguridad en una empresa y ayuda a los gastos del hogar. Doña Rafaela es costurera en corte y confección, tiene veinte años de experiencia, ella inicio haciéndoles costuras a su familia y vecinas. Con este préstamo que le presten quiere terminar de construir su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Finish construction of house

loans.name: Aslam Din

texts.en: Aslam Din is a young man and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is very talented and has had a retail shop for more than five years. He is happy with his business, but would love to expand his business. When he found out about AFSG microfinance, he requested an individual loan to complete his stock and expand his business. This will enable him to make a better income and provide a better future for himself.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicken medicine, chicken feeds, and charcoal.

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en:
Mushviq I. is a 38-year-old man who keeps a food store. He started his business in 1985 and since that time he has continued working in his home region, Saatli. He is married and has 2 sons; they study at school.

As Mushviq and his wife are otherwise unemployed, keeping this food store is the only financial resource for their family. He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase more goods and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for re-sale and expand his business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.

Juana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Juana vende jugos de frutas que ella prepara al momento, actividad que realiza den el mercado F. Vivanco que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Juana inicio con este negocio hace 3 meses gracias a los consejos de su amiga y actualmente su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco. Anteriormente Juana vendía verduras en el mercado Las Américas donde sus ventas era mínimas y no tenia ingresos suficientes.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, leche, huevo y frutas. Los sueños de Juana son implementar otros negocios más rentables, tener una mototaxi y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Magnolia Microfinance Institute.

Juana is a 29-year-old woman who has a live-in partner and two children. Juana sells fresh fruit juice (prepared when it is ordered) at the F. Vivanco market, located in downtown Ayacucho. Juana started this business 3 months ago thanks to her friend’s advice. Her business is steadily increasing at the moment. She used to sell vegetables at the Las Américas market, but her sales were low and she did not earn enough income.

Juana needs a loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, milk, eggs, and fruit. Juana dreams of establishing more lucrative businesses, owning a motorcycle taxi, and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, milk, eggs, and fruit

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S. M. is a villager in the village of Kampong Chrey in Takeo Province. She sells grocery goods in the local village and her husband, Mr. Chao Meng, is a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's business. Mrs. M. is 35 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of four. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Kim would like to buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's pig breeding business.

loans.name: Hue

texts.vi: Chị Huệ năm nay 28 tuổi và mới tham gia Quỹ tình hương được hơn 1 năm. Gia đình chị sống ở gần chợ nên rất thuận tiện cho việc kinh doanh và buôn bán.  Trong những năm qua ngoài làm ruộng vợ chồng chị còn buôn th Năm 2007 chị được vay vốn từ quỹ đã giúp cho gia đình chị có vốn đầu tư vào buôn thêm các mặt hàng tạp hoá.  Trước kia thu nhập của anh chị từ buôn bán chỉ đạt 1,2 triệu đồng/ tháng. Đến nay mức thu nhập đã tăng lên 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá
texts.en:
Ms. Hue is 28 years old and joined TYM fund over a year ago. Her family resides near the market, so it is very convenient for retail business. In addition to rice farming, she and her husband also has a grocery store. In 2007, she was able to borrow from the fund and invested in their grocery store by buying additional products to sell. Before joining the fund, their income was only about 73 USD per month. Now their income has risen to 122 USD per month. For this next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to invest in her grocery store

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Chuks

texts.en: Chuks I. is 47 years old and married with 4 children. All his children are in school. He sells motorcycle spare parts. Chuks is also a commercial motorcyclist. He needs the loan amount of $425 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is forty-six years old. She is married the mother of three children, all of whom are in school.

Georgina produces and supplies her product to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand is very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts, and gallon containers to store the oil, so she can increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. 

Georgina belongs to a community trust group called "Nyame Nhyira," which means "God's Blessing," and her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba’s principal occupation is the cultivation and production of vegetables. She is an excellent and admirable farmer who received from her husband the techniques and secrets of this beautiful activity, skills that have allowed her to develop multiple agricultural capabilities and have especially granted her the possibility of maintaining her loving family in these times of numerous financial problems.

Nasiba has two children who have been her aid in the most difficult moments of her life and are her principal motivation to progress. For this reason, she wishes to contribute to the dreams of each one of her children by furnishing their small home in the best way possible in order to open a small store there to cover her household’s expenses.

Nasiba requests your help in the form of a loan that will allow her to obtain greater revenues this year for the purpose of reaching each one of her goals. She is asking a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 11 months in order to purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer, to be able to sow corn, and also with part of the loan she wants to buy cattle. Nasiba expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Juana de la Concepción M. tiene 58 años, está soltera, y tiene un hijo de 12 años. Hace quince años que Doña Juana ha tenido un negocio de una pulpería y venta de ropa, lo cual esta en su casa de habitación. Doña Juana dio inicio a este negocio con fondos propios ya que necesitaba buscar una alternativa de obtener ingresos para su hogar, y por eso, decidió incursionar en este negocio pensando en el bienestar de su familia. El financiamiento de Kiva es para capital de trabajo por lo que Doña Juana necesita incrementar su negocio para la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa y golosinas. Al final, sus deseos son de incrementar su negocio, tener mejores ingresos, y a la misma vez, mejorar la calidad de vida para su hijo. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 10.500 córdobas a un plazo de 9 meses.
texts.en:
Juana de la Concepción M. is 58 years old, single, and has a 12 year old son. 15 years ago Juana started a general store and sold clothing from her home. Juana began this business with her own funds as she needed to look for an alternative means of obtaining income for her home, and so she decided to open this business, thinking about her family’s well-being. Kiva’s financing will be working capital because Juana needs to increase her business by buying basic grains, cosmetics, clothing, and candy. Her dreams are to grow her business, have greater income, and at the same time, improve the quality of life for her son. She is seeking C$ 10.500 córdobas which will be repaid over 9 months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Izzatillo

texts.en:
K. Izzatillo is a 45-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. Izzatillo works as an inspector for the government agency of social insurance and pensions. Since he earns little, he also runs a business raising and selling cattle. He has 10 years of experience in this field. 

Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Izzatillo has become a very successful businessman. Izzatillo has a friendly family who are always try to help each other. Thus with their cattle raising business, his wife and elder son help him. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing them. 

Now Izzatillo wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He applied for a loan of 850 USD. He promises to repay the loan within 10 months and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Izzatillo can get ahead.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the family business

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeurn N. lives in Seirey Douch Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds pigs. She is a 56 year old widow with three children; two of them own a small restaurant where they sell rice, soup, Chinese noodle, coffee, soft drink, etc., and the third helps out with the plantation. 

She is applying for a loan which she will combine with her savings to buy an “electric cow” (a machine that pulls a plow and runs on fuel) for her third child. The electric cow will be used to plow the field and transport rice products. Mrs. Noeurn N. hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions as a result of this loan.

loans.use: Add to her savings to buy an electric cow for her third child.

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Freddy M. Alarcón se dedica a la elaboración de calzados para damas. Don Freddy tiene su pareja con la cual solo son convivientes, además de tener una hija de 18 años que le ayuda a vender en su puesto de la calle comercio.
Don Freddy es bastante responsable, ya que supo invertir cada uno de sus créditos, pues actualmente cuenta con tres máquinas y dos ayudantes, lo que le permite producir en mayor cantidad para satisfacer la demanda de su principal cliente Calzart Bolivia.
La manera en la cual vende los calzados es mediante sus dos puestos que tiene; una en la galeria ISMAR y la otra en la PEREZ VELAZCO, en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz, otra forma de vender es a tráves de la venta ambulante.
texts.en:
Freddy M. Alarcón makes womens’ footwear. He has a common law wife and an 18 year old daughter. His daughter helps him sell in the stall on the business street. Freddy is responsible. He knew how to invest each one of his loans. He now has three machines and two helpers. This allows him to produce more and meet the needs of his main client, Calzart Bolivia. He sells the shoes from two stalls that he has. One is in the Galeria Ismar, and the other is in the Perez Velazo in the center of La Paz city. Another way to sell is as a traveling vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing machine and a scrutch (tool used when making shoes)

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en: Josiah A. is thirty-two years old and married with three children. Josiah sells bags of charcoal. He is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. He is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Etiennette

texts.fr:
K. Etiennette est née vers 1968 à Adja dans le Département du Mono au sud du Bénin. Etiennette est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Les enfants de Etiennette sont encore à la charge des parents sauf un, qui lui est déjà majeur. Depuis près de cinq ans, Etiennette vend en gros le bois de chauffage. Etiennette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits pour le compte de son activité. Etiennette sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour faire face à la demande de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Etiennette K. was born circa 1968 in Adja, in the Mono Department in Southern Benin. She's married and the mother of four children. One of her child is an adult already, but she still has to support the other three. For almost five years, Etiennette has been wholesaling firewood. She already obtained two loans for her business. She's seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, in order to meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two truckloads of firewood

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 59 years old. Zosima is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zosima makes and sells specialty food products in her local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2002, Zosima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase the ingredients needed to make products to sell. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which she will be use to purchase ingredients. This will be Zosima's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara A. owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store selling a variety of different products in the community. She is 43 years old, married and has eight school-age children. They are from Oroquieta City. Barbara has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Barbara joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Barbara has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Barbara is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.
