About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a sari sari store

loans.name: Ahrorjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Акилов несколько лет записывает, оформляет и продает компакт диски. Спрос на его диски большой, так как они качественные и место продажи расположено в центре рынка Панчшанбе. Для того чтобы запись была еще качественней он хочет на следующий займ приобрести записывающий DVD проигрыватель. Клиент благодарен кредиторам за поддержку его бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Ahrorjon A. records, packages and sells DVD's for several years. The demand for his disks is high because they are of high quality and his vendor location is in the center of the Panschabe market. He wants to use the next loan to buy a DVD recorder so that he can make an even more quality DVD records. He is very thankful to the lenders for the support of his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a DVD recorder

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en: Dasola is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells building materials. She is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more building materials to sell.  She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Narcisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Narcisa de 57 años de edad, reside en el Reparto los Martínez en la en la capital de Managua, procreo cuatro hijos  todos mayores de edad, tiene una pulpería que desde diecisiete años administra la cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo, solo vendiendo granos básicos, ahora vende una variedad de productos, y con la alternativa de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, dos hijos le ayudan económicamente. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, golosinas entre otros para ofrecer a su clientela la variedad, lo cual espera que le genere mejores ganancia y la captación de clientes nuevos. Sus planes es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo y por lograr sus objetivos.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, carnes y golosinas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak N. lives in Roeu Sey Srok village in Takeo province. She is a chicken middle woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens to resell to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Touch, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Vannak N. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more chickens to resell to earn more profits.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch M., 36, has one young child and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Sun Phal. They work together selling utensils and they make around US$5 each day. They have their parents to support as well in their household. Touch M. is asking for a loan of US$900 to purchase more utensils to sell. They believe that with the loan, the expansion of their business will bring about an increased income and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Buy utensils.

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en: Robilyn M. is from the village of Catiba, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Robilyn is just starting a business venture making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. In 2009, Robilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the revenue generated from her business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun T., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sam-at Chhum, 57, have been married since 1978 and have 5 children. Three of them are married and live in separate homes. The couple is living along National Road 10 about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Oeun has been selling grocery items for 1 year. She also grows rice for food as well. Her husband has been a security guard for 5 months. She is requesting her first loan of US$ 250 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice.

loans.name: Norma Hilda

texts.es:
Solicita un préstamo para poder construir la barda lateral más alta ya que el terreno de alado esta solo y han intentado entrar a robar a su casa. 
La señora Nora Hilda T. es madre soltera y tiene baja su responsabilidad a quienes les quiere dar la seguridad cuando ella no este en casa. 
Ya que es empleada del estado, en el departamento de secretaria este es el ingreso con el que pagar el crédito ya que los gastos de sus hijos los cubrirá con la pensión alimenticia que recibe de su ex esposo.
texts.en:
She is requesting a loan to build a wall, as the neighboring property is vacant and there have been attempts to rob her house. Nora Hilda T. is a single mother, and she is required to provide a secure living environment to those in her care when she is not home. She is a state employee, and would use income from her job to pay for the loan. Her children’s expenses would be covered by the child support she receives from her ex-husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Percita

texts.en:
Percita G. is 44 years old, married, and has an only child, Mark Anthony, 24 years old, a criminology graduate. They live in Bombong in a village of Talim Island located in Rizal Province, Philippines. In the year 2008, she decided to join ASHI ('rise up from poverty') KIVA's field partner, because of her eagerness to fight poverty and her aim to access more capital for her business so that she can supply the demand of her customers. On her third loan, she proposes the amount of Php 15,000 to use for the same businesses as before (fishing and her sari-sari store- a small retail shop).

This loan will be utilized for 10 pieces of bamboo, fingerlings, a fish net for her fish cage, rope, etc. amounting to Php 15,000. Her hopes and dreams are to expand their business to add more fish cages and also expand their sari-sari store to become a grocery store. She also wants good health and a good life for her family. These dreams give their life direction.

Percita appeals to the good hearts of Kiva lenders to support her loan and make their dreams real.

loans.use: pay for bamboo, fingerlings, fish net, etc.

loans.name: Samera

texts.en:
Samera, age 50, has worked hard throughout her life to get ahead. She owns a store in the market where she sells various kinds of clothing items. She started this business because she wanted to be able to help pay family expenses. The additional income was needed in order to help her husband to provide for their five children.

Samera is asking for a loan to buy new clothes for sale in order to be able to improve her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de tortas y dulces.  Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas y su esposo, quien es chofer de un motocarro propio. Lidia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en productos de belleza.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido una parte en productos de belleza y otra parte en la compra de tortas y dulces para vender. La meta de Lidia es tener una distribuidora de dulces.
texts.en:
Lidia is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is 41 years old and a mother of four, three of which are already grown up. She sells beauty products and also cakes and sweets. She has her daughters' and her husband's support. He works as a driver with a three-wheeler of his own. Lidia has been part of the Communal Bank "Las Doncellas" ["The Maidens"] for 5 years. Her first loan was 500 PEN which she invested in beauty products. Now she needs a 1,000 PEN loan which will be invested partly in the purchase of beauty products and partly in the purchase of cakes and sweets to sell. Lidia's goal is to have her own sweets distribution wholesale business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: beauty products and cakes and sweets

loans.name: Amarilis Del Establo Group

texts.es:
YACQUELIN, ES SOLTERA,TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 8 AÑOS, A QUIEN CRIA SOLA Y POR QUIEN PONE TODOS SUS ESFUERZOS PARA SACARLO ADELANTE. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "AMARILIS DEL ESTABLO", FORMADO POR NUEVE SOCIAS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE EL ESTABLO EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO. ELLA HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑEROS COMO SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DE SU GRUPO.
YACQUELIN, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE SALCHIPAPAS. TODAS LAS NOCHES UBICA SU CARRITO SANGUCHERO EN LA PUERTA DE SU DOMICILIO. DESDE PEQUEÑA ELLA VIÓ Y APOYÓ A SUS PADRES EN ÉSTE NEGOCIO Y HACE SEIS MESES DECIDIÓ INDEPENDIZARSE, NO LE HA IDO MAL, HA PODIDO AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO VENDIENDO TAMBIÉN BEBIDAS GASEOSAS. ESTE TRABAJO LE HA PERMITIDO PAGAR EL COLEGIO DE SU HIJO Y SU CASA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS AL POR MAYOR,PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Yacquelin is single and 24 years old. She has an 8-year-old son who she is raising by herself and for whom she is putting all her efforts to get ahead. She is a member of the "Amarilis del Establo" group, which is made up of residents of the El Establo zone in the district of Carabayllo. She has been chosen by the other members as secretary of the governing board of her group. Yacquelin sells salchipapas (local fast-food dish of thinly sliced pan-fried hot dogs and French fries) every night from her sandwich cart in front of her house. Since she was a little girl she helped her parents in this business and six months ago she started her own. It has not gone too badly and she has been able to expand her business by also selling soft drinks. This work has allowed her to pay for her son´s school and for her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supples for her business at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a happy woman and is always prepared to serve her customers better. She hopes to receive a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She hopes to be a major engine oil distributor in the future. 

Rita is a widow with 4 children. Alone, she takes care of her 4 children and she hopes they become graduate from school soon. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
Seutaatia F. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Seutaatia has 1 year of experience in this business.  Seutaatia needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Seutaatia joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Seutaatia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  Seutaatia joined the program to assist her business development.

The following social metrics for Seutaatia F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Herlin Rafael

texts.es: El Sr. Herlin Rafael Hernández G. es casado y padre de tres hijos dos en edades escolares actualmente  se desempeña como operador de maquinas industriales cuenta con dos años de experiencias y trabaja para una generadora de energía de la zona de San Rafael Del Sur. Este crédito lo solicito para la construcción de un muro de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Señor Herlin Rafael Hernández G. is married and is the father of three school-aged children. He currently operates industrial machines. He has two years of experience and works for an energy company in the San Rafael del Sur area. He is requesting this credit to construct a wall on his property.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, iron, and gravel

loans.name: Daniel Enrique

texts.es:
Daniel 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en su vivienda. El se inicio 
en el negocio de venta de alimentos balanceados para aves en un mercado de la 
localidad, primero con un capital pequeño producto de ahorros obtenidos por sus 
trabajos ya que es de profesión veterinario, en la actualidad ha implementado otra 
tienda en la tinguiña, se incrementado el negocio con mucho esfuerzo. El atiende el 
negocio de manera muy calida y amable ya que la gran mayoría de sus clientes son 
personas de la campiña, solicita el crédito para invertir en mercadería y de  esta 
manera incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Daniel, age 26, is single and lives at home with his parents. He started his business for the sale of specially balanced bird feed in a town market, beginning with a small amount of capital from savings from his job as a veterinarian. Currently, he has opened another shop in Tinguiña, and he has grown his business with a lot of effort. He tends his shop and his his countryside clients in a very warm and friendly manner. He is requesting this loan in order to invest in more merchandise and increase his income as a result.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Germinia

texts.en:
Germinia A. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Germinia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Germinia owns & operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Germinia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Germinia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Germinia is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Germinia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: Née en 1953 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, T. Euphrasie vit depuis 39 ans environs au quartier Dandji à Cotonou. C'est une veuve qui est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés et qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Euphrasie n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Euphrasie prépare et vend de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Euphrasie achète ses matières premières. Euphrasie avait obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué les remboursements du crédit.Euphrasie voudrait préparer plus d'akassa par jour, pour mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est pour cette raison que Euphrasie sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1953 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. T. Euphrasie has been living for 39 years in the Dandji district in Cotonou.  She is a widow and the mother of six children, who have all had schooling and are no longer in her care.  Euphrasie never attended school.  To meet her needs, she makes and sells akassa (a local food made from corn starch) out of her home.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she purchases her ingredients.  Euphrasie had once obtained a loan from ALIDé and has accomplished the repayment of the loan.  She would like to make more akassa each day in order to cope with the customer demand and to increase her sales.  For these reasons, Euphrasie is requesting a second loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn for making akassa

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena de 31 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, por la falta de ingresos y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio Lorena invirtió sus ahorros hace 5 años en papelerías y vitrinas, también readecuo su casa para ubicar la papelería frente a su casa. 

Lorena a trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación durante los cinco años. Sus resultados han sido favorables para que siga con su papelería. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Vende cuadernos a $ 1.10, lápices $ 0.20, papelería etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, lápices y papelería para su negocio. En el futuro tener dos papelerías.
texts.en:
Lorena is 31 years old. She lives an urban area in Guasmo de Guayaquil. Lack of income and the desperate idea of having her own business caused Lorena to invest her savings five years ago in paper goods and display cases. She also altered her house in order to locate her stationery store in front of her house. Lorena has worked with effort and dedication during those five years. Her results have been favorable to continue with her stationery store. She works from 9:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She sells notebooks for $1.10, pencils for $0.20, and paper goods, etc. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, and paper goods for her business. In the future she wants to have two stationery stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks and pencils

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Esperanza” esta representado por la señora Eulalia y conformada por 12 miembros D. los cuales dos son varones y diez son mujeres, todos muy trabajadores y dinámicos como lo han demostrado en los cuatro ciclos que han trabajado con la institución creciendo mas y mas con cada préstamo. La señora Eulalia se dedica a la venta D. pollo crudo ella es madre D. familia y tienen tres hijos, ella es muy trabajadora ya que debe trasladar su mercadería hasta puerto Villarroel donD. tiene mayores clientes, una pequeña parte es vendida en el pueblo D. Ivirgarzama y el resto lo comercializa en el puerto, ella desea poder obtener el financiamiento para poder adquirir un vehículo para el trasporte D. su mercadería y poder generar mayores ganancias con su negocios. Una mayoría del resto del grupo se dedica a la venta D. pan, todo tipo D. masitas, tortas, empanadas y también todo tipo D. refrescos y algunas socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, ropa y gelatinas. En cuanto a la competencia no es alta ya que todos tienen cabida en un puerto que es frecuentemente visitado por turistas y trabajadores. El crédito será utilizado para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias y para darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos. Este es un banco comunal  ya tiene experiencia ya que este es su cuarto ciclo pero también  trabajaban con  otra entidades financiera similares cumpliendo a cabalidad con cada obligación financiera que tienen y mejorando cada día mas con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” (Hope) Group is represented by Eulalia and maD. up of 12 members, two men and ten women. They are all very hard-working and dynamic, as they have shown in the four cycles that they have worked with the institution, growing more and more with each loan. Eulalia sells raw chicken. She is a mother and has three children. She is very hard-working since she has to move her merchandise to Villarroel port where she has more customers. A small part of her merchandise is sold in the town of Ivirgarzama, and the rest is sold at the port. She wants the loan so she can acquire a vehicle to transport her merchandise and be able to generate greater earnings with her business. Most of the other group members sell bread, all types of pastries, cakes, empanadas and all types of soft drinks, and some members sell food, clothing and gelatinas (gelatin treats). As far as competition goes, it is not high since they all have places at a port that is frequently visited by tourists and workers. The loan will be used for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies and work tools that help generate greater income to support their families and to give their children a better quality of life. This communal bank already has experience since this is their fourth loan cycle, but they also worked with other similar financial institutions, conscientiously fulfilling each financial obligation they had and improving their businesses daily.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: María D. Jesús M. D. R. D. 45 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo en casa propia ubicada en ciudad delgado, él posee una sastrería desD. hace muchos años y por su excelente trabajo cuenta con muchos clientes. María trabaja desD. su casa en su negocio propio el cual es una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, en la que comercializa sus productos todos los días D. la semana, contando con varios clientes los cuales compran a diario. María desea poder surtir la tienda con productos muy necesarios para el hogar como detergentes líquidos y en polvo, así mismo comprar bolsitas D. shampoo, y productos comestibles como pan, huevos, frijoles y otros más, D. manera D. poder contar con todo lo más esencial para una tienda y que las personas buscan más, ya que D. esta forma ella podrá brindar un mejor servicio el cual le permita contar con más clientes. María es una señora muy visionaria quien desea ver en mejores condiciones su negocio, más surtido, y produciendo mayores ganancias, D. manera que ella pueda poseer una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
María D. Jesús M. D. R., age 45, lives with her husband in her own house, which is located in Delgado. He has had a tailor shop for many years. He has a lot of customers because of his excellent work. María works from her house in her own business, which is a store selling basic needs products. She sells her products everyday of the week. She has lots of customers who shop daily. María wishes to stock her store with much needed products for the home like liquid and powdered detergents. She will also buy small containers of shampoo and food products like eggs, beans, and other things. She will do this to be able to have all of the most essential and requested things in her store. This way she will be able to offer better service, which will allow her to have more customers. María is a very visionary woman who wishes to see her store in better condition, better stocked, and producing greater earnings. That way she will have better economic stability together with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Tutafika Group

texts.en:
Simoni A., age 28, is married with one daughter aged 4 years and 8 months. He has had a fish business for five years now. He works from 9am to 7pm daily and he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $380.

This will be Simoni ’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to develop his skills and his business -- for example, he completed driving lessons and he increased his fish stock. He has successfully paid back his loans.  

Simoni hopes for a loan to further increase his fish stock. His dream is to buy more fish, twice each day. For now he is making just one buying trip every day. 

Simoni is happy with his loans because his business is doing very well. He can even send his little child to a good school now. 

Simoni will share this loan with his loan group Tutafika, which totals 19 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Simoni is first on the left front.

loans.use: To increase his fish stock and develop his skills.

loans.name: Nargis Saleem's Group

texts.en:
Nargis Saleem is a resident of Murtaza Abad, which is located in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house with her husband and five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son runs a tea stall to financially assist his family. 
 
Nargis is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn an income. She is very efficient in her work. She manages her sewing business and her domestic work very efficiently. She gives the required time to her family and takes care of them very well.
 
Her husband sells clothes. He buys clothes from the wholesale markets of Faisalabad and Multan and sells them in his local market to earn an income. His business is going well, but as the time is passing very rapidly, so are changes in dresses and designs in the fashion field. His business demands he keep aware of the new fashions and fabrics.
  
Therefore, Nargis has applied for a loan from Asasah for the fifth time for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy stock in bulk and increase the profit of his business. She is a regular client of Asasah. In the previous four years of loan experience, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es:
El señor Constancio C. T. tiene 52 años de estado civil, viudo más de 2 años, de los 5 hijos solo está con él un hijo dependiente que estudia en nivel secundaria, la actividad  principal es la agricultura produce  papa, papa liza en su terreno que tiene 3 hectáreas en la comunidad de Kuri mayu, Don Constancio C. T. y su hijo viven en una comunidad Rural Kuri Mayu  a 62 km de la ciudad, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. 

El Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. Don Constancio C. T. nos comenta que la esposa falleció en un accidentes de tránsito cuando retornaba de la feria de Colomi después de la venta de los productos, Don Constancio lo que quiere, es que, su hijo menor estudie y que salga profesional como técnico en agronomía para luego trabajar y tener mejores ingresos dar el  cuidado y mantener a su padre cuando ya sea viejito así para ya no sufrir, y con el crédito va sembrar  la papa en mas superficie y va poder ahorrar dinero para que estudie su hijo.
texts.en:
Constancio is 52 years old and was widowed more than two years ago. Of his five children only one is dependent on him, a son who is in high school. Constancio makes a living growing potatoes on his 3 hectares of land in Kuri Mayu, a rural community 62 kilometers away from the city, so it is very difficult to be approved for a loan from a bank. Kiva partner Cidre took the initiative of going to this rural area. Constancio tells us that his wife died in a traffic accident while she was returning from the Colomi flea market after selling her products there. What Constancio wants is for his youngest son to finish his studies and become a professional like an agronomy technician so he can work and earn a good income so he can provide and care for him when he becomes an old man so he doesn't suffer. With the loan, he plans to plant more potatoes so he can be able to save money for his son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds and other supplies necessary for planting it

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis is a veteran electrician, having worked in this trade for the past forty years. He remembers one of his first projects as an electrician: on stage for jazz pianist Herbie Hancock. "He was using a lot of synthesizers and microphones, so it wasn't an easy job." Willis keeps a photo of Mr. Hancock hanging in his office in Oakland, California.
 
In 2007, after working as a union electrician with large companies for 34 years, Willis decided to open his own business: Special Electric Construction. He wanted the freedom to take on the projects he is most passionate about: industrial and public works, such as bridges, schools and public buildings. He also wanted to have more control over the decisions that are made around purchasing and managing project budgets. "I've seen so much waste in 34 years," he said.
 
As the son of a general contractor, Willis is proud to own a professional electrician business. “There are very few ‘mom-and-pop’ shops left,” he says, “because of the competition from larger players.” As a minority-owned business and a certified Small and Local Business, Willis's shop fulfills an important niche in the Bay Area.
 
Willis’s biggest challenge so far has been finding a line of credit to support the upfront costs of larger projects. He sought a small business loan from his bank but, despite being a home-owner and successful businessman, he couldn’t qualify for a loan because he had never borrowed on credit cards and usually avoids taking on debt. When he saw Opportunity Fund’s small business loan program featured on the local news, he decided to apply.
 
With a $5,000 loan, his first from Opportunity Fund, Willis will purchase and install exhaust fans in a building he is working on in Oakland. The loan will act as the line of credit he needs to purchase these costly items before his clients pay him for the job. In addition, this loan will ensure that he is able to start establishing a credit history for his business.

loans.use: To purchase and install exhaust fans in a building he is working on

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie B. is into farming to support his family. He and his family lives in Sto. Niño, a town in South Cotabato. He and his wife help each other in tilling the land, hoping for a good harvest.

Gerlie applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money will be use to acquire seed and fertilizer. They are expecting a better yield on their crops for having the means now to buy the needed farming maintenance.

Any income derived from this business will be spent on Gerlie’s family’s daily consumption and on future business investment.

loans.use: To acquire seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Rumbo Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Cuando Rosa formo su familia  pensó en hacer algo para ayudar a su esposo, anteriormente hiso varios trabajos  pero por dedicarse a su hijita  quería hacer algo en su misma casa, cuando su  esposo recibió un dinero producto de las utilidades de su trabajo ambos pensaron en utilizar ese dinero para invertirlo en algún negocio  así deciden poner una bodega lo hicieron con muy pocas cosas pero con muchas ganas de trabajar ahora ya tienen  cerca de 3 años con el negocio  aun cuando hay varias bodegas cerca de la suya han logrado tener muchos clientes que siempre acuden a su negocio para realizar sus compras, Rosa vende productos de pan llevar como arroz, azúcar, fideos, bebidas etc. Su negocio ha prosperado mucho  ahora tiene mas cosas para ofrecer a su clientela y lo que le ha sido de gran ayuda han sido sus prestamos de EDAPROSPO esto le sirve para seguir comprando mas productos para tener variedad.
 sus ganancias le han ayudado para tener algunas comodidades dentro de su hogar, mas adelante quiere lograr tener una tienda mas amplia y grande para convertirla en un minimarket ,actualmente ella es la secretaria del grupo “RUMBO AL ÉXITO”  formado por 8 socias vecinas de ventanilla.

*Rosa es la 4ta de las paradas esta con polo celeste.
texts.en:
When Rosa started her family she thought of doing something to help her husband. She previously worked in different jobs but she wanted to do something from her own home to be able to dedicate herself to her daughter. When her husband received money from his work, they both thought of using it to invest in a business, so they decided to set up a grocery store. They started with a few items but they had a lot of desire to work and they have now had the business for almost three years. Although there are several grocery stores nearby, they have been able to attract many customers that always come to their store to do their shopping. Rosa sells basic items such as rice, sugar, pasta, drinks, etc. Her business has done very well and she now has more items to offer to her customers. What have been of great help are the loans from EDAPROSPO, which help her to continue purchasing more products to have variety.

Her earnings have helped her to obtain some comforts in her home. In the future, she wants to have a larger store and convert it into a mini-market. She is currently the secretary of the ‘Rumbo al éxito’ communal bank, which consists of eight members who are neighbors. * Rosa is the fourth one from the left with the blue top.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elisa Trinidad

texts.es: Elisa Trinidad R. C. de 47 años de edad, reside junto a su madre en el departamento de San Salvador. Elisa trabaja muy duro día con día comercializando ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa de forma ambulante, así mismo comercializa cuadros y portarretratos. Ella recorre grandes distancias para poder vender por lo menos la mitad de su mercadería diaria, de esta manera ella se asegura poder obtener ganancias las cuales no solo le permitan solventar los gastos de la casa, sino también, seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, lo cual en muchas ocasiones es algo difícil. Es por esto que Elisa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda poseer el dinero necesario para comprar más ropa.
texts.en: Elisa Trinidad R. C. is 47 years old and lives together with her mother in the San Salvador department. Elisa works very hard day to day selling clothing for men, women and children. She sells door to door, and also sells paintings and photoframes. Elisa covers large distances to be able to sell at least half of her stock every day, and in this way she is sure she can obtain earnings which not only let her cover her household costs but also continue investing in her business, which on many occasions is very difficult. Is it for this reason that Elisa is seeking a loan with which to have the necessary money to purchase more clothing.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man with one child in school. He rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his child.

He has operated his video show and barber shop business for over four years and most of his customers are neighbours and passersby. Kevin faces a challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a television screen, movies and hair chemicals for his barber shop. Kevin decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a television, movies and hair chemicals for his barber shop.

loans.name: Trần

texts.en:
Sự Trần Thị (20213020012) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children.  

To make a living, Sự owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Sự has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Sự joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sự has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  

Sự is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  Sự plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her  business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sự Trần Thị (20213020012) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Sự Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Sự thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sự kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Sự đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sự đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Sự dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To buy young livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta Lilian C. de 39 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hija mayor de edad, un nieto y su yerno, Marta se dedica a la elaboración de quesadillas, un pan tradicional el cual posee muy buena demanda. Desde hace 10 años que trabaja de esta manera para ganarse la vida, por lo que posee muchos clientes, a los cuales les reparte las quesadillas a domicilio. Marta es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que es esta su única fuente de ingresos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima como: queso, harina, semillas de ajonjolí y otras más para elaborar más quesadillas y atender mayor cantidad de pedidos para esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Marta Lilian C. is 39 years of age and lives in Mejicanos,  which i  in the San Salvador department . She lives with her grown up daughter, her grandson, and her son-in-law. Over the last ten years Marta has earned a living making quesadillas, a traditional type of bread which is very popular.  Because she has worked in this business for so long, Marta has many customers, and she delivers the quesadillas to their door. 

Marta is a very responsible and hardworking person who has high hopes of improving her business as it is her only source of income. For this reason she is requesting a loan to purchase all of the necessary quesadilla ingredients including cheese, flour and sesame seeds, among others, so she can make more quesadillas and cater for a more orders for this Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make quesadillas

loans.name: José Amadeo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
Aquí conocimos a don José, él está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque en las charlas aprende mucho y además porque los créditos le sirven de mucha ayuda. Tiene 55 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 14 años que estudia en colegio. Nos cuenta que además con su primera esposa que falleció hace muchos años tuvo tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su mujer se dedica a las labores del hogar.
 
Tiene un negocio  de transporte escolar de lunes a viernes,  los sábados y domingos se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado en la feria libre. Nos cuenta que realiza dos a cuatro viajes diarios para dejar a los alumnos tanto en sus colegios como también en su casa cuando ya salen de sus colegios, nos cuenta que lleva prestando este servicio ya por 8años y que esto le ha servido para sacar a su familia adelante. Y que vende sus frutas porque en la actualidad con lo que gana en el transporte no le es suficiente y esto le representa ganancias extras.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas, verduras y legumbres. Su sueño es ver que su hijo menor sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'Las Américas' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet José.  He has been a member of the community bank for two loan cycles and he likes it because he learns a lot from the talks and the loans are very helpful.  José is 55 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has a 14 year old son who is in high school.  He tells us that he had three children with his first wife who died many years ago.  These children are already grown up and independent.  His wife looks after the household chores.

José has a school transport business in which he works from Monday to Friday.  On Saturdays and Sundays he sells fruit and vegetables in the farmers' market.  He tells us that he makes two to four journeys a day to drop his students off both in their schools and at home when they get out of school.  He tells us that he has been providing this service for 8 years and that this has helped him to get his family ahead in life.  He says that he sells fruit because currently his income from the transport business isn't enough and the fruit sales make him extra money.

This loan will be used to buy more fruit, greens and vegetables.  His dream is to see his youngest son become a great professional.

loans.use: To buy fruit, greens and vegetables

loans.name: Nueva Organización Group

texts.es:
Rafaelita  Sánchez García, vive en la localidad de San Vicente, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con  dos hijos a su responsabilidad y son: Ángel de Jesús de diecisiete  años y el otro es Carlos Fabián de catorce se años de edad.
Rafaela se dedica a elaborar panes y solicitó el préstamo para apoyarse comprando ingredientes que más le hacen falta para realizarlo, con esta actividad lleva veintiséis años, el cual está contenta porque con ello a sacado adelante a sus dos hijos que son lo mas importante para ella.
Se inspiró en esta actividad ya que su mamá le enseñó y desde el momento que inició lo ha estado practicando ya que le parece que es un trabajo bonito de donde se obtiene buenos ingresos y con estos ingresos ella apoya a sus hijos que están estudiando.
Con lo que va obteniendo de su trabajo compra mas ingredientes para realizar su actividad que tanto le gusta y de los mosmo ingresos ella pagará puntualmente sus pagos con Fundación Realidad.
Su más grande sueño es que con el tiempo logre agrandar su panadería, pues no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie más que la bendición de dios y su trabajo para salir adelante.
Ella formó el grupo pero descanso un ciclo y hoy de nuevo esta en el programa, el grupo se llama "Nueva Organización" ya que es un grupo nuevo en donde se integraron nuevas personas que también ya han estado en el programa.
      Las personas que integran el grupo son:
*Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, como tambien la compra y venta de pimienta.
*Rafaelita Sánchez García: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar panes.
*Cirila Sánchez M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de productos agrícolas.
*Vivian Ibis S. G.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas que compra en  la mesilla.
*María del Carmen Reyes López: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.
*Sarita M. López: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pimienta para luego venderlo seco.
texts.en:
Rafaelita Sánchez Garcíá lives in the San Vicente area of the Copainala district, in the Mexican state of Chiapas. She is a single mother with two dependent children: 17-year old Ángel de Jesús and 14-year old Carlos Fabián.
Rafaela earns her living by baking bread and is requesting the loan to help buy the essential ingredients for this activity. She has been making bread for 26 years, and it makes her happy because it has allowed her to provide for her two children, who are the most important thing in the world to her.
She was inspired to take up this trade when her mother taught her it, and she has been doing it ever since. She enjoys the work and says it provides a good income that enables her to support her children, who are in school.
The profits she makes from her work allow her to buy more ingredients, enabling her to do the work she enjoys so much. With that income she will also make punctual repayments to the Fundación Realidad.
Her biggest dream is to expand her bakery over time, since she has nobody to support her except God's blessing and her own hard work to move her forward.
She formed the group but had a break for one cycle and is now back in the programme. The group is called "Nueva Organización" (New Organisation), as it is a new group made up of new people who have also been in the programme.
      The group's members are:
*Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García: is investing the loan in buying goods to stock his grocery shop, and also in the purchase and sale of pepper.
*Rafaelita Sánchez García: will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients for baking bread.
*Cirila Sánchez M.: is investing the loan in the purchase and sale of agricultural products.
*Vivian Ibis S. G.: is investing the loan in the purchase and sale of clothes, which she will buy in La Mesilla.
*María del Carmen Reyes López: will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients for baking bread.
*Sarita M. López: is investing the loan in the purchase of pepper to dry and sell.

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Rosa Alejandrina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial. La localidad pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Rosa ofrece sus productos  tanto al crédito como al contado y siempre trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes por lo que en el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio este ha empezado a contar con buena acogida. Ella complementa sus ingresos con la venta de ropa y abarrotes Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio adquiririendo mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old, single, and lives with her family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with a fair amount of commercial activity, which is located in Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosa runs a small grocery store in her home.  There she offers her customers different staples and groceries.  Rosa offers her products both on credit and for cash and she always tries to provide her customers with good service which is why her business is now very popular.  Rosa supplements her income by selling clothes as well.  She uses the profits that she makes from this activity to cover her personal expenses and help her family financially.

Rosa would like to expand her business, acquiring merchandise so that she can meet her current demand.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business, acquiring merchandise to meet her current demand

loans.name: Adalia

texts.en:
Adalia L. is from the village of Camarag, San Isidro. She is 54 years old. Adalia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adalia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adalia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Adalia is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Adalia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Tawopaneh Group" from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadiatu K.. She was born in the village of Masanga in northern Sierra Leone 27 years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. Kadiatu sells medicines and clothes. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now. With her share of this loan she will buy more medicines and clothes to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicines and clothes to add to her business

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ricardina; la socia tiene 54 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida ,la socia trabaja de forma independiente esto es uno de los motivos que le hace sentir bien ya que mediante este negocio la socia puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro los días sábados de feria también se va a las distintas ferias que se realiza en Cusco y en el Valle Sagrado de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, leche menestras entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ricardina belongs to the Chaska Ñahui Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, and the Cusco department.

Ricardina is 54 years old, married, and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling food.  She works in an independent manner, which is one of the reasons she feels good.  Through this business she is able to spend more time with her children.  She sells in an itinerant manner at the Huancaro market on Saturday, which is the day of the fair.  Also, she goes to different fairs in Cusco and the Valle Sagrado.  That way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her business.  She will buy things like rice, sugar, milk, and vegetables, among other things.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business like rice, sugar, milk, and vegetables, among other things

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a resident of Nyamira in western Kenya. He is married with two children, both of whom attend school. He has worked in mixed farming for five years.  Through his work, he produces milk that he sells locally and tea that he sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He has employed one farmhand.  He is focusing on constructing a zero grazing unit over the next five years. His main challenges are drought and disease, both of which affect his production.

Innocent has requested a 45,000Kes loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes the income from this loan will enable him expand his retail business, which will in turn provide him with additional income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rita

texts.ar: ريتا في عمر 35 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع فساتين الأعراس والسهرات لها في عملها 5 سنوات تحب عملها وتجيده كثيرا لها تاريخ جيد في العمل ولها زبائن كثر من محيطها جيرانها وهي تتميز بالتجدد والتطور تحب عملها وتريد دائما التحسين والتقدم فهي طموحة محبة للعمل والنشاط تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء فساتين جديدة للموسم الصيفي حتى تتمكن من مواكبة المواسم حيث انها تعتمد على الموسم الصيفي في الاعراس والحفلات
texts.en: Rita is 35 years old and unmarried. She works selling wedding and evening dressing. She has been doing this for five years, is skillful and loves her work. Her business has a good history and she has many local customers. She is always seeking improvement and progress and she is very ambitious. She loves being active and loves her business. With this loan she wants to purchase new summer clothing stock in order to keep up to date with the season. She depends on getting more customers in summer due to weddings and parties.

loans.use: to buy new summer clothing stock

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a resident of Mian Channu, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Rasheedan owns a single-room house and has been living in it with her family in the area of Mehrabad for the past 22 years. She is a very helpful person, always willing to help her family in difficult times. Her husband's name is M. R.. He is a mason by profession. Rasheedan is a housewife and stays at home and does her household work. She is the mother of 6 sons and a daughter. Only one of her sons is able to attend school due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son constructs houses, a second one is a factory worker, a third helps his father in his business, and a fourth one sells crockery.

Rasheedan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to buy masonry tools to provide better quality services to his customers. He has been operating this business for the past 5 years and Rasheedan is confident that he will be able to put his business in a better position with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: to buy masonry tools

loans.name: Luz Veña

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Veña; ella tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de aves y también la socia trabaja en una piñatería (es una tienda donde venden artículos para fiestas de cumpleaños), el negocio de crianza de aves los realiza con su papa, ellos crían patos y gallinas y luego lo venden en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de aves. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para las aves.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the  “LAS TRIUNFADORAS” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

The assocate is Señora Luz Veña.  She is 20 years of age and single.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the business of raising birds and the associate also works in a piñatería (a store where they sell articles for birthday parties).  She runs the business of breeding birds with her father.  They raise ducks and chickens and then they sell them independently.  The associate wants to expand the bird breeding business.  The associate requests the loan to buy food for the birds.  

The associate is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy food for her birds.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina  se dedica a vender perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos y ropa de diferentes catálogos. Ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la Fundación para surtir su negocio y tener en existencia productos. Ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 2 años y dice que emprendió este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa ya que sus hijas están estudiando una carrera técnica y tiene muchos gastos con ellas. Comenta que ella vende sus productos a conocidas ya que vende sus productos en pagos. Ella sale a surtirse a la cuidad de México. Doña Cristina esta casada con el señor Enrique el cual es músico y tiene dos hijas de 17 y 19 años. ella esta contenta por el préstamo que le están realizando por que así puede tener su negocio surtido y sus clientas le compran mas si tiene los productos a la mano. La meta que tiene doña Cristina es comprar una motoneta para moverse rápido en su población y no perder tiempo ya que vive un poco retirado del centro y se le complica ir de un lado a otro.
texts.en:
Cristina sells perfume, creams, cosmetics, shoes and clothes from various catalogues.  She is asking the Fundación for a loan to stock her business to have products on hand.  She’s been in business for about 2 years and she says she started it to help her husband with household expenses since her daughters are studying technical careers and there are many costs associated with them.

She comments that she sells her products to acquaintances because she sells on credit.  She goes to Mexico City to stock up. Cristina is married to Enrique, who is a musician, and she has two daughters who are 17 and 19 years old.  

She is happy with the loan she’s taking out because she will be able to have her business stocked better and her customers buy more if she has the products on hand.  Cristina’s goal is to buy a motorbike to get around her community quickly and not lose so much time because she lives a bit far from downtown and getting from one place to another is complicated.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothes, shoes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for 20 years. She started with capital of 700,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is debtors, and her vision is a bigger business plus educating her children. Margret needs the loan to buy hair chemicals and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de meriendas y tortillas, tiene 6 años de trabajar con este negocio que hasta hoy ha sido la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para apoyarse junto a su esposo y juntos velar por las necesidades del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para las meriendas como: pollo, carnes, frijoles, arroz, aceite y condimentos, también maíz para las tortillas, con esta ayuda contara con todo lo necesario para su negocio.
El objetivo de Teresa es que a través de su esfuerzo, sus hijos puedan estudiar y preparase para mejorar sus oportunidades.
texts.en:
Teresa lives together with her husband and two children aged 13 and 10.  Her business is selling snacks and tortillas.  She has been working in this business for six years and it has been the source of income with which she has supported her family, together with her husband's help.

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making her snacks such as chicken, meat, beans, rice, oil and condiments.  She will also buy corn for making her tortillas.  With this help, she will have everything she needs for her business.

Teresa's goal is to work hard so that her children can study and prepare themselves in order to improve their opportunities.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, beans, rice, oil, condiments and corn

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, hace 2 años inicio su negocio Taller de soldadura “Don Pepe” donde realiza variedad de trabajos de herrería como lo es puertas, protecciones todo a la medida requerida del cliente y color.  El negocio se encuentra ubicado al intemperie donde solamente hay una lamina que  cubre su área de trabajo por lo que el opto por poner la losa, para estar mas protegido y no sufrir alguna insolación lo cual ocasiones algún problemas mas serio. Para realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra ya que de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando sin ningún problema ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
José Antonio is a very hard-working and responsible man.  He started his business, a soldering shop called “Don Pepe”, two years ago.  He does a variety of ironwork like doors and protections.  He does it all to the size and color that the customer requires.

His business is in the open air, and there is only laminate sheeting covering his work area.  That is why he decided to install flagstone in order to be more protected.  He also made this decision so that he will not suffer from exposure to the sun, which could cause a more serious problem.

In order to carry out his project he needs to buy construction material and to pay for the labor.  This way he will be able to continue working without any problem.  This is his only source of income.

loans.use: to install flagstone for his business.

loans.name: Kiloja

texts.en:
Kiloja is 29-years old, married and has two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds and also land preparation). 

With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. 

He dreams to be prominent farmer. 

He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos, ella vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes lugares como Urubamba y Calca, ella los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende al por mayor, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the "Reyna de los Ángeles de Urquillos" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province and Cusco department. 

Tomasa is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising chickens.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor, transporting her goods to different places such as Urubamba and Calca.  She fattens and grows her chickens and then sells them wholesale.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her chicken business and is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.

Tomasa is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 39 years old and is married to a farmer. Together they raise their two children well and send them to school for their bright future. As farmers working in the Philippines, this couple is earning P30,000 average net income every crop season during the months of April through November .

They grow rice and have been doing this for 10 years. Madelyn is asking for a loan of P10,000 to pay for labor fees and to buy seeds and fertilizers for the  maintenance of their farm.  They hope to eventually improve their crop production. 

In the future, Madelyn hopes to make a consistent increase of profits to uplift her family's living condition.  She also wants to save some of their income for the studies of her children.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees and to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 45-year-old father of five children. He plies his food sales business in Ibanda district in western Uganda.

He has been in this business, where he mostly sells bananas, for 16 years. 

Jackson is described by friends as God-fearing and hard working. The fact that he has a farm on which he grows and harvests bananas to resell has been an added advantage.
 
Despite the fact that he has faced some financial hardships along the way, his recourse has invariably been determination and diligence.

On the side, Jackson also sells coffee. Monthly, he says, his sales profits add up to Ugandan shillings 220,000.

Jackson says he intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase better hoes, pangas, manure, etc to use on his banana farm.

loans.use: to purchase better hoes, pangas, manure, etc to use on his banana farm.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda, a 55-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has a retail shop that sells vegetables such as squash and eggplant. In  business for 20 years, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables to sell.  Rosalinda, a new member of HSPFI, hopes to improve her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BARA est composé de quatre femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles à Massablacoura un des quartiers de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de l’arachide, de poissons  et avec la présidente Aminata pour le commerce de condiments. Elle est  la première à droite et a sous ses pieds une assiette pleine de condiments.   
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Aminata compte acheter, 1 carton de cube Maggi, 1 panier de tomates fraîches et 20 Kg d’oignons. 
Elle s’approvisionne au marché de BOUGOUNI  auprès des grossistes  et effectue sa vente de façon ambulante dans le quartier en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en: The BARA group is made up of four married women, who are on average 24 years old and who have on average 2 children. They live in traditional families in Massablacoura, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). They are neighbors. In an attempt to satisfy their clientele and to grow their business, they decided to incorporate microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in their businesses of selling peanuts and fish, and with their president, Aminata, who sells seasoning. She is the first one on the right, and next to her feet, there is a dish full of seasonings. They are on their second group loan and the previous loan was repaid. With this new loan, Aminata plans to buy 1 box of Maggi cubes (soup flavoring), 1 basket of fresh tomatoes, and 20 kg. of onions. She stocks up at the Bougouni market with wholesalers and sells door to door in the neighborhood for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she plans to earn 25,000 FCFA monthly, of which part will be used to repay the loan and pay for family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mrs.Ven is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray District of Kompong Thom Province. She has married Mr. Chea who is a rice cultivator. They have given birth to two kids who are living under their care. To make a living, Mrs. Ven sells different kinds of goods in her community. She can earn about $3 USD per day in her selling business. Mrs. Ven sells basic necessities, for example milk, rice, oil, toilet paper, eggs, some fruit, etc. To upgrade to a comfortable life, her husband has decided with her to purchase a plowing machine but they do not have enough cash to buy one. So Mrs. Ven and her husband are requesting a loan through HKL, a partner with Kiva, to purchase a plowing machine to help support in farming business as well as use for transportation firewood to sell in the marketplace. Mrs. Ven is expecting that this loan will make her family earn more benefits. In the future, she hopes to send her children to study at the university.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine to help support in farming business as well as use for transportation firewood to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Don Reynaldo, vive en  unión libre con la señora  María Teresa  y con quien procreo  un hijo de la edad de dos años, ellos llevan 5 años de casados.

     El solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mantas por kilo y luego elaborar camisas y blusas para bordar en lo que salen a vender en la ciudad de san Cristóbal de la casas y así mismo compra mas material para seguir trabajando.

    En esta actividad lleva practicando  seis años y cuatro meses en la que el comenta que le va muy bien ya que ha visto un gran rendimiento en su negocio y ganancias para su familia.
 
    Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo  que solicito pueda ir  mejorando, día con día su actividad así con el tiempo  comprar otra máquina para trabajar más días a la semana.
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives with his common-law wife María Teresa.  The couple have a two-year-old son.  They have been together for five years.

Reynaldo requested this loan to invest in buying calico by the kilo.  He will use this to make shirts and blouses to be embroidered.  He goes out to sell his goods in the city of San Cristóbal de la Casas.  He will buy more material so that they can continue working.

Reynaldo has been in this business for six years and four months.  He says that things are going very well as his business is performing well and making good profits for his family.

What Reynaldo would like is to use the loan that he has requested to keep improving his business.  Over time, he would like to buy another machine so that he can work more days a week.

loans.use: to buy threads and calico so that he can embroider shirts and blouses

loans.name: Ana  Tau

texts.en:
Ana is 52 years of age and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling fast foods.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    Ana needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or $104 per week) to improve the business.

In 2011, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.
