*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is a basket-weaver. She is 54 years old and has 5 children. Tita uses "buri" (a type of palm) to make her baskets. People in her town sell dried buri and she buys from them. Tita requested a loan to purchase more "buri" and other materials for basket-weaving. Tita hopes for her business to grow. She plans to make improvements to their house with her profit.

loans.use: to purchase more "buri" and other materials for basket-weaving

loans.name: Robertha Lisseth

texts.es: Robertha Lisseth se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 15 años que tiene este medio de vida. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad en sus productos, ella tiene que alistarse todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, que regresa a su vivienda ha sido con el paso del tiempo que Robertha ha mejorado cada día. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, entre otros.
texts.en: Roberta Lisseth has operated a general retail business for more than 15 years.  Her customers want a variety of products so she has to work hard to stock the kinds of merchandise they want.  She starts getting ready each day at 7:00am and works until 9:00pm when she can finally go home.  The business has allowed her to slowly improve her quality of life.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise--footwear, cosmetics, clothing, etc.--that she will resell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
CHEIKH HABITE AU SUD AGE DE 41 ANS CELIBATAIR SANS ENFANTS DEPUIS 1984 , IL EST DANS  LE METIER ARTISSE EN MEME TEMPS COMMERCE D'HABITS.AVEC CE CREDIT , CHEIKH VEUT RENFORCER SON ACTIVITE , CONFECTION DE TABLEAUX D'ARTS , PUISQUE NOUS SOMMES DANS PERIODE TOURISTIQUE C'EST LE MOMENT OU LES PRODUITS D'ARTS MARCHENT BIEN VERS LE COP SKIRING ZONE OU IL VENT SES PRODUITS.AVEC SON METIER , IL ARRIVE A ENVOYER UNE SOMME D'ARGENT A LA FAMILLE AU NORD POUR LA NOURRITURE.
CHEIKH DANS L'AVENIR VEUT FAIRE LE REPORTAGE DE DOCUMENTAIRE,DE LA MUSIQUE?
texts.en:
Cheikh lives in southern Senegal. He is 41 years old, single and has no children. He has been earning a living as an artist since 1984, and also sells clothes.

Cheikh will use this loan to invest in his art business. He is currently focussing on creating paintings because the tourist season is ongoing and art works sell well during this period, particularly in the Cap Skirring area where he sells his wares. His income also allows him to send some money to his family in the north of the country, for food.

In the future, Cheikh would like to make documentaries and maybe music.

loans.use: buy supplies for his art business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 39 years old and lives in Paynesville.  She’s married and her husband is a businessman.  Together they have two children, one of whom lives at home and attends school.

Hawa sells oil and pepper and has had her business for ten years.  She was taught how to run a business by her mother.  Her main challenge in business is how to cope with increases in wholesale prices of the things she sells.  She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more oil and pepper. In future, she hops to build her own house and to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and pepper

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa est une femme mariée agée de 54 ans  mère de 6 enfants et 3 autres qui lui sont confiés.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 02/08/2008 ou elle occupe actuellement le poste de présidente.
Awa fait parti du groupe de solidarité takku liguey.

Son activité génératrice de revenu reste le commerce dans la vente de petit déjeuner (restauration) une activité qu elle maitrise bien pour l avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.

Son nouveau prêt de 500000 francs Cfa lui permettra de financer son activité de restauration en achetant du pain des haricots du sucre du lait ...

Les bénéfices qu'elle aura réalisé lui permettront de payer la scolarité de ses enfants mais également de payer des ordonnances pour ses enfants en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Awa is 54 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She is also taking care of 3 more. She is the president of the Banc Villageois and has been a member since August 2nd, 2008. She is also a member of the solidarity group Takku Liguey.

Awa is an experienced restaurateur and has been earning a living selling breakfasts for a long time. She will use the loan of 500 000 francs to buy the ingredients she needs to make the breakfasts, such as bread, beans, sugar and milk. 

Awa will use her profits to pay for her children´s education and for any medical bills they may incur.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as bread, beans, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Gisele

texts.fr:
Cliente de 52 ans, célibataire avec 3 enfants a sa charge, elle se lance dans le commerce des sous vêtements il ya de cela 23 ans, ayant déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts, elle a fait ses remboursements sans difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables.
 Ces prêts ont grandement contribue a son épanouissement familiale. Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va acheter des douzaines de slips hommes, des sous vêtements des femmes, des enfants et des maillots de corps, qu'elle commande a Douala, Nigeria et la Chine. Elle expose ses sous vêtements pour attirer sa cliente, elle fait la vente a crédit des ses articles. Dans l’avenir, elle pense ouvrir une boutique de lingerie et elle s'occupe valablement de ses enfants.
texts.en: The client is 52 years old, single, and with three children in her care.  She began in the sale of undergarments more than 23 years ago.  Having already benefited from several loans, she has made her repayments without difficulty and has earned considerable savings.  These loans have hugely contributed to her family's development.  With this new loan, she is going to buy dozens of men's undershorts, women and children's underclothing and bathing suits, which she orders from Douala, Nigeria and China.  She displays her merchandise of undergarments to attract her clientele, and she sells her items for credit.  In the future, she thinks that she will open a lingerie boutique and she takes excellent care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of undergarments, undershorts and bras

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has nine children between the ages of 14 and 27, all of whom attend school. For the past five years Kuma has been selling cosmetics. She makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics her business. Kumba plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y verduras, vive con su hermana y una tía, además es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años, el negocio de Reina es la venta de tortillas y verduras, tiene además crianza de cerdos en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora, que se esfuerza por mantener ingresos para su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, papas, güisquiles, plátanos, tomates, cebollas, estos productos para fortalecer el negocio con verdura fresca, con la compra de maíz al por mayor tendrá la materia prima necesaria para aumentar la producción de las tortillas.
La aspiración de Reina es que su negocio crezca, brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Reina sells tortillas and vegetables. She lives with her sister and an aunt and is also a single mother of a 4 year old daughter. As well as selling tortillas and vegetables she raises pigs in her home. She is a hardworking woman who commits herself to maintain an income for her family.

At the moment she is requesting the loan to buy corn, potatoes, whiskey, bananas, tomatoes, and onions so she can offer fresh products and with the purchase of wholesale corn can make more tortillas. Reina's goal is to grow her business and offer he daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn, potatoes, whiskey, bananas, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Joséphine est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Germain. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Joséphine assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Joséphine n'a pas fréquenté  l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et aux besoins de ses enfants, Joséphine vend depuis une quinzaine d’année de la nourriture accompagnée de boissons et ceci de façon secondaire dans sa région. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Joséphine sollicite pour une quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et des boissons.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en: Christine is a group leader; aged 34.She is married with 4 children aged between 2 and 9 years. The group is called ABADAHEMUKA which means “PEOPLE OF INTEGRITY” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their future. She has a shop and has been running in a business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and juice for sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and juice for sell.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia Del Carm

texts.en: I am the owner of a small grocery shop that sells basic staples and other popular products such as milk, bread, lard, soda, candies amongst others. Iâ€™ve had my business for the past two years and itâ€™s the only shop in my community. Because of this I have a high demand and I need to restock with products that will be easily sold. I use the earnings from my store in order to keep my children in primary and secondary school.

loans.use: Buying lard, soap, candies, cookies, soda, bread and gum

loans.name: Elvia Patricia

texts.en:
Patty is 33 years old and is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo León. She is a married mother of two children. Some time ago she started her own auto parts shop, taking advantage of the knowledge and experience of her husband Oscar, who for many years has been employed by another auto parts store. Three years ago, driven by the need for extra income to supplement her husband's wages, and utilizing his experience in the field of auto parts, she decided to start her own business. At first her selection was small but it has been growing steadily along with size of the clientele.

She is in need of a loan of $475 to purchase a cabinet which will allow her to better display her products and also increase her inventory. Remember that Patty needs your support. You have the opportunity to help her, so don't hesitate. She will appreciate it always.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Patty tiene 33 años, originaria D. Monterrey Nuevo León, es casada y madre D. dos hijos. Hace tiempo que inició su propio negocio, una refaccionaría, aprovechando los conocimientos y experiencia D. su esposo Oscar, quien durante muchos años ha sido empleado D. otra refaccionaría. Es así como hace tres años con la necesidad D. emprender una actividad que le generará un ingreso extra al sueldo D. sus esposo y con la experiencia que el tiene en el ámbito D. las refacciones decidió iniciar su negocio, el cual comenzó con poco surtido y ha ido creciendo poco a poco, incrementando también su número D. clientes.

Ella necesita un crédito para la compra D. un mueble que le permita exhibir mejor sus productos y también incrementar sus inventarios, por la cantidad D. $ 475 DLLS. Recuerda que Paty necesita apoyo y tú tienes la posibilidad D. ayudarla, no lo duD. más, ella te lo va agradecer siempre.

loans.use: Purchase equipment

loans.name: Maghfor

texts.en:
Maghfor D/O M. Anwar was born in 1956 and lives in District 6 of Kabul City. She and her son run a property dealer shop which helps people find homes, cars, buildings, etc. to rent or buy. She is in her first loan cycle with AFSG and will use this money to purchase furniture for their business. Maghfor is illiterate because she wasn't able to take on studies during the wars. She wishes to help her family financially, and she is grateful the AFSG loan program that is making it possible for she and her son to grow their business.

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her shop

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat S. is 41 years old and is a widow with 5 children. She lives in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. She works very hard to support the entire family, especially her children's education. In order to service in her family's expense, S. runs a small booth at a market selling fruits and typically makes in average about $2 per day in revenue, which is barely enough to supplement the household.  S. made a decision to request for the loan amount of $200 to help increase her inventory by purchasing more fruits to meet the recent demand of her clients. She would be  very happy and grateful if the loan gives her an opportunity to grow her business as well as increasing the size of her income. In the future, S. hopes to expand her business with many kinds of fruits to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to invest in her business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: "I am happy to be LAPO client", says Mrs. Faith B., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells wood and has been in this business since 1997. She is a leader of her union and hopes to buy more wood with the requested loan. Mrs. Faith is 49 years old, married with 5 children.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
For 2 years, Lorenza C. has had a small business selling purses, sunglasses, caps, and other items in the street markets in the city where she lives. She has many customers because she sells her items for good prices.

She has many orders for goods, and she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more items. She supports herself and her children with the money she earns in this business.

loans.use: Purchase purses, wallets, and other items to sell

loans.name: Mummy Fatou

texts.en: Mummy is a mother of 7 children. At the age of 50 years, she runs a small grocery in the open air market of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Married to a daily laborer, Mummy has to work hard to generate enough income to meet the family’s expenses. With her previous loans, she increased her stock. She is planning to increase her stock and diversify her business so that her husband could also participate in selling of other items in the village. This, she said, “could enable them to generate sufficient income for the family.”  She is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: Increase her stock and diversify her business.

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer K. sells milk and wants a loan to purchase another fridge to increase her business and start another small business. She cares for 4 children of which two are orphans.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for milk

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en: Bahar is 40 years old, and a local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She breeds cattle in her yard together with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. They also sell milk and other diary products. Bahar wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle for the family business.

loans.name: Hospital East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Babirye Z.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Babirye is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a cattle trader. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Babirye makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Babirye has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Babirye is joined in her small group by Ruth Namugere and Milly N.. Ruth Namugere has a business in charcoal selling and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Milly N. is currently operating a business selling potatoes and wants a loan to increase the stock of potatoes.

loans.use: To add to charcoal business

loans.name: Diocelina

texts.es:
Mrs Diocelina González García is a member of the Banco Comunal Picota. She lives in San Martín, in Picota province, Picota district, in the area Las Almendras Manzana H, Lot 12. She sells maize wholesale and retail, banana flour, business which she carries out in her own home. In order to produce the banana flour she uses a small electric machine. She also has a business selling dry maize which is profitable, with a high demand both within and outside Picota. With the requested loan of S/ 1500.00 which she would pay back within 6 months, she will buy dry maize by the tonne to be marketed in nutritionally-balanced food factories. She is 49 years old, with 5 children, 3 of whom still live with her. She feels well in herself and happy to be achieving what she has always wanted, a developing business, seeing her children grow up to be professionals. In the future she wants to have premises to be able to store the maize she has bought large quantities of.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Diocelina González García es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, domiciliada en la urbanización Las Almendras Manzana H, Lote 12, se dedica a la venta de maíz al por mayor y menor , harina de plátano negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Para producir la harina de plátano utiliza una pequeña maquina eléctrica, también tiene el negocio de la venta de maíz seco que es rentable, con mucha demanda tanto dentro y fuera de Picota, Con el préstamo solicitado S/ 1500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara maíz seco en toneladas para ser comercializado en las fabricas de alimentos balanceados Tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 viven con ella, se siente bien y contenta de estar logrando lo que siempre quiso, que su negocio salga adelante y ver a sus hijos profesionales, en el futuro piensa poner un local para ir almacenando el maíz comprado en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy dry maize

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is married and has two children. She started her business because at the time they were still paying the house where they live and their income was very low. Six years ago she started selling clothing out of her mother's house and then she started selling clothing in bulk at the markets.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $825, to be paid in 6 months, to purchase clothing of the season in bulk. With your help she will continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Francisca es casada y tiene 2 hijos inició el negocio por que en ese momento todavía estaban pagando la casa donde viven y el ingreso que entraba era muy poco. Hace 6 años fuera de la casa de su madre empezó a vender ropa hasta meterse de lleno a los mercados para la venta por pacas.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $825 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar pacas de ropa de la temporada. Con tu ayuda ella seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is a fifty two year old widow and mother of five children. She believes in hard work and dedication and that is the secret of her success. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like fufu, banku, ampesi, and rice balls.

Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and is eaten with any stew.

She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Boafo Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her restaurant and food shop, like bags of maize and baskets of cassava.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 42, is married and lives with her four children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around $2 each day, while her husband works as a rice miller. Her husband makes about $4 each day, however, they must also support an older sister and mother at home. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Chea S. is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase more rice. They will purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Thong

texts.en:
Mr. Thong B. is a motorcycle taxi driver, and he earns approximately $1.70 per day. He is married with three children, and he and his family live in the Andong Sambour Village in Pursat Province. His wife is a farmer in addition to her duties of cooking and caring for the family.

Because Mr. B.’s motorcycle is old and frequently breaks down, he is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle. In practice, the loan proceeds would allow him to generate greater income for the benefit of his family because a new motorcycle would drastically improve his motorcycle taxi service. More specifically, a new motorcycle would look nicer and would thus attract more customers; at the same time, a new motorcycle would require less maintenance and would thereby cut down on expenses to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing a new motorcycle

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina operates a small business offering hairdressing services in Primorsk, Ukraine. She has an attractively arranged little facility in her home town where she does all sorts of haircuts and hairstyles for her female customers. Nina's business has developed into a stable, profitable enterprise, based on services that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her family. In a typical month she gets around $1000 in gross revenue.

Nina's business is growing and her clientele is consistently increasing. She has requested a loan of 1000 Grivnas to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business.

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Nohemi es originaria de García Nuevo León, y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.

Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de seis meses para con ello resustir mercancías para la venta de productos de belleza y zapatos.

Nohemi se inició hace tres años en las ventas por catálogo debido a la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, en virtud de que él no cuenta con una estabilidad en su trabajo. Nohemi es casada y tiene tres hijos. Con el transcurso del tiempo Nohemi ha vendiendo productos de belleza de distintas marcas, sin embargo, hoy en día dice que ya encontró a un proveedor que le ofrece productos de mejor calidad y que le generan mayor utilidad.

¡Los invito a apoyar a Nohemi para que su negocio siga creciendo!
texts.en:
Nohemi is a native of García Nuevo León and makes a living selling beauty products via catalog. Currently, she is requesting a loan of $475, which she plans to repay within two months, so she can revamp her stock of beauty products and shoes to sell. Nohemi, who is married and has three children, started her job three years ago due to the need to help her husband with household expenses because he did not have a steady job. As time has passed, Nohemi has been selling brand-name beauty products and says she has already found a supplier who offers products of higher quality and more usefulness.

We invite you to support Nohemi so her business keeps growing!

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Revamp supply of beauty products to sell via catalog

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina D. sells coal pots and African cooking pots at Kotokoraba, which is in the heart of the Cape Coast.

Sabina has received a junior high school education. She has four children. Sabina has been doing this business since 1996. She is responsible for feeding the family and paying the utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy more coal pots and cooking pots for resale. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more coal pots and cooking pots for resale.

loans.name: Kwamé

texts.fr:
Né le 1er mai 1957 à Accra, Monsieur A. Kwamé est marié et père de 4 enfants. Mécanicien d’entretien dans une société de la place, il a pour activité secondaire la vente de jus de fruit glacé et eau minérale glacée. Dans l’intention d’agrandir son activité secondaire qui génère d’important revenu, il sollicite un crédit afin d’acheter un congélateur et quelques ustensiles pour son activité.
Ceci l’aidera beaucoup à accroître sa production et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Les revenus ainsi dégagés contribueront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on May 1, 1957 in Accra, Mr. Kwamé A. is married and the father of four. A maintenance mechanic in a local company, his other work involves selling iced fruit juice and mineral water. With the intention of expanding this other work, which generates sizable revenues, he is requesting a loan to buy a freezer and a few utensils. This will assist him a great deal in raising his production and increasing his sales figures. The income thus derived will help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer and some utensils

loans.name: Elifia

texts.es: Elifia tiene 52 años de edad, es separada, en su vida conyugal tuvo 5 hijos, con ella están viviendo ahora, su hija y su nieta. De niña trabajaba en la chacra ayudando a su padre, y cuando tuvo sus hijos se dedicaba a la venta de comida en el mercado, su esposo, es ese tiempo era chofer y le apoyaba en lo posible. Ahora tiene una tienda donde vende perfumes, joyas y objetos personales para mujer, pero también sigue vendiendo, en los días de feria, los sábados, salchipapas y refrescos. Los productos de su tienda las adquiere por catálogo, y le gusta mucho su negocio, cuando llegan sus pedidos sale a repartir de casa en casa, mientras que su hija se queda en el negocio para no perder clientela. Es su 2do préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Todo el dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra de perfumes y tarjetas de navidad por campaña para venderlas en su tienda.
texts.en:
Elifia is 52 years old, separated, and had five children while married. Currently, her daughter and granddaughter are living with her. As a youngster, she helped her father work on the farm. Once she had children, she dedicated herself to food sales in the market. Her husband was a driver at the time, and helped her as much as possible. Currently, she has a store where she sells perfumes, jewelry and personal care items for women. She still, however, sells food and beverages on market days. She acquires her store’s products by catalog and very much enjoys her business. When her orders arrive, she leaves to distribute them door-to-door while her daughter tends to the store so she won’t lose customers. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. All the funds requested will be invested into the purchase of perfumes and Christmas cards to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products that she sells.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 22 años, es madre de 2 niños pequeños, vive con su conviviente quien le da su apoyo en lo posible. Ella se dedica a vender ambulatoriamente gallinas y queso, su mejor punto de venta son los paraderos de los carros de las agencias de viajes. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y lo que le gusta es conocer muchos lugares y sobre todo, a muchas personas que se sienten satisfechas de comprar sus quesos y sus animales. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y en el ciclo pasado ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco para poner sus productos en exposición y lo compren con mayor confianza.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 22-year-old mother of two small children who lives with her partner who is very supportive. She is a traveling salesperson, selling chickens and cheeses, making her best sales at the stops for tourist buses. She has been doing this business for one year and she enjoys visiting new places and, more importantly, meeting the people who are satisfied with their cheese and animal purchases. This is her second MFP loan and she was punctual with the payments of her last loan. With the requested funds she will have a display kiosk built for her products to raise client confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou C. works selling lotus at a busy market and is able to make US$ 7 every day. He lives with his wife, Bak Leakena, pictured here, who has a business selling various kinds of fruit in the same market. On average, she makes around US$ 5 per day. This couple has five children. Sou C. is asking for a loan to expand his wife's fruit stand and increase the number of lotus he has for sale.

loans.use: To expand fruit stand and increase the number of lotus he has for sale

loans.name: Tun

texts.en: S. is 36 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She makes a living raising pigs which she sells for slaughter in four months' time after raising. She has been raising pigs for 13 years and is currently earning around US$ 2.50 a day. S. is married with four children, all of whom are single. Her husband is Moun, aged 49, and he is a local rice farmer, a skill he learned from his parents. S. is applying for a loan as capital to allow her to save to help her husband to purchase a pair of buffalo to raise for sale, as well as using them for rice farming.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of buffalo to raise for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Morn Nheb Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 13 people living in Prasat village in Cambodia's Kandal province who comprise this village bank loan will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. M. N. is a 50-year-old village bank president. She uses hay to make fertilizer that she sells to farmers. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more hay to make more fertilizer to sell and earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Sam Lorn, is a hairdresser. Mrs. M. N. has two children who attend the local school.

Three members of this group have End-of-Term (EoT) loans, while the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They enable borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a 0% default rate on KiV..

loans.use: Purchasing more hay to make more fertilizer to sell and earn more income.

loans.name: Deab

texts.en: Deab S., 56, is a widow who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has six children and has a business selling rice and food from her home. She and her daughter sell rice and typically make US$3 of profit per day. She is also supported by four children, two working as construction workers and two others as garment factory workers. Deab S. is asking for a loan to reinvest in her business. (Deab S. was not available so her daughter is pictured instead, on the right hand side.)

loans.use: Reinvest in her business (selling rice).

loans.name: Epi

texts.en: Epi M., 28, is married with 4 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Chip/Plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 6 days per week. She has had 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD). SPBD loans are Epi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for plantation and tank of oil, oven, plastic papers, and sacks of salt for chip business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is thirty-five years old and married with six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of her children are in  senior high school while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Martha works as a trader to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a food crop farmer. Martha trades in smoked fish, buying the fish from markets in nearby communities and selling at the local market.  She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Abibata

texts.en:
Abibata is 40 years old; she is married and mother of three children. All her children are in school. She sells ladies' used footwear like slippers, sandals, shoes and sometimes school bags. Abibata has been in business for the last four years. She sells her products through hawking; she normally treks to sell in villages during their market days. Her husband sells agro chemical but does not have enough money to support his wife.

Abibata needs the loan to enable her to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. With the loan, she wants to purchase assorted used shoes, sandals and slippers in bulk. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘God first’.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes, slippers, and sandals, etc.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia C. is from the village of Salvador, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has five adult children. Anastacia owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling groceries and food items in the local community. She has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. On June 29, 2006, Anastacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania T. is from the town of Roxas. She is 48 years old. Epefania is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Epefania owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall where she sells a variety of fruits in the local community. Epefania has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Epefania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Epefania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Epefania is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Epefania from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1969. (no: 010117140044). She lives in Xom Ngoai, Uy No, Dong Anh, Hanoi with her husband and four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells building materials (cement, iron, steel, etc). The first child is learning in university. The next three children are going to school. She has a monthly income of about 4.500.000 VND. However, her income is not enough to cover the cost of the family and they have no savings. So, she has to earn more money to care for them and save. She has engaged in micro finance for five years. This time she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND( or 350 USD) to invest in her construction materials store. There are three other Fund participants in her group: 
  Bích Thị Hồng Phạm was born in 1977. (no: 010117140042). She has two children. Her husband repairs motors and she sells soft drinks at home. She wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND ( or 330 USD)to buy spare parts for motorcycles. 
  Dung Thị Nguyễn was born in 1961. (no: 010117140046). She has three children. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND ( or 350 USD) to buy a cow. 
  Vân Anh T. Nguyễn was born in 1978. (no: 010117140006 . She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND( or 300 USD)to buy clothes to sell in the market.

loans.use: To invest in her construction materials store

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 42 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs and she has been in the business for the past ten years. She lives in Lagos.

Fatima is very happy with LAPO-Kiva for their financial support. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to enable her to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 35 years old and is married with four children.  Celia owns a grocery shop in a small agricultural and fishing community on the banks of the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Celia’s husband is a teacher.

Celia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a about year and is a member of the communal bank “Las Mariscalas.”  She has used past loans to invest in her grocery shop and plans to do the same with this loan of 1300 soles.  She will also buy gasoline to sell in the same community where she has her grocery shop.  

Celia is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her with capital to work.  She is pleased to be able to help with household expenses alongside her husband.  Celia’s goal is to expand her grocery shop and offer a wider variety of products.

loans.use: Products for a small grocery shop; gasoline for sale

loans.name: Help Me Go Ahead Group

texts.en:
Help Me Go Ahead is a group of five borrowers. It is headed by Sambi M., who lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. Sambi is thirty years old, married, and has two children, ages one and three. She also cares for three children orphaned in the war. Sambi was unable to attend school because, even though she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide; therefore, school was considered unnecessary. 

Sambi sells clothes, including slippers, children’s clothing, shirts, pants, etc. She buys her stock wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells it in a market stall along the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for three years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers. 

Sambi is requesting a loan so as to build up her inventory to meet increased demand. Her ambition is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business Sambi dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale clothes to sell

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mr. Dy S., 62, (shown in the picture with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Chhet, 53, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1970 and have three sons and three daughters. Four of them were married and live outside the family home, one son is a teacher and another son attends school.

Dy has been a farmer since 1979. He grows cauliflowers and cucumbers in the farmland in his village. His wife has been selling grocery for 2 years. One of his daughters is a hair dresser, but she doesn’t have enough materials for operating the business.

Hence Dy is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase materials for hair and beauty salon for his daughter’s business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for hair and beauty salon for his daughter who is a hair dresser.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor N. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Flor is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Flor owns & operates a variety store, selling products to local community members.

In 2009, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Flor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Flor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luse

texts.en:
Luse M. is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luse owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Luse has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luse joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luse is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Luse plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Taboo in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Conchita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Conchita opened a clothing business where she sells cloth and dressmaking supplies to members of the local community . Conchita is taking a loan out to increase her inventory as working capital for her business. 

In 2007, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Conchita's 5th loan from PMPC. She is requesting a P4500 loan and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide financial support to members of her immediate family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Bushura Tutungukye Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
M. Alice is 50 years old and married with two children, aged 20 and 17 years, and she takes care of two dependents.

Alice has had a retail shop in Bushura cell for 3 years. She is able to make 30,000/= profit a week. This can be mostly attributed to the availability of items in her shop, although defaulters are also many. Apart from the shop, Alice is also a farmer and she would like to become rich in the future and have a better standard of living.

Alice needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods and to buy seeds and pesticides to improve and expand her plantations. Alice is the leader of her lending group in Kihihi and a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: Restock her shop with more goods, and buy seeds and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 55 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Issam has owned a cow farm for four years. Issam decided on having a farm because it has always been the family business. This business allows him to sell dairy products like milk, cheese, etc.

Issam requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase feed for his cows and a van for his work, which will allow him to improve his work and distribute his dairy products to houses in his village and the surrounding area. Issam has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

Issam is special in his work because he is known for his good dairy products. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as people from outside his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business and to always be able to supplement his family’s expenses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his cows and a van for his work.

loans.name: Milagro De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagro de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 39 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Milagro de Jesús, lleva  04 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos y sabanas, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudo en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementarlo y que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Milagro de Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Milagro de Jesús belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 39, single, and she has three dependent children. Milagro de Jesús has been making clothing and sheets for four years. Little by little, she has been generating her own income and saving her money. She wanted to set up a small seamstress shop. Having the skill for this type of work, she had no doubt in doing so. Thanks to the support from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to set it up. The shop is in her house in an area that is very well equipped to wait on her customers. She tells us that her sales are going very well. She works on advance orders from her customers. She currently continues with the same business. She has loyal customers who come to her house everyday for her work and orders. She personally waits on them with her characteristic kindness. She will use this loan for 2,500 PEN to buy meters of different types of fabric and instruments that she uses like scissors, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Milagro de Jesús now feels like a fulfilled woman, and she has a great desire to make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and also for helping a lot of women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Yadira Ether

texts.es:
Yadira Esther M. S. tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en edades 8 y 6 años en el barrio El Carmen de Malambo, Municipio del Área Metropolitana de Barranquilla y pueblo anfibio del  departamento del Atlántico, nacido a orillas del río Magdalena y la Ciénaga Grande, en él que sobreviven las danzas y ritos derivadas de la época de esclavitud en el Atlántico Colombiano, como la Cumbia, el Fandango, La Danza De Negro, La Danza De Los Pajaritos y El Gavilán Pio-pio. 
Como en el interior de Malambo sus habitantes no suelen transportarse en taxi, el transporte público se efectúa principalmente en moto taxi, una moto con sillas para dos pasajeros, que pasa por la puerta de la casa de Yadira, ubicada en esta vía principal, lo cual hace que ella esté bien posicionada en su negocio de venta de aceite para motos, debido a que sus clientes principales son los conductores de moto taxi y a que las cortas distancias al interior de Malambo, hacen que la  población utilice este tipo de transporte y hacen de ella una actividad  muy rentable. 
Aunque Yadira siempre tuvo un negocio, se inició con la venta de aceites para motos, cuando fuè felizmente involucrada  por su prima quien se mudó hace cuatro años y se lo dejó; ella accedió teniendo en cuenta que su casa era el sitio perfecto para comercializar este producto por la  alta circulación de estos vehículos, para ello su padre abrió un local para su funcionamiento. Ella dice que tiene una ventaja competitiva en este negocio porque es una población que ha aumentado mucho y este crecimiento significa un aumento en el número de personas que van transportados por los moto taxis y por consiguiente aumenta la demanda de aceite; adicionalmente tiene una habitación en su casa dedicada a los videojuegos donde niños y jóvenes del Municipio pueden divertirse, este lo trajo una cuñada de Bucaramanga y aunque en el barrio hay mucha competencia, sus equipos son más modernos y ninguna otra sala de videojuegos del municipio tiene los X-Box. Así que la rotación del dinero diario por este concepto lo hace bien atractivo para ella y su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo por valor de  $2.000.000 para comprar aceite y comprar una reja y mejorar la cubierta de la sala de videojuegos lo cual servirá para aumentar la seguridad. Éste es el segundo crédito, efectuado a Yadira por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  entidad a la que le gusta pertenecer, porque considera que  otras organizaciones hacen muchas deducciones, lo que significa que reciben menos dinero; en la Fundación recibe financiación de acuerdo de su capacidad de pago. Es más, Yadira  expresa que aprovecha muy bien los cursos y programas formativos que  le ofrecen el la Fundación y está decidida a  ponerlos en práctica en el negocio. Con esta actividad apoya los ingresos de la familia y  se siente contenta pues puede enviar a su hija a una escuela de ballet.
Yadira M., dice que su mayor desafío personal que enfrenta es la salud de su cónyuge porque tuvo que asumir la dirección y parte de los gastos de la familia cuando  él se enfermó, pero por suerte tiene la seguridad social cubierta, porque en este país le prestan todos los servicios a él. La meta de su familia es construir un almacén de repuestos e insumos para las motos en un lote al lado de su casa, pero aun  sueña con tener un local propio e independiente de sus padres y por eso abrió una cuenta de ahorros para seguir guardando sus ingresos y así poder hacerlo.
texts.en:
Yadira Esther M. S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children (ages 8 and 6) in the neighborhood of El Carmen de Malambo, which is in the metropolitan area of the City of Barranquilla, Department of Atlántico. The city lies on the banks of Magdalena River and the Great Marsh. Many of the dances and rituals derived from days of slavery still survive in the Colombian Atlantic region such as the Cumbia, the Fandango, “La Danza de Negro” (The Black Dance), “La Danza de Los Pajaritos” (The Dance of the Small Birds) and “El Gavilán Pio-pio” (The Cry of the Hawk). Within the interior region of Malambo, the inhabitants rarely travel by taxi. The primary mode of transportation is a “mototaxi”, which is a motorcycle with seats for two passengers. When you come across the front door of Yadira’s house, which is located on the main road, you will find a strategically located business for selling motorcycle oil. Her main customers are motorcycle taxi drivers who travel short distances within Malambo. Most of the population utilize this method of transportation, so it can be a very profitable business.

Even though she already had a business, Yadira decided to begin selling motorcycle oil with her cousin. The cousin moved away four years ago and she agreed to take over the business entirely. Her house was the perfect place for selling this type of product because of the high frequency of motorcycle traffic, so her father set aside a space for her to run the business. Yadira says she has a competitive advantage in her business because of the significant increase in the population. This type of growth means more people are traveling by motorcycle taxi, which leads to an increase in the demand for oil. In addition, Yadira has a room in her house where children and teenagers from the neighborhood can come to play video games and have fun. Her sister-in-law brought in the equipment from Bucaramanga. Even though Yadira faces stiff competition from other video arcades in town, her equipment is more modern and her business is the only place in the area that has an X-Box. This particular business was attractive because of the daily income it generates for her and her family.

Yadira is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 COP to buy motorcycle oil and security bars to install in her video game room to provide more safety. This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an institution which she enjoys doing business with because she noticed that other organizations made several deductions that decreased the loan amount issued. With the Foundation, she is able to receive the full amount requested. In addition, Yadira says that she taken several good courses offered by the Foundation and is determined to implement them in her business. With her business activities, she is able to provide income for her family and is happy that she is able to send her daughter to ballet classes.

Yadira says the biggest personal challenge she faces is the health of her husband because she had to take charge of the family expenses when he became ill. Fortunately, she receives payments from the government because in her country she is able to access services that her husband needs. Yadira’s goal for her family is to build a warehouse next to her home where she can sell parts and supplies for motorcycles. She still dreams of having a home separate from her parents, so she has opened a savings account to set aside the funds needed to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase security bars for her video arcade & motorcycle oil for her retail business

loans.name: Sambou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambou H. is 40 years old, married, and lives in Sam Raong village, Takeo province. Her spouse has four children, three of them are students in the local school while the youngest is two years old.                
Mrs. Sambou H. is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Bros Ben, is a cattle middleman. He is able to earn a small income to support his family. In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Sambou H. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy two oxen for her husband's business. With her loan, she hopes her income will increase and her family's standard of living will improve.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina L. is from the village of Quipasa Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old and single. To make a living, Rufina sells coconut in the local community. Rufina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Rufina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rufina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a rice farmer who lives in Agusan Del Sur. She just started preparing her land for planting and she needs inputs for it. The farm is her family’s only source of income so she makes sure to earn from it. Her oldest child, who is now 35 years old, also helps her on the farm.

Florenda applied for a loan from CEVI to supply her farm inputs. She asked to loan Php14, 000, which she would use to buy seed, fertilizer and other inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nurbubu's Group

texts.ru:
Люди по – разному верят в приход успеха в их жизнь. Некоторые полагают, что успех – это везение, счастливая судьба  и нечто предписанное и не зависящее от самого человека явление. Другая же группа людей верит, что хоть от судьбы никуда не уйдёшь, однако сама судьба предоставляет нам выбор жить, так или иначе. И успех наш зависит от конкретных усилий и стараний, а не от везения. Такого мнения придерживаются и герои нашей истории. Нурбубу Макеева– лидер данной группы. У Нурбубу трое детей. Старшая дочь замужем. Средний сын учится на втором курсе в Аграрном университете, а самая младшая дочь учится в средней школе. Положение в селе довольно тяжёлое, учитывая безработицу и массовый отток населения в города. Однако Нурбубу вместе с мужем попытались всё - таки попытать счастье в родном краю. Они купили корову, откормили и перепродали за десять тысяч сомов ($200). На эти деньги они обратно закупили скот, только теперь овец и с тех пор это стало основным их занятием. Перепродажа скота позволила им отправить дочь на обучение в Бишкек, а в дальнейшем приготовить ей приданое. Сейчас их доход составляет около пяти тысяч ($130) сомов в месяц. Муж являясь членом фермерского хозяйства, активно помогает Нурбубу ухаживать за скотом. Сейчас, Нурбубу нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить четырёх баранов для откорма. 

У Нурбубу три партнёра по группе:

Эдилу Аскарбек – уулу двадцать один год. Он женат. Его супруга работает учительницей. У Эдила есть сын, которому всего десять месяцев. Эдил работает главным инспектором в районной архитектуре. Эдил решил обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить ГСМ для сельскохозяйственных работ. 

Нурисе Матсаевой тридцать лет. Муж Нурисы – член фермерского хозяйства. Нуриса воспитывает троих детей. Помимо них с ними также живут свекровь и свекор Нурисы. Дочь учится в третьем классе, средний сын учится во втором классе, а младшая дочь пока дома. Нуриса работает медсестрой. Нурисе нужен кредит, чтобы купить стиральную машину. 

Нурзаде Кожомкуловой тридцать один год. У Нурзады двое детей. Старший сын уже пошёл в школу. А также вместе с Нурзадой живёт и её свекровь. Чтобы прокормить семью Нурзада продаёт ГСМ, а её муж занимается фермерством. Нурзада начала торговлю с помощью кредита, который она получила полтора года назад. Сейчас она вновь нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить сто литров ГСМ.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
People have different beliefs in how success comes into their lives. Some believe that success is luck, a lucky fate and something prescribed, a phenomenon which is not in the person's power. Another group of people believes that though you cannot escape from fate however the fate itself gives us a choice in how we want to live. And our success depends on actual efforts and diligence rather than luck. This is the opinion which belongs to the characters of our story. Nurbubu M. is a leader of this group. Nurbubu has three children. Her oldest daughter is married. Her middle son is in his sophomore year in the Agrarian university, and her youngest daughter goes to secondary school. The conditions in the village are very difficult considering unemployment and a mass exodus of the population into the cities. But Nurbubu and her husband still tried to find happiness in their homeland. They bought a cow, fed it and resold for ten thousand soms ($200US). The used this money to buy cattle, but this time sheep and since then it has become their main business. Reselling of the cattle has allowed them to send their daughter to study in Bishkek and to prepare her dowry later on. At this time their income is around five thousand soms ($130) a month. Her husband is a member of the farmer's union and is actively helping Nurbubu to take care of the cattle. Right now Nurbubu needs a loan to buy four rams for feeding. Nurbubu has three partners in the group: Edil A.-U. is 21 years old. He is married. His wife works as a teacher. Edil has a son who is only ten months old. Edil works as a head inspector in the regional architectural association. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy GSM (fuel and oil for machinery) for agricultural work. Nurisa M. is thirty years old. Nurisa's husband is a member of the farmer's union. Nurisa is raising three children. Nurisa's parents-in-law also live together with her family. Her daughter is in third grade and middle son is in the second grade, her youngest daughter is staying at home. Nurisa works as a nurse. She needs a loan to buy a washing machine. Nurzada K. is thirty one years old. Nurzada has two children. Her oldest son goes to school. Her mother-in-law also lives with Nurzada. To feed the entire family Nurzada sells GSM (fuel and oil for machinery equipment) and her husband is in farming. Nurzada has started selling with a loan which she received a year and a half ago. Right now she again needs a loan to buy 100 liters of fuel and oil.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four sheep for feeding and resale

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric G. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. He is 34 years old. Eric is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eric owns & operates a business providing motorcycle services used to transport passengers to the local community. Eric has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Eric joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Eric has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Eric is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Eric from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Seun

texts.en: To make a living in Ibadan, Seun sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because she has the opportunity to be self employed and also to be able to support her home from the profits she makes in the business. She is 42 years old, married with a child 5 years. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She is requesting for a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more medicines to sell.  She say thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase computers

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Guillermina;  ella tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es viuda, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende granos secos como habas secas, maíz, morado, maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, cereales. Ella vende en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos y venderlos en su stand en Urubamba.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc”. She lives in Urubamba Province, which is part of the Department of Cusco.

Guillermina is 45 years old, widowed, and divides her time between her household activities and running her small business. She sells dried goods such as beans, purple corn, white corn, yellow corn, and grain. Guillermina sells at the standard market in Urubamba. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products and sell them from her stand in Urubamba.

Guillermina appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried goods to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian B., 38 years old, is from the village of Rizal Lopez Jeana Misamis Occidental. Vivian is married and has two infant-aged children. Vivian owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vivian from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N. is a 30 year old married woman and is the village bank president having been selected by its eleven members. The bank is which located in Ou village, Takeo province.  The members of this village bank will use the loans for  different purposes.
Mrs. Kong N. and her husband, Mr. Tola Chann, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice. They the work very hard to support their four children.  Mrs. Kong N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer . Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Tola Chann is also a secondary teacher who is able to receive a small salary to support his family. Three of this couple's children are attending  the local school while another one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Obidohon's Group

texts.ru:
В повседневном труде человек приобретает очень ценные качества. Во – первых он становится терпеливым и расчётливым. Пролитый пот и усилия прививают бережливость и уважение к труду в целом. Именно поэтому даже в условиях безработицы и экономического упадка, герои нашей истории ещё раз показывают, что для человека трудолюбивого работа всегда найдётся. Обидохон Жураева – лидер данной группы. Ей шестьдесят лет и после смерти мужа, она осталась с двумя детьми. К счастью дети подросли, женились и теперь даже внуки помогают Обидохон в её деле. А Обидохон в настоящее время занимается разведением скота и выращиванием хлопчатника. Старшему сыну тридцать девять, а младшему – тридцать. Оба её сыновей уехали в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Но уехали они лишь тогда, когда убедились, что внуки смогут ухаживать за бабушкой и смотреть за хозяйством. Обидохон занимается животноводством уже двадцать пять лет. Раньше Обидохон занималась только выращиванием хлопчатника. Однако усердие в работе и старания Обидохон привели её к тому, что вскоре ей удалось купить живность и начать разводить скот. Она сумела женить сыновей и сейчас уже подумывает о том, чтобы справить свадьбу внуков. Обидохон обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить корову. 
Партнёры Обидохон по группе:
Дилмураджану Маматалиеву сорок один год. У Дилмураджана две дочери и один сын. Всей семьёй они занимаются выращиванием и реализацией подсолнуха, картофеля и моркови. Дилмураджан недавно начал строительство нового дома. Сейчас он надеется получить кредит и купить стройматериалы для стройки. Дилмураджан ожидает получить второй урожай, и сейчас все его усилия направлены в эту сторону. 
Дилнозе Камоловой двадцать пять лет. Она замужем. Муж Дилнозы – частный строитель. Чтобы помочь мужу, Дилноза занялась животноводством. Она откармливает скот и перепродаёт его на скотном рынке. Дилноза обратилась за этим кредитом, так как планирует купить бычков. В будущем Дилноза хотела бы построить большую конюшню.
Хатиче Марипжановой пятьдесят три года. Хатича – вдова и мать двоих детей. Чтобы не зависеть от детей Хатича усердно занимается откормом скота. У неё имеется корова с телёнком и две овцы. Она также продаёт молоко. Хатича хочет получить кредит и потратить средства на закупку овец. 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
