Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
When a person works every day, he gains very valuable traits. First, he becomes patient and prudent. Sweat spilled and effort expended imparts thrift and respect for work as a whole. For this reason, even during times of unemployment and economic decline, the heroes of our story once again show that hardworking people always find work. Obidohon J. is the leader of this group. She is sixty years old, and after her husband’s death she was left with two children. Fortunately, her children have grown up, married, and now there are even grandsons to help Obidohon with her business. Obidohon works raising cattle and cultivating cotton. Her elder son is thirty-nine, and her younger son is thirty. Both of her sons have left to work in the Russian Federation. However, they left only when they were convinced that the grandsons could look after their grandmother and take care of the household. Obidohon has been working in animal husbandry for twenty-five years. Earlier, Obidohon only grew cotton. However, through Obidohon’s diligence and hard work, she produced enough cotton to allow her to buy livestock and begin to raise cattle. She has managed to marry off her sons and is already thinking about celebrating the weddings of her grandsons. Obidohon is asking for a loan to buy a cow. Obidohon’s partners in the group: Dilmuradjan M. is forty-one years old. Dilmuradjan has two daughters and one son. The entire family works cultivating and harvesting sunflowers, potatoes and carrots. Dilmuradjan recently has begun building a new house. Now he hopes to obtain a loan to buy building materials. Dilmuradjan expects to receive a second harvest this season, and now all his efforts are directed towards this. Dilnoza K. is twenty-five years old. She is married. Dilnoza’s husband is a freelance builder. To help her husband, Dilnoza works in animal husbandry. She fattens cattle and resells it in the cattle market. Dilnoza is asking for a loan to buy calves. In the future, Dilnoza would like to construct a big stable. Haticha M. is fifty-three years old. Haticha is a widow and the mother of two children. So as not to be dependent on her children, Haticha industriously works fattening cattle. She has a cow with a calf and two sheep. She also sells milk. Haticha wants to take out a loan to buy a sheep. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) and sells it locally. It is called “etew” by the Fante people at Takoradi. She serves it with okro (okra) stew and hot pepper sauce with fish and meat.

Faustina has no educational background. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Faustina’s loan will be used to buy more maize to be able to cook in bigger quantity for sale. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize to be able to cook in bigger quantity for sale

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Marco; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente,   el socio es taxista el presta servicio de taxi y solicita el préstamo para su conyugue, ella es comerciante, tiene una carreta en la cual vende golosinas. El socio ayudara a implementar el pequeño negocio de su pareja.  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de golosinas de su conyugue.  
       
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Marco he is 35 years old and lives with his partner. The member is a taxi driver and needs the loan to help his partner; she is a merchant and has a cart where she sells candy. The member will help his partner set up her business. Mr. Marco needs the loan to invest in the candy business of his partner.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payment of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in the candy business of his partner.

loans.name: Niel

texts.en:
47 year-old Niel G. from Sto. Niño earns a living through rice farming.  With rice being the staple food in the country, he has had his share of profits from his hard work from the previous harvest season.

With the money that he is requesting from this loan, he plans to buy sacks of fertilizers and seeds. He works hard on his farm so that he can expect a good harvest and increase his profits. The additional income generated will go to his family's daily consumption, future savings and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married. She is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo where she works in the local mall selling bed sheets, blankets, pillows, and other retail items. Ganna has been in this business for 10 years. Her venture has grown up to 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory and about 5,000 Grivnyas in monthly profit. 

Ganna is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to diversify assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her outlet. This type of inventory is always in demand. People purchase the items for themselves as well as for gifts. Ganna is hoping to generate additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha  es viuda ya hace varios años, tiene tres hijos, vive en anticretico en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí  de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente cuenta con un ambiente en alquiler el cual utiliza como horno de elaboración de pan, elaborando pan para el Hospital de la Mujer, Materno infantil y Hospital Obrero de la ciudad de La Paz. Los tres hijos le ayudan a elaborar pan todos los días  y  es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar..
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materia prima (harina, azúcar, en cantidad) y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su tercer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en: Señora Martha has been a widow for many years. She has 3 children and lives in an anticretico arrangement in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone in La Paz city. Martha rents a location where she uses a bread-making oven, making bread for the Women's, Maternity and Infants hospital and Workers' Hospital in La Paz city. Her 3 children help her make bread every day and in this way she obtains earnings for her household. The loan Martha is seeking is to purchase ingredients (catering quantities of flour and sugar) to be able to increase her earnings. This is Martha's third loan and the socioeconomic analysis which was done was favourable, allowing her to obtain a loan.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, yeast etc to make bread

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita P., 57, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Mateo P., a rice dealer, and mother to three young hard-working adults. By the grace of God, Anita has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Anita dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Kydykbek

texts.en:
Kydykbek G. is a farmer from Tashkiya village. He is 43 years old and has three daughters aged 6, 8 and 10. Kydykbek was born into a large family with ten children but in spite of many difficulties, he was able to graduate from college as a builder and worked in this trade for 20 years. He is known as a very positive, hardworking person and a grateful son, who lives with his elderly parents and supports them.

In 1994, in order to find more means of subsistence for his large family, Kydykbek decided to start his own business in cattle breeding. Over the past 16 years, his efforts have been aimed at supporting and expanding his household. He has managed to multiply the number of cattle and today he has four milk cows, five sheep, five lambs and one horse. Also, Kydykbek began cultivating potatoes and holy clover on a plot of land and worked hard to get a good harvest of high quality products.

Now Kydykbek is applying for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy five bull calves for fattening and resale. With the revenues from this investment, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle for fattening. His plans for the future include providing a higher education to his daughters; he dreams of seeing them as progressive-minded persons.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie S. is a widow  who lives in  Brgy. San Antonio, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  retailing of Avon products and Ready-To-Wear clothes businesses. Melanie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melanie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to buy Avon products to sell to her neighbors so that she can continue to save up for future improvements of her business. 

Melanie S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase stock of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Martha Fanny

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Fanny  que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha procreado dos hijos de 32 y de 24 años, su hija menor  vive en su casa con sus dos pequeños hijos. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene una pequeña granja donde cría pollos y chanchos, compra los pollos pequeños en Bahía  en una incubadora y los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses hasta que estén listos y con buen peso, luego los pela y los lleva a entregar a las tiendas del lugar, igual hace con los cerdos los tiene por 4 meses y junto a su esposo los faena y vende la carne por libra a los vecinos y personas del lugar. Trabaja todos los días en el cuidado de sus animalitos unas tres horas por día pero cuando entrega hasta 8 horas ya que tiene que repartir sus productos.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar más pollos ya que la temporada que viene es muy buena y se venden muchos de estos animalitos.  Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a los Bancos. Sus sueños tener buena salud ella y los suyos y ver que sus nietos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Here we chatted with Fanny who tells a bit about her life.  She’s 57 years old, married and has two children who are 32 and 24 years of age.  Her youngest daughter and her two small children live with her.  Fanny’s husband is a merchant.

She has a small farm where she raises chickens and pigs.  She buys the chicks from an incubator in Bahía and keeps them for two to three months until they are ready and at a good weight.  She then butchers them and takes them to the local stores.  She does the same with the pigs.  She raises them for four months and then with her husband’s help she butchers them and sells the meat by the pound to neighbors and locals.  She works every day caring for her little animals about three hours a day except on delivery days when she works up to 8 hours because she has to make all her deliveries.

This loan will be used to buy more chickens because the season that’s approaching is a very good one and a lot of these little animals are sold.  This is her second cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because interest rates are very low compared to banks.  Her dream is that she and her loved ones are always healthy and to see her grandchildren become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jewelry

loans.name: Stephen Mwangi

texts.en:
Stephen Mwangi M. is 22 years old, married to Ivy Wanjiku, and they have one child. He has had a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for the last three years.

Stephen was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a new motorcycle with the loan amount.

In the future, Stephen hopes to own a number of motorcycles, employing other people to operate them.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida belongs to a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur, which is famous for its leather industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past ten years. She is 37 years old, married to S. A. and has six children. Only three of them are able to attend school; the others are free to stay at home. 

Her husband operates a soaps and hair oil selling business. He has a shop in the market where he sells his products and earns income for the family. He started this business ten years ago, and he has obtained a good reputation among his customers for his quality products and good conduct. He supplies soaps and hair oil to other shops as well. 

Zubaida operates a business of selling shawls. She sells shawls to her neighboring clients by receiving orders from them. Her business grows during the winter season.  

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy soaps and hair oil in larger quantities to sell through his shop. Zubaida is hopeful that an investment will put a positive impact on her husband’s income and also expand his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy soaps and hair oil for reselling

loans.name: Soad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 31 years old, a single woman who lives with one parent.

Soad learned to be a seamstress, so in 2008 she opened her own sewing project for women's and baby clothes. She is well known in her local area and has an excellent reputation.

She is requesting a $1400 loan to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator. She is aiming to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine and a small generator

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia trabaja en un salón de belleza por el centro de la ciudad ella trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 9:00am hasta las 9:00pm la socia lleva años en este trabajo del cual se siente feliz ya que de eta manera ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia desea en el futuro aperturar su propio negocio pero por ahora ella se siente feliz trabajando así,la socia necesita el prestamo ya que se viene campaña escolar y necesita para comprar sus utiles y uniformes para asi poder tener todo en orden cuando sus hijos ingresen al colegio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para su uso personal como comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the “CHASKA ÑAHUI” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.  

She is 35 years old, separated and has two children.  She works in a beauty salon near downtown from Monday through Saturday, from 9am until 9pm; she’s been in this job for several years and is happy because that’s how she supports her family.

In the future she’d like to open her own business but for now she is happy working like this.  She needs a loan because the school year is about to start and she needs to buy her children’s school supplies and uniforms so that she can have everything in order when they return to school.

She is asking for a personal use loan to buy her children’s school supplies.  She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: To buy her children's school supplies.

loans.name: Serah Wambui

texts.en:
Sarah has practised farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 40 years old, married to Stephen Karanja, and they have four children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In future, Sarah hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag B., 51, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Her husband is self-employed. Her eldest son is in the army and her second son works for a transportation company, while her youngest, a daughter, attends a local secondary school. 

Tungalag began operating her own business in 2000. She makes horsehair ropes and belts, which are used for gers. In the beginning, she sold her products at an outdoor market. Now her business has become more stable and she gets enough custom orders for her products. 

She has recently bought some equipment that increased her production. She is a hardworking person. She says, " I would like to get some more necessary tools so that I can increase my job efficiency."  

She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy a machine for processing horsehair for making ropes and   belts.

loans.use: to buy a machine for processing horsehair

loans.name: Dial's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. Mrs. Dial is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members.

Mrs. Dial, a married woman, was born in 1975. She and her husband, Mr. Dang, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow corn and rice. In order to support and improve this farming, Mrs. Dial would like to ask for a loan to buy gasoline to fuel her pump for growing rice.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local schools and the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to fuel her pump for growing rice.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia J. B. es una mujer muy emprendedora que se dedica al comercio de mercancía en general, aprovechando cada época, oportunidad y cliente potencial al que consigue   convertirlo en su comprador conociendo sus intereses, necesidades, gustos y posibilidades. Alicia es diseñadora de calzado y aunque no ejerce esta actividad, es muy creativa y sabe identificar muy bien la mercancía que al cliente le gustaría tener, eso sí adaptado a la moda, a sus expectativas  y posibilidades;   así ella ha diseñado un sistema de venta  a crédito para cada uno atendiéndolo  de acuerdo con su perfil. Alicia emprendió su negocio hace dos años e inició entre amigos y gradualmente se ha ido extendiéndose entre sus vecinos y referidos a otros sectores.
Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el anterior compró telas para producir vestidos de baño femenino, de esta forma diversificó un poco su negocio e imprimió   su creatividad y diseño al servicio de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva con el cual comprará mercancía como ropa perfumes, accesorios femeninos electrodomésticos menores pues se acerca el día de la madre y sus clientes quieren sorprender a las madres de su familia y amigas con detalles para celebrar este maravilloso día.
,
texts.en:
Alicia J. B. is an enterprising woman who sells general merchandise.  She takes advantage of each season, opportunity, and customer potential to get people to be her customers.  She gets customers by knowing their interests, needs, likes, and possibilities.

Alicia is a shoe designer.  Even though she does not exercise this business activity, she is very creative.  She knows very well which merchandise her customers would like to have.  She knows what fits with the style, customer expectations, and possibilities.  She has designed a system of credit sales for each of her customers.  She does this in accordance with their profile.

Alicia started her business two years ago.  She started with friends, and she has gradually been expanding to her neighbors and referrals in other areas.

This is her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She used the previous loan to buy fabric to make women’s bathing suits.  This way she diversified her business a little, and she put her creativity and design at her customers’ service.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy merchandise like clothes, perfume, women’s accessories, and small household appliances.  Mother’s Day is coming up, and her customers want to surprise their mothers and friends with items to celebrate this marvelous day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, perfume, women’s accessories, and small household appliances

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: La señora Carlota tiene 31 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 2 niñas una de 8 años y otra de 2 años, ella se dedica a venta de zapatos, colchas, ropa, perfumes por catalogo, ella tiene con esa actividad mas de 15 años y empezó con este negocio desde que estaba en la escuela ya que les vendía a las maestras y a sus compañeras de clase, y así ella se compraba su ropa y lo que ella quería y no les andaba pidiendo a sus papas dinero ya que desde muy chica le gusto ser comerciante. Doña Carlota es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, a diario sale a vender y a cobrar lo que le devén sus clientas ya que vende sus productos en pagos. Ella surte sus productos en la cuidad de México en distribuidores autorizados, Carlota esta muy agradecida por el préstamo ya que así podrá comprar los zapatos que le han encargado sus clientas y así poder tener los artículos en existencia ella dice “como que a mis clientas le gusta mas ver las texturas de la ropa y de los zapatos como que les agrada mas tenerlos en vivo y sonríe”. La meta que tiene Carlota es rentar un local donde pueda vender sus productos para así estar mas al pendiente de sus hijas y no salir tanto a la calle.
texts.en:
Carlota, 31, is a single mother of two girls, an 8-year-old and a 2-year-old.  She sells shoes, comforters, clothes and perfume via catalogue.  She’s been in this business for over fifteen years; she started the business when she was still in school selling to her teachers and classmates and this is how she earned money to buy her clothes and whatever she wanted and not have to be asking her parents for money.  She’s enjoyed being a merchant since she was a little girl.

Carlota is a very hard working, responsible woman.  She goes out daily to sell and collect what her customers owe her because she sells on installments.  She stocks up in Mexico City from authorized distributors.

Carlota is very grateful for the loan because she’ll be able to buy shoes that her customers have ordered and have the items on hand because, as she says:  “my customers like to see the items and feel the texture of the clothes and shoes, like they like to have them there live,” she smiles.  Carlota’s goal is to rent a locale to sell her products in order to be more watchful of her daughters and not have to go out street selling so much.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius has been running a retail shop for 14 years in Ngalaiya Tala and he earns an income of KES 10,000 per month. He is 48 years old, married to Muthiani, and they do not have children yet.

Pius has never borrowed from any other MFI and has good credit history with KADET LTD. This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy cooking fat, sugar, flour and tea leaves for sale. Pius will reinvest the income generated from this loan back into the business. In the future, he desires to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, flour and tea leaves.

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.en: Dolores is a 65-year-old grandmother who helps support her daughter and two grandchildren who live with her. She has been very successful selling cosmetics door-to-door and plans to use the loan proceeds to buy more merchandise to maintain and ultimately grow her business. Her dream is that her grandchildren will have all the opportunities they would want as they grow up.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His older two children, whom are 12 and 14 years old, go to a local secondary school while the younger two are in kindergarten. His wife is a salesperson in a private little store. 

Naranbaatar manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business after moving to the center of the province. Since then, his business has been quite successful. This has allowed him to buy a plot of land in order to build a house. He is planning to repair his car in order to provide safe and reliable drives for his customers. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I am trying hard to feed my family. Previously I used to spend all of my earning for my family consumption. Now my wife has a job. So we can save money for the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has been in farming for over 10 years in the Eldoret area of South Rift, Kenya, producing milk and maize and selling to the local market.  He is married with eight children, three of whom are still schooling.

Jackson has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help him educate his last three children and also supplement family meals. He is focusing on having quality dairy cows in future.

Jackson notes that  animal diseases pose the greatest challenge to dairy farmers due to huge costs involved.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kantutitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Viviana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de api, venta de verduras, venta de pescado, venta de papa, venta de comida, venta de lubricantes, tienda de barrio, lechería, llantería y lubricantes.
 
La señora Susana,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación del asesor y del equipo de promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de api desde hace un año atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su vecina.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de harina y azúcar (que servirá para la elaboración de pasteles de api), los que comprará La Paz, y posteriormente lo venderá en la comunidad de Jancoamaya. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
texts.en:
The "Kantutita" Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Copacabana. It is made up of ten members, and is directed by a board of directors headed by Mrs. Viviana. The members' businesses are varied. They include: api [a fruity pastry] sales, vegetable sales, fish sales, potato sales, food sales, lubricant sales, a corner store, a creamery, a tire repair shop, and lubricants.

Mrs. Susana says that this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer, and she was invited by the consultant and the promotion team. She currently has an api sales business which began a year ago. She learned this business from her neighbour.

The loan that she is now taking out is for the purchase of flour and sugar (which she will use to make the api pastries) in La Paz. She will then sell the api pastries in the community of Jacoamaya. This work will allow her to generate an income to support her family as much as possible; she is married and has five children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Bijahual (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el sitio Bijahual de  la  parroquia Calderón en la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Bijahual. Este lugar se lo conoce por su vegetación y naturaleza, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y cría de animales.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como  agricultura, cría de animales, comercio, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aura, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 10 años que es como su hijo y estudia en escuela, también un señor que es especial y a quien ayuda. Su esposo trabaja en el campo.

Ella con este crédito quiere comprar pollos para la cría, además de chanchos, nos cuenta que hace varios años se dedica a la cría de estos animalitos ya que cuenta con el espacio suficiente para esto y es algo que no le quita mayor tiempo.

Con este crédito va a comprar 100 pollos y alimentos para los mismos además de dos chanchos pequeños. Este es el primer ciclo al igual que todas sus compañeras y espera quedarse por mucho tiempo.
 
Sus metas son tener salud y salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Bijahual loan group meet in Bijahual, in Calderón parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its vegetation and natural beauty.  Most local people farm and raise animals and livestock.

This is a group of people who decided to come together and form a loan group which would help them a lot as they would be able to use the loans to improve their small businesses.  The members are engaged in different business activities such as farming, animal raising, commerce, etc.

Here we meet 57 year-old Aura who is married and has seven grown-up children who live independently.  She has a 10 year-old grandson who lives with her like a son and attends school.  She also lives with a gentleman who is special and who she helps.  Her husband works on the land.

Aura will use this loan to buy chickens to raise and pigs.  She tells us that she has been raising these animals for several years as she has enough space for this business and it is something that doesn't require too much time.

Aura will buy 100 chickens, feed for the chickens and two young pigs with this loan.  This is the group's first loan cycle and they hope to remain together for a long time.

Aura's goals are to enjoy good health and get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens, 2 young pigs and chicken feed

loans.name: Laalegria-Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea tiene la edad de 41 años de edad, termino de estudiar la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Adan que se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura. Ella nos platica que tiene una pequeña tiend de abarrotes  llamada "Abarrotes Garcia, Doña andrea nos dice que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo a mejorar  su hogar y ayudarlo con los gastos.

Ella inicio a trababjar en su negocio desde hace 3 años y nos platica que fue la segunda persona en abrir una tienda de abarrotes ella nos dijo "antas si habia tiendas pero solo vendian cerveza por eso iniciamos a vender los abarrotes", doña Andrea necesita este credito para la compra jabon, detergentes, productos enlatados, azucar, sal, frijol, arroz, arina, cafe, dulces, refrescos y jugos,

Doña Andrea espera con este credito resurtir de nuevos productos su tienda y que su negocio prospere y ser una de las mejores tiendas de su comunidad. 


Ella nos dice que se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundacion por el prestamo que le dio.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea, 41, left school when she was very young.  She is married now to Sr. Adan, a farmer.  She tells us that she has a small grocery business called Garcia Grocery.  Dona Andrea started the business to help her husband with family expenses. 

She started it 3 years and tells us that she was the second person to open a grocery.  "There were stores before", she says, "but they only sold beer so we started selling groceries".  Dona Andrea needs this loan to buy soap, detergents, dairy products, sugar, salt, beans, rice, flour, coffee, snacks, sodas and juices.  

Dona Andrea hopes that restocking her store with new products will see her business prosper and be one of the best stores in the neighborhood.  

She says that she is very grateful to the Fundacion for this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with 6 children. With 1 child in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a buying and selling of scrap business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save enough to repair and renovate the family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap to sell

loans.name: Djeyesse Ii Group

texts.fr:
DJEYESSE  II est un groupe de 10 femmes mariées du village de KOLA SANGOULA, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 5 enfants et cultivent généralement du riz, de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
BINTOU MADOU, la deuxième assise à droite avec  foulard jaune, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA , YANGASSO et dans les marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20.000à 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
DJEYESSE is a group of 10 married women from the Kolga Sangoula village. They all live in traditional families, are 47 years old with 5 children; they grow rice, peanuts and okra for a living. In order to drive profits and to boost the productivity of their land, the group members are seeking their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 
Bintou Madou is the second lady sitting on the right with the yellow headscarf. She aims to use her loan to purchase good quality seeds, small tools and fertilisers from BLA's large market. After winter, the harvests are stored for a certain amount of time so that they accumulate in value before being sold in the large BLA market, in Yangasso and in the surrounding markets. She sells at wholesale and retail, and takes cash from a customer base predominantly from large towns. 
The members of the group aim to generate 20,000 to 40,000 FCFA each, which will be used to repay the interest on the loan and to see to their families' everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilisers, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Mitos

texts.en:
Mitos is 37 years old and married with four children.

Mitos works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mitos has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and earns additional income from food vending.

Mitos aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Paula Petrona

texts.es: La señora Petrona Paula se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y tortillas desde hace 22 años, la ubicación es en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus amigos, vecinos, familiares, saben de la buena calidad de sus nacatamales. El crédito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de masa, especies, chile, hojas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca cada día y mejorar cada día  en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Señora Petrona Paula has been selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales] and tortillas from her home for 22 years.  The majority of her friends, neighbors, and family know of the good quality of her nacatamales.  She will use the loan to purchase flour, spices, chilies, leaves and other products.  Her dream is for her business to grow every day and to improve the welfare of her family every day.

loans.use: purchase flour, spices, chilies, leaves and other products

loans.name: Buena Flor

texts.en:
Buena Flor is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Buena Flor has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Buena Flor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Buena Flor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to stock and sell.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman with seven school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Nadzua has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge in harassment from the local authority because of the tree cutting and burning ban. She dreams of starting a cereals selling business.

With the 30,000 KES, Nadzua wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it helps small-scale business operators through loan giving.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel se dedica a brindar el servicio de moto taxi, desde hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, él siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos. El crédito es para la compra de llantas, combustibles, tapizar los asientos y otros tipos de mejoras necesarias. Sueña con obtener otro moto taxi, para generar más ingresos para su hogar. Sabe que tiene que levantarse temprano desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel works providing motorcycle taxi services.  He has had this business for more than 11 years.  He has three minor children in his charge.  He is always looking for the way to improve his income.

The loan is to buy tires and fuel, upholster the seats, and make other kinds of necessary improvements.  

He dreams about getting another motorcycle taxi to generate more income for his household.  He knows that he has to get up early, from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.

loans.use: to buy tires and fuel, and upholster the seats.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh, a 20-year-old ambitious young man who finished high school, started working and helping at his brother’s shop. At the shop he sells cosmetics, gifts, and accessories. Because he succeeded in what he is doing, his brother now depends a lot on him in the shop. 

Now Sameh wants to work on expanding the business to include selling at wholesale prices and quantities and be a distributor for some of the products, and that’s why he applied for this loan.

In the future after he has gained the experience he seeks, Sameh wants to open his own shop in another area as another branch for their family’s shop.

loans.use: to work on expanding the business to include selling at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro a sus 43 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmente tiene cultivos de aguacate y cilantro en terrenos de propiedad familiar. El Señor Álvaro dedica su tiempo libre a los cultivos ya que también él trabaja como operario agrícola en un cultivo de flores en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. El señor Álvaro cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en el oficio puesto que pertenece a una familia de agricultores.
El señor Álvaro tiene dos hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad; el menor de sus hijos tiene una enfermedad en el colón y requiere de una cirugía y del consumo de medicinas muy costosas. 
Actualmente, el señor Álvaro desea sembrar palos de aguacate y de esta manera seguir creciendo con su actividad, por tanto podrá generar otros ingresos para el sustento familiar. El señor Álvaro sueña con ver a su hijo recuperado de la enfermedad que tiene y continuar trabajando para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Sr. Álvaro, 43, is a farmer. Currently he is growing avocados and cilantro on family land. He dedicates his free time to his own farming since he also works as a farm laborer in flower cultivation in the municipality of Carmen de Viboral, located east of Antioquia. He has many years of experience in this work since he belongs to a family of farmers.

Álvaro has two sons, 15 and 6 years old. The youngest of his sons has a disease of the colon that requires surgery and very expensive medication.

At present, Álvaro wants to plant more avocados and continue growing as a farmer so that he will be able to generate additional income to support his family. He dreams of seeing his son recovered from his the illness and of continuing to work to give his family an education and a  better quality of life.

loans.use: to plant avocados.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a 42-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 3 children, ages 10, 8 and 7.

Ma. Fe and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops to sell. Ma. Fe's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Ma. Fe, on the other hand, makes an extra income weaving mats to sell. She does her best to take care of her family and help provide for their needs.

Ma. Fe is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leny

texts.es: La señora Leny nacida en Galilea - Santa Cruz, hace 27 años convive con el señor Rolando  con el cual tienen 2 hijos, el para trabajando fuera de casa por temporadas largas y la señora Leny tiene un negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 1 año y medio, donde ella vende toda la semana y su mayor ganancia son sábados y domingos, y de esta manera colabora con los gastos del hogar,  el crédito que solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería de ropa para ampliar el negocio, ropa de temporada ya que por estas fiestas de fin de año tiene mucha demanda de ropa y tiene mucha clientela, y se encuentra con muchos pedidos que tiene que entregar, la Sra. Leny es una persona muy amable y trabajadora que tiene que dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos y de su negocio ya que con esta actividad solventa los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Leny was born in Galilea in Santa Cruz.  She is 27 years old and lives with Señor Rolando, with whom she has two children.  He works away from home for long periods of time, and Señora Leny has had her business selling clothing for the last year and a half.  She sells throughout the week and her best earnings are on Saturdays and Sundays.  In this this way she contributes to covering the household expenses.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing clothing merchandise to expand her business; it will be seasonal clothing, as the at the holidays at the end of the year, there is great demand for clothing and she get many customers and many orders that she must meet.

Señora Leny is a very friendly and hard-working person who must look after her children and her business, as with this activity she covers the household expenses.

loans.use: to expand further her business selling clothing.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronicah is 47 years old and married to Reuben. She runs a grocery store and has been in business for the past 5 years. She earns a monthly income of about Kes 30,000. She is requesting her first loan of Kes 10,000. She plans to purchase stock items for the grocery store. Her dreams are to expand her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Malis, 29, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a wholesaler who sells gas at home and also distributes to her clients around the province. Additionally, she has a rental house which generates more income for the family. Her husband runs a phone shop and Internet shop in Phnom Penh city. 

Due to the increasing demand for gas in the province, Malis is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more gas to distribute to her clients. This way she will make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to invest more money in her business in order to become a gas distributor who directly purchases gas from the company. Moreover, she plans to buy a flat for her husband to run his phone shop and Internet shop in Phnom Penh city and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more gas to distribute to her clients.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34, married, and has four children of ranging from 22 to 18 years old. She sells charcoal and also runs a retail shop. Elizabeth has been in business for 13 years with a monthly income of 31,400 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

Elizabeth is borrowing a loan of 40,000 KES which she intends to purchase more stock of charcoal and also to add stock to her retail shop. She plans to plough back the anticipated profit to the business. This is her third loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Kashuli Group

texts.fr: Espoir et sa sœur Stella ont été initié aux travaux champêtres depuis 2004 par leurs parents avant qu'ils ne décèdent tous les deux. Ils continuent dès lors à exploiter leur champ. Lors de l'expérience passée, ils ont réalisé un montant de quatre cents dollars dont deux cents ont remboursé leurs charges mais les deux cents autres comme gain. Espoir se plaint de l'insuffisance financière pour exploiter toute la superficie. Il est confiant que les crédits de PAIDEK l'aiderons sûrement à exploiter toute la superficie leur appartenant, pouvoir fonder un foyer et scolariser les enfants.

loans.use: Travaux de sarclage jusqu'à la récolte

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is married with 6 dependants. She is a very active lady and a treasurer of Ole Roimen Women Group.

Teresia is the sole supplier of Furniture in her locality. She gets orders from the schools and residents since she does quality work. Though she is not able to meet the demand of her clients on time due to limited capital and lack of wood curving machine. In addition to the furniture business, she sells vegetables and milk from her zero grazed cows. Her income from farming is steady throughout the year.

loans.use: Given the loan of USD.1100 She will purchase a wood curving machine and increase the stock of timbers.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo D. is married with two children. Her husband is a taxi-moto driver. She has become an experienced fabric retailer, thanks to her dynamism and level of education. She had no problem managing and repaying two previous loans. In the textile trade, one must stock the latest patterns and designs. Otherwise, a retailer can easily lose clientele. The means that Mrs. D. has today don’t allow her to keep up with these trends to satisfy her demanding customers. To overcome this shortfall, she is seeking an $850 loan to enlarge her fabric display to meet market demand. This project’s financing will allow her to increase her income, which will have a positive impact on her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Adjo est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son mari est un conducteur de taxi moto. Revendeuse de pagne, elle a acquis une grande expérience dans le domaine grâce à son dynamisme et à son niveau d’instruction. Elle a eu à gérer deux fois de suite des crédits qu’elle a remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Le commerce de pagne est tel qu’il faut suivre le rythme des nouveautés qui sortent. Autrement, on perd facilement la clientèle. Les moyens dont dispose aujourd’hui Madame D. ne lui permettent plus de suivre ce rythme afin de pouvoir satisfaire des clients très exigeants. Pour pallier à ces insuffisances, elle sollicite un appui financier d’un montant de $850 afin d’agrandir son étalage pour satisfaire la demande du marché. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu qui aura un impact positif sur le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase and sale of traditional fabric

loans.name: Progress

texts.en: "I changed to this business four (4) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 39 years old; my numerous customers always give me satisfaction", says Mrs. progress O.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sales

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a rural teacher. His wife and 2 children are dairy farmers, and they sell their dairy products to Pil Andina (which is an industrialization milk plant). They live in the Achacachi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used towards the purchase of a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario, trabaja en el magisterio rural (es maestro rural), la esposa y sus dos hijos son productores de leche de vaca que comercializan a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). Viven en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito le servirá para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Umoru

texts.en: Umoru B. is fifty-years old and married with four children.  He runs a business of selling palm oil wholesale to small retailers in the town market of Kabala in Sierra Leone.  He started his business four years ago and was been able to keep making a profit.  Umoru said with the profit generated from previous loans from SMT, he was able to purchase some land for the family and meet his family expenses.  He now wants to generate more income for re-investment and for repairing the family house.  Umoru is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to purchase twenty-two “gerri cans” of palm oil.

loans.use: Expansion of Wholesale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more avocados for sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, is a native of Cochas GranD.. She was born and raised in a family of farmers and artisans, and this training has helped her succeed. When she was about 10 years old, her parents taught her the art of carving the "burilados" mats and she has trained her six children who also work making these mats. Carmen feels very satisfied with the work she does, she is delighted that she developed fine strokes, and what especially pleases her is when one of her animals goes to graze in the field, and she draws inspiration from the blue skies to incorporate in her work. Now, that most of her children are adults, and all that is left is to look after her young ones, she'd like to continue with her work in order to ensure that her children have a better future. Carmen would like to move forward applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of materials and supplies and continue creating her beautiful mats. She would also like to buy fodder for her animals. Let's join with Carmen and continue generating prosperity for her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, es natural D. Cochas GranD., nació y creció en una familia netamente agricultora y artesanal, esta formación la ha ayudado a salir adelante debido a que desD. los diez años sus padres le han enseñado el arte D. tallar los mates burilados y ahora ella transmite estos conocimientos a sus seis hijos que también trabajan realizando estos trabajos con mucho esmero.Carmen se siente muy satisfecha del trabajo que realiza, a ella le agrada mucho elaborar finos trazos y lo hace muy gustosa aún más cuando se va a pastar a sus animales al campo y aprovecha la inspiración del azul del cielo para hacer finos trazos del dibujo que desea plasmar.Ahora que la mayoría D. sus hijos están en edad adulta sólo le queda velar por los menores y desea continuar con su labor para asegurar en sus hijos un futuro mejor y también su vejez. Para seguir adelante solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra D. materiales e insumos para seguir elaborando sus bellos mates y también para comprar forraje para sus animalitos. Solidaricémonos con Carmen para que continúe generando bienestar a su querida familia.

loans.use: To purchase material and supplies in order to continue creating her beautiful crafts/decorations. (Compra de materiales e insumos para continuar con la fabricación de sus bellos adornos.)

loans.name: Margreth

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Margreth M.. In 2001 she established a business seliing African print cloth. She now requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional stock in bulk. Margreth is married to husband Daudi, with whom she has three children. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of African cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Abdugappor

texts.en:
S. Abdugappor lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 5 children. Mr.S. became the client of MicroInvest because he had heard many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan procedure that helped his friends to develop and improve their businesses. Thus he has been a client of MicroInvest since 2003. His loans improve his business stability and increased his income which helped him to return his previous loans on time.

He is engaged in a home business of raising and selling livestock. He has 20 years of experience in this business and has developed the appropriate skills to use in the practice. Now Mr. S. requests a loan of $625 to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en: María is in her late fifties, and she is an experienced and many-sided entrepreneur. María sells sweets and candies to people of the Batey Palavé community of San Cristobal. She also sells a wide collection of bedspreads, curtains and shoes in the same community. She explains that she’ll press on toward her main goal, which is to buy a comfortable house so that her five children can live at ease. She hopes that her business can turn into a ‘Big Store’ with so many customers that she’ll have to hire many employees to attend to them.

loans.use: Maria would like to purchase bedspreads, curtains and other goods to restock her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her store's stock

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Senora Nimia is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located in the district of Manantay in Ucayali. She is 43 years old and has 5 children. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business selling food and drinks. Today, she continues to run her business with the help of her children. They get up early to prepare the food, and then they sell the meals in the afternoon.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will expand her business by buying more utensils, sodas and sweets. Nimia appreciates the loans and she feels comfortable that she can continue to work with a good support system in place to help women like herself.

La señora Nimia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Nueva América Mz 17 Lt. 1-2, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 5 hijos. Nimia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida y golosinas. En la actualidad continua con su venta de comida y golosinas, con la ayuda de sus hijos se levantan temprano para dedicarse a la preparación de sus comidas, y en las tardes sale a vender sus comidas. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implantara su negocio con la compra de utensilios, gaseosas, y golosinas en general. Nimia agradece el préstamo que le brindo Manuela Ramos, a través de su banco comunal así mismo se siente muy cómoda de seguir trabajando con un buen respaldo y apoyo para todas las mujeres.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE UTENSILS, SODAS AND SWEETS TO CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to keep satisfying her customers' needs

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long P., 24, is married and lives with her three young children in Kampong Cham province. Her only source of income is her husband, who has a business raising pigs but is unable to make enough money to support their family. She would like to begin to breed ducks to sell them and their eggs for a profit.

Long P. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $1,000 to buy ducks. If there is money left over, she will purchase pig feed with the balance of the funds. She sees this loan as a good economic decision, and believes it can both increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy ducks and pigfeed.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1973 in Agbanakin in Togo, Mr. Kodjo K. is a very dynamic and dedicated carpenter. He is married and has six children. The profit he derives from his carpentry business being no longer able to help him meet the various household expenses, he has decided to diversify his sources of income.

For this, he is asking for a loan to buy and raise pigs and goats with a view to increase his income and improve the living conditions of the members of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1973 à Agbanakin au Togo, Monsieur K. Kodjo est un menuisier très dynamique et très dévoué. Il est marié et est père de six enfants. Le bénéfice qu’il dégage de son activité de menuiserie ne lui permettant plus de faire face aux multiples charges familiales, il décide de diversifier ses sources de revenus.

Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter et élever des porcs et chèvres dans la perspective d’augmenter ses revenus et d’améliorer les conditions de vie des membres de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and raise pigs and goats

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a member of the Community Bank Atinchik which means "We can" in Quechua.

Vilma is a widow, 48 years old, and has 4 children. 3 of her children live with her. Vilma sells blankets, comforters, bedspreads, and other products ordered by her customers. She purchases her products in the city of Tacna, Lima, where she travels every 15 days.

In addition to this, Vilma is a sales agent of surgical steel pots, for which she receives a commission. She also works as a teacher in a local school.

Vilma needs a loan of 1000 Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of various blankets.

Vilma's dream is to have a stable business and her own capital so that she is able to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa Podemos en quechua.

Vilma es viuda, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Vilma venD. frazadas, edredones, cobertores, y otros productos D. acuerdo a los pedidos D. sus clientes, sus productos los adquiere D. la ciudad D. Tacna, Lima a donD. viaja cada 15 días. Ademas Vilma es agente D. ventas D. ollas D. acero quirúrgico por lo cual obtiene una comisión. Vilma también trabaja como profesora en una escuela D. la ciudad.

Vilma necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frazadas variadas. Los sueños D. Vilma son tener una tienda estable donD. pueda vender sus productos y capital propio.

loans.use:
Vilma needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of a variety of blankets.

Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de frazadas variadas.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Doña Albertina tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer que ya son mayores de edad, doña Albertina trabaja como docente de la Educación  primaria en un colegio de Managua,  tiene 9 años de experiencia como maestra y presenta como un plan futuro seguirse preparando académicamente para fortalecerse como profesional de la educación en Nicaragua, Nos solicita apoyo para recibir crédito para componer la tubería del desagüe de su casa de habitación y también poder embaldosar parte del patio ya que en época de Invierno el agua acumulada pone la tierra muy difícil de transitar.
texts.en:
Doña Albertina is 45 years old. She is single and has two children, one man and one woman who are already grown up. Doña Albertina works as a teacher for primary education in a high school in Managua. She has 9 years of experience as a teacher and she has a plan for the future in order to continue preparing academically to improve herself as an educational professional in Nicaragua. She has asked us for help in getting a loan in order to repair the piping of the drains in her home and also to be able to tile part of the patio that during winter accumulates floods her floor, making it very difficult to pass.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change the drainage pipes and tile the patio

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima F. was born in 1971 and comes from a village named Đurđevik near Živinive. She is a housewife and her husband works out of Bosnia. She keeps busy by her handwork – she makes table suites and such things and Fatima does mostly the orders. Beside that she has her garden and now she wants to try poultry. That is the reason that she takes a loan in WWI in amount of 1200 KM. She will use this loan to buy poultry and food for them.

loans.use: Fatima would like to buy poultry.

loans.name: Djiguiya (Espérance) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un groupe de l’association Yankadi composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, des coépouses et les enfants dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région Koulikoro République du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de mariage et font en général le commerce de bois de chauffe. En plus du bois de chauffe, elles font également l’achat et la vente des différents articles tels les céréales et le charbon de bois.
 Dans le souci de constituer un stock important afin d’éviter les ruptures elles ont décidées ensemble d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis une année. Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux précédents prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) elles sont à leur troisième prêt.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter et stocker du bois de chauffe destiné au marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les bois de chauffe sont achetés avec les paysans ayant un permis de coupe (à Marka-Coungo et dans les villages environnants) et stockés en brousse jusqu'à ce qu’elles obtiennent la quantité souhaitée. Ensuite elles cherchent des camions pour les acheminer sur Bamako où des grossistes achètent au comptant toute la cargaison. Au retour elles achètent des articles divers qui seront vendus à Marka –Coungo.
Avec ce prêt elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel et moyen de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour renforcer le fonds de commerce et aider les maris à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. Elles ambitionnent créer une association pour la promotion et la sauvegarde des intérêts des vendeurs du bois de chauffe à Marka-Coungo.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group from the Yankadi association consisting of four women, all married and with an average age of 29 and two children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses and children in the village of Marka-Coungo (in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali). They met through neighborhood and marriage ties, and mainly sell firewood. In addition to firewood, they buy and sell miscellaneous items such as cereals and charcoal. Keen to build up a decent stock in order to avoid shortages, a year ago they decided, as a group, to join the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. Having successfully repaid two previous solidarity loans (group loans), they are now on their third loan. They plan to use this loan to stock up on firewood to sell at the market in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The firewood is bought in conjunction with peasants holding a wood-cutting permit (in Marka-Coungo and surrounding villages) and stored in the bush until the women obtain the desired quantity. They then arrange for trucks to take it to Bamako where wholesalers pay cash for the entire load. On the way back, they buy miscellaneous items to sell in Marka-Coungo. Through this loan they expect to make an average monthly profit of CFA 35,000, which will be used to strengthen their working capital and help their husbands meet the family expenses. Their goal is to create an association to promote and safeguard the interests of the firewood sellers in Marka-Coungo.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María B. se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua donde comercializa sus perecederos a sus fieles clientes que le visitan a diario en el mercado.

Su trabajo lo realiza todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y es por esto que se ha dedicado a laborar mas en su actividad para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Hoy en día la razón por la cual espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los perecederos, es importante destacar que por medio de este crédito logrará la compra de las frutas y verduras que tanto requiere.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria B. sells fruits and vegetables in the Ivan Montenegro Market in Managua. She sells goods to her faithful customers who visit her daily at the market. She works every day, starting early in the morning, in order to improve the economic condition of her family. Because of this, she has put her hope in Kiva partner Ceprodel and applied for a loan to buy more products. It is important to bring out that this loan will help with the purchase of fruits and vegetables that she needs so much.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Inti (“Sun” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and is married with two children. Elizabeth is a stylist, and is planning to open a beauty salon in Ayacucho. She is originally from Ayacucho, but was living and working in Lima until recently, when she decided to move home and open a new salon. She is partnering with her sister in this business venture. Her sister is a masseuse, so the two plan to open a full-service salon. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 1600 soles, which she will use to prepare and decorate the space in which she plans to open the new salon. 

Elizabeth has been a member of the Inti Village Bank for eight years now. She says she loves coming to meetings, since her mother, her sister, and her sisters-in-law are all members of the same bank and meetings are a nice space to share and be with family and friends. 

Elizabeth’s goal for the future is to open a full-service spa in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Prepare space to open beauty salon

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Moa Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which consists of seventeen people, is located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Mom M. is the village bank president. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 1-hectar field. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to deal with her problem. Her husband, Mr. Phin Meng, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Mom M. is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are all attendI. the local school. Mrs. Koe Sovannary and Mrs. C. Sotheary who are group guarantors are also shown in the picture with the village bank loan members.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to deal with her problem.

loans.name: You's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people, all of whom live in Prekpras Sdach Commune of Battambang Province. The group leader is L., 35, who earns a living by selling clothes in and around her community. She is married and has three children who are single and attend school. Her husband Viet, 44,  sells snooker equipment that he makes by himself. 

L. had been selling clothes since 2006, and she can earn about $3 a day. She buys the clothes in bulk and resells them in retail. Her work has improved her family's income. L. is seeking a loan to purchase additional clothes. 

The other three borrowers are:
T., who sells beef in the market, and she requests a loan to buy more beef.
S. L., who sells perfume in the market, and she asks for a loan to increase her inventory.
N., who is a teacher, and she is applying for a loan to pay her children's school fee.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU est une femme mariée  elle est agée de 34 ans .elle vit dans la concession de son mari .son principale activité est le commerce de tissus qu 'elle vend aux femmes de quartier.Elle fait ce metier depuis plusieurs années.Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de satisfaire des depenses mineures des enfants.avec le prt qu élle compte renforcer son fond de commerce pour profiter de l"arriver des vendeurs saisions de tissus pour augmenter ses stocks.
texts.en:
Fatou is 34 years old, married, and lives at her husband's house. For several years, her main business has been consisting in selling fabrics to women in her neighborhood. The profits of this business enables her to provide for the children's small expenses. With this loan, she intends to bolster her stock by taking advantage of the arrival of the seasonal cloth vendors.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan I. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to open a bar. Susan is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar

loans.name: Leonidas Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 43 años, vive  con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace uno año vende pescado en un triciclo y una carpa para cubrirse, siempre quiso aventurarse por tener un ingresos propios, así decidió implementar este negocio, que en la actualidad es el motor de la economía familiar. Todas las mañanas compra su pescado fresco en el mercado de su zona.
