Que su producto esté fresco es el sello de garantía de sus ventas, además de la calidad y peso exacto que ofrece, ha podido adquirir clientes regulares, por lo que sus ventas son estables. Es la  segunda vez que Margarita está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, está muy decidida a seguir progresando y ha notado que su banco comunal está siendo un espacio desarrollo personal y empresarial. El dinero requerido lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, además de cuchillos nuevos para poder cortar mejor la carne de pescado.
texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children in their own house. For the past year, she has sold fish on a tricycle and a tent to cover her. She always wanted to challenge herself to have her own income, so she decided to start this business, which is currently the motor of the family economy. Every morning, she buys her fresh fish at the market in her neighborhood. The freshness of her product is the guarantee of her sales. In addition to the quality and exact weight that she offers, she has been able to acquire regular clients, so that her sales are stable. This is the second time that Margarita has asked for a loan through MFP. She is very determined to continue progressing and has noticed that her community bank is a space for personal and business development. She will invest the requested money in the purchase of more merchandise, in addition to new knives to be able to better cut the meat of the fish.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en: Mrs. Ruos R., 24, is a good homemaker who cares for children and cooks tasty meals for her family. She is married and has two children who are going to school. Besides her housework, she also helps her husband with his fishing business. The head of the family is Mrs. R.'s husband, who makes an income by catching fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. Recently, R.'s husband has not been able to go fishing because he lacks necessary fishing equipment. R. has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase nets and traps for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase nets and traps for fishing.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Señor Ricardo J. de 33 años de edad está acompañado  hace 10 años con la señora Sandra Rotela de 28 años, la pareja tiene cinco hijos de 10, 7, 4, 3, y 1 años de edad, el primero está en el quinto grado y el segundo está en el segundo grado y los otros todavía no están en la edad escolar.
El señor Ricardo hace siete años que se dedica a la venta ambulante. Empezó con un capital inicial que había juntado de su trabajo anterior, estuvo trabajando como vendedor y cobrador en casas dedicadas a la ventas de muebles y electrodomésticos, también siempre ayudado y apoyado por su señora.
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de sillones chicos y grandes, camisas, pantalones, short, calza, sandalia zapatilla, media y de esta forma ofrecer mucha variedad a sus clientes y con eso aumentar sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo J. is 33 years old, and has been with Sandra Rotela for the past 10 years, who is 28 years old. Together, they have 5 kids, ages 10, 7, 4, 3, and 1. The oldest is in 5th grade, the next oldest is in 2nd grade, and the others have yet to begin school. Ricardo has been selling various goods for the past 7 years. He began his business with money he saved from his previous work as furniture and appliance salesperson. He has always had the support of his wife Sandra. Ricardo is requesting a loan to purchase large and small armchairs, shirts, pants, shorts, sandals, and socks, in order to offer more variety to his clients and thereby increase his monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his business.

loans.name: Sugran Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Maqsooda baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a dryer for her beauty salon.

Fozia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Sugran baji, wife of M. A., has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband has a tailoring center in the community and sews clothes and earns income. Sugran baji also helps him by sewing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that he is able to sew more clothes and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia J. resides at Manil, Leon B. Postigo. She is forty-one years old and married to Jaime, a fisherman. She has four children: three of them are helping in generating an income. Her daughter, Liza, is her companion in running their business.

Alicia started her dried-fish vending and fish selling business in 1995 and it has served them well as their primary source of income. She sells her dried fish thrice a week during "tabo" or market day.

She commenced her membership in Paglaum in November 2008. She shows active participation in the micro-finance program. She is now applying for her first loan in the cooperative. She is very optimistic that such loan will help in developing her business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish-vending business

location.town: Sindangan-Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine Z. was born in 1978 in Abomey Calavie, in southern Benin.  She is married to Marcellin Dossa, a tailor, and she is the mother of four children. For ten years, she has been living with her family in PK10, a neighborhood in the community of Sèmè-Podji, not far from Cotonou.  

Victorine works in food sales. She sells rice and beans near the Cotonou to Porto-Novo autoroute. Her daily sales average around thirty thousand West African Francs, which is about sixty dollars. Victorine would like to buy ten sacs of rice, a sac of beans, and other goods. She likes to buy in bulk because it is cheaper and more efficient. With the help of a loan, Victorine hopes to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Dios Nos Ayude Group

texts.es: El Grupos Solidario Dios Nos Ayude está conformado por Jacoba Ramona Solís Mejía  y Hilda de Jesús Mejía  B. . Las actividades económicas de ambas son diferentes. Pero ambas luchan por lo mejor y así seguir adelante con su negocio. Por lo que solicitan este financiamiento para invertir en sus negocios. Ellas son personas responsables y muy trabajadoras. El sueño de ellas es seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta los momentos.
texts.en:
The Dios Nos Ayude (God help us) Group is made up of Jacoba Ramona Solís Mejía and Hilda de Jesús Mejía B.. The two have different economic activities, but both fight for the best and thus move forward with their business. For that reason they request this financing to invest in their businesses. They are both responsible, very hard-working women. Their dream is to continue working as they have up to now.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a member of the Force and Power village bank. She is 44 years old and has three children who are 15, 10, and 6 and who all go to school.

Susana owns a curtain-making shop but also sells beauty products from a catalog. She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy more beauty products as well as shower and window curtains. Her dream is to build a house for herself where she can live and run her business.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and shower and window curtains

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
Zouheir lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. He has been selling tires since 1992. Zouheir has requested a loan of $700 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Zouheir is special because he sells good quality tires. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Zouheir decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing a bigger shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Sasfy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sasfy L., 21, and her husband, Mr. Man Kob, 34, were married in 2000 and have four children. They have three sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in school. The famiL. lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sasfy has been selling clothes for 10 years. She buys clothes from market located in Phnom Penh for resale in her village. Her husband has been a construction worker for five months. He works in his village. 

Sasfy wants to expand her business to become bigger and so she will able to generate more income.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To expand her selling clothes business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa, 42 years old, is from the village of Santa Isabel Norte, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Ronilo Montales who is working hard in their own farm. They have four children, of whom two are still studying. Their eldest Jenilyn is now 20 years old and already married. Second is Raphie, 19 years old, a high school graduate; he is now helping his father in the farm. Next is Riezel Grace, 16 years old, she is presently studying as a first year college student . Rona Jean, their youngest, is now 14 years old and she is presently a third year student in secondary school.

Narcisa has been selling vinegar and soy sauce in their village. She purchases vinegar and soy sauce in huge containers and retails it by dividing or pouring it into small bottles. From this business, Narcisa is generating a net income of PHP 5,000 monthly which is of great help in providing the needs of their family.

Narcisa is planning to re-open her general store but she has insufficient capital to purchase various commodities. For this reason, she is requestingl a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to be used as additional starting capital for her retail business. She hopes that with the help of lenders, she will be able to pursue her retail business to provide a better living for her family. She hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: additional capital to pursue her retail business

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal O. is the group leader of a six members loan group who all live in Reussei SrO. village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Un Sotum, sell bananas in the local market. Since this business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sophal O. decided to request a loan to buy more bananas to resell to earn more income to support the family’s standard of living. She is 42 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Pey

texts.en:
Pey S., 29, lives Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling grocery inventory, such as cooked food and sweets for kids, from her house. She has been in this business for a long time.

Pey S. is married and currently takes care of two children, all of whom are single and also attend school, whilst her husband works in construction.

Pey S. works hard every day and is a very responsible to her family. Recently, she sold all her groceries from her store. Because selling groceries is Pey S.'s main way to earn an income to support her family, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a range of grocery item to sell. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to buy a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a range of grocery item to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria J. is from the village of San Vicente in Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 9500 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to be used as working capital. This will be Gloria's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann P., 38, makes a living cooking specialized dishes that are served at weddings in his home provence of Takeo. He typically makes about $3 per day, and that income is supplemented by his wife, who makes $2 a day from farming. The couple has five school-aged children. Chann P. has applied for a loan for $1,200 to expand his business. When someone hires him to prepare food for a wedding, these funds will help him provide the meal quickly and efficiently.

loans.use: to expand a business providing wedding banquets

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 45 años, vive al lado de su esposo Zenón,  también de 45 años, y con sus jóvenes  hijos, Doris de 23 y Jessica de 21 años. Todos viven felices y con muchas ganas de progresar en su casa que es propia.Desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (platillo compuesto de papas y salchichas fritas),  y le va muy bien en el  negocio ya que la cocina siempre ha sido una de sus principales habilidades. La venta empieza durante  la tarde, ya que por las  mañanas debe dedicarse a las labores del hogar y atender a su familia, además al empezar la noche este  plato es muy requerido por las personas que llegan a sus casas después de un día de larga faena laboral, y  en el camino se les provoca degustar de la salchipapa que prepara Carmen. En un futuro quiere ampliar  su negocio para que le rinda mayores ganancias y aperturar su propio restaurante.Es el  quinto préstamo con  MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en  todos los pagos, y promete serlo una vez más porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para poder incrementar sus ventas y sus  ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old. She lives with her husband Zenón, also 45, and their children, Doris, 23, and Jessica, 21. They have a happy life in their own house, with a strong desire to get ahead.

For the past several years, Carmen has had a business selling salchipapas; a dish made of potatoes and fried sausage. The business has succeeded because cooking has always been one of her greatest skills. She begins work in the afternoon, as the morning is devoted to household and family chores. This works out well, as her product is very popular with people who stop on the way home after a hard day’s work, tempted by Carmen’s salchipapa.

In the future, Carmen would like to expand her business into a true restaurant, which would yield greater profits. This her fifth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments and promises to do so again, as she has a great desire to get ahead. With the loan money, she will purchase a larger quantity of ingredients to increase sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Cecilia Giuliana

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia Giuliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Gaviotas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 19 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Cecilia Giuliana, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Cecilia Giuliana belongs to the "Las Gaviotas II" Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, San Martin Province. She is 19 years old, single, and has one son, who is dependent on her. Cecilia Giuliana is a perserverant and capable woman. She sells clothing out of a well equipped space in her home and reports that it is going very well. She counts on clients who know her and her business. Her strength and perserverance have helped her grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of her achievements. With this loan of 1000 soles she will buy merchandise to increase her stock, such as: pants, shorts, all sizes and styles of blouses, polo shirts and dresses for adults and children. She considers herself an established and hard working woman and appreciates the opportunity that the Movimiento Manual Ramos has offered her to develop as a woman and as a small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Elinya

texts.en:
Elinya L. is 35 years old and married to a teacher. She has four school-aged children. Elinya is currently in the business of selling clothes, shoes and sandles at the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy new material to make bedsheets to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy two sewing machines for making bedsheets.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy material to make new bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Rung

texts.en:
Mrs. Rung M. is 44 years old and she lives in Rung village, Takeo province. She is a married woman with four children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory while the other two are attending the local school. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Nhor Vong, is a cow middleman.
Right now, Mrs. Rung M. is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to support her husband's business by purchasing 4 cows. With the help of her loans from AMK, she has been able to increase the family's income from her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase 4 cows.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez C. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 39 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedez owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products such as bananas, etc. in the local community. Mercedez has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mercedez joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan Mercedez has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 46, is in the rice-farming business. She started her business way back in 1993. She is now managing a rice field in Agusan del Sur. She loves her work on the farm. She is the mother of four children; her eldest is 20 years old. She strives hard in order to provide for the basic needs of her family.

She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to support the financing of her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies and seeds

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda T., 32 years old, owns a rice farm. She has five children with the eldest being 12 years old. She keeps on thinking of a good business to venture into so that she will be able to provide the basic needs of her family.

Linda is managing her farm with her husband and desires an abundant harvest. She said that she learned to farm since she was just a kid: her parents taught her everything.

Linda wants to make her farm productive in honor of her late husband. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria S. is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy 5, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by providing desktop publishing services to her community.

Macaria’s husband Reynante helps his wife run their computer printshop business. They have four children who are between 15-23 years old. Three of their children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores and one child already has a family and a child. 

Macaria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a computer-aided printing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000 from her business activities.

Macaria is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 15,000 for her 14th loan, which she intends to use expand the services she provides to her customers. Macaria is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Olapade

texts.en: Olapade sells mouth watery Nigerian cooked foods. She has been in this business for long and she is popularly known as ‘mama put’ in her community. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to see her business and family life make progress. She has been in this business for long. She is 43 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She is requesting for a loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Agbei

texts.fr:
Agée de 40 ans, cette dame reste très active. Elle est revendeuse de céréales. Elle voyage régulièrement sur les marchés aux  céréales du pays, notamment SOTOUBOUA, BLITTA. Elle y achète du maïs, mil, sorgho, haricot et arachide. Elle associe à ce commerce, la vente du charbon de bois.
La vente des marchandises se fait à son domicile. Le crédit actuellement sollicité est destiné à l’achat de cette saison agricole.
Elle compte sur l’accroissement de ses activités grâce à ce nouveau crédit pour mieux contribuer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aged 40, this woman has remained very active. She sells cereals and travels regularly to the country’s cereal markets, particularly in Sotouboua and Blitta. She buys corn, millet, sorghum, beans and groundnuts. She also has a business selling charcoal. She sells the goods out of her home. The loan requested will be used to make purchases during the agricultural season. She wants to use this loan to grow her business and contribute more to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cereals and charcoal

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera y tiene 1 hijo, Rosa tiene un puesto en la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende periódicos, semanarios, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de periódicos.
Su mayor sueño es que su hijo culmine sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and has one son. She has a stall in the Plaza de Armas in the city of Ayacucho, Peru, where she sells newspapers and magazines. She works there every day of the week. Rosa belongs to the Imasumacc Communal Bank, whose name means "how beautiful" in Quechua. The thing she likes the most about being a member of this bank is the incentive to save money. Rosa needs a loan for 1500 Peruvian soles, which she will use to buy newspapers. Rosa's greatest dream is for her son to finish school and have a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of newspapers

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann S. is a 26-year-old married father caring for two young kids. Both children are still living in the family home and are pupils in the local primary school. Chann is a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electricity wires and plastics. His wife assists him with his business activities. Chann is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more stock to increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy more stock to increase his profits

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.en:
T. Abdurakhmon is 32 years old. Together with his wife they have 3 children. Bakhtiyor is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 10 years. He is baking the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His wife helps him with his business. 

Having many customers Abdurakhmon is selling the majority of his products just from his place. However, he is also running the trading place in the central local market for selling lepeshka. 

Now Abdurakhmon requests $1500 USD. He is planning to purchase flour at wholesale as required for his business. Abdurakhmon is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour

loans.name: Elizabeth Kasaya

texts.en:
Elizabeth Kasaya O. is 28 years old. She is married and is the happy mother of four children. Ever since she got married, Elizabeth has always been in business as she aspires to be an independent woman though married.

Elizabeth started with charcoal selling, but with things not going the way she planned, she decided to quit and started farming in 2007. Since then, she has excelled with all her produce getting buyers who come for them at her farm in Nyamasaria.

Elizabeth would like to expand her business in order to meet the rising demand and improve her living standard. She wishes to obtain a Ksh 30,000 loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. cooks banku for sale at Takoradi (banku is a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup.).

Akua has received no educational background. She is married and has three children. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Akua’s loan will be used to buy more maize, some to cook and some to sell raw. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to beautify her sales location so she can get more customers.

loans.use: To buy more maize, some to cook and some to sell raw

loans.name: Irma Angelica

texts.es: Irma Angélica A. y su esposo con ahorros han ido construyendo su casa pero en este momento ellos requieren de un préstamo para terminar el baño. Ellos quieren enjarrar por dentro y comprar los accesorios como los son el inodoro, el lavabo y regadera. Este proyecto lo quieren realizar para ofreces a su hijos la mayor comodidad y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe Lagunas bought a lot upon which is a house in ruins. She wants to demolish that house and begin the foundation of a new house. Maria Guadulupe wishes to give her son a higher standard of living and an inheritance when he grows up. Maria is a hard-working woman; she is exposed to the elements as she looks for customers who will become affiliated with a banking institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a bathroom

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N., 52 years old, lives in Magongo, Mombasa. She is married to Mwandoe N. who also works and adds to the family income. They are blessed with two children.

Elizabeth has been a greengrocer for the last ten years, and she says that business has been good so far. She supplements her income by selling secondhand clothes to friends and family members.

This is Elizabeth’s third loan from KADET; she repaid her previous loans well and on time. She would like to purchase more groceries for her store and additional secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Elizabeth hopes to be a prosperous business lady and take her children to good schools.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Kosar Muhammad Awais' Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a resident of the city of Borewala famous in Pakistan for its shrines. She owns a small house of two rooms in the area of Haneef Park and lives in it with her family. 

She owns and operates a business selling clothes. She takes orders from people in her neighboring areas and provides them with a different variety of clothes to earn an income for her family. She buys clothes from the city of Faisalabad which is famous for its textile industry and where the cost of clothes is cheap.  

Her husband's name is M. A. and he is involved in the business of selling bangles. He has a small bangles shop in the market where he offers his customers colorful bangles of every kind such as steel, glass and embroidered. Bangles are a jewelry item which every women loves to wear on special occasions and in their routine life as well. 

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy bangles in bulk quantities which will help him to increase his sales.

By increasing her husband's income, Kosar is hopeful that her family will be able to live a better standard of life.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy bangles for reselling

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Emmanuel y se ubica en el Estado de México. Esta comunidad se distingue porque las actividades productivas que predominan en el lugar son la Agricultura, ganadería, comercio de pescado, verduras y frutas en los tianguis de la región de la zona norte del Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes. La Sra. Marisol G. es integrante de este grupo. Ella es originaria de la comunidad de Emiliano Zapata, ha vivido en esta comunidad 26 años, se dedica a la elaboración y venta chicharrón, actividad que inició hace 5 años. Sus ventas las realiza en los tianguis de los alrededores de su municipio. La Sra. Marisol argumenta que últimamente su negocio se ha fortalecido gracias a los créditos, ya que juntamente con su esposo trabajan en la elaboración del producto. La Sra. Marisol tiene 26 años, estudio la primaria. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos, que en la actualidad dependen económicamente de ella y de su esposo y que gracias a su negocio los han sacado adelante. Quiere este crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que durante los últimos 5 años le ha dado la oportunidad de mantener a su familia y de construir una casita, ya que anteriormente vivían en casa de sus suegros. Y desea que con el crédito su negocio se siga fortaleciendo. Actualmente consiguen a préstamo la materia prima para la elaboración de su chicharrón y desea que a un mediano plazo tener su propio capital para que sus ventas incrementen y así pueda surtir el chicarrón a un menor precio y obtener una mejor demanda de sus productos.
texts.en: This group is called Emmanuel and is located in Mexico State. This community is notable because its predominant productive activities are agriculture, livestock, and commerce of fish, fruits and vegetables in the street markets of the region of the northern zone of Mexico State. The group is made up of 8 members. Mrs Marisol G. is a member of this group. She is from the community of Emiliano Zapata, and has lived in this community for 26 years. She makes and sells pork rind, an activity that she started 5 years ago. She sells in the street markets surrounding her municipality. Mrs Marisol says that her business was recently strengthened thanks to loans, since now she and her husband work together making this product. Mrs Marisol is 26 and receiving her elementary education. She is married and has 2 children, who currently depend on her and her husband. Thanks to their business, they have gotten their children ahead. She wants this loan in order to continue investing in her business, which for the last 5 years has given her the opportunity to maintain her family and build a small home, since they previously lived in the home of her in-laws. She wants her business to continue to strengthen through this loan. She is currently buying the prime materials for her pork rinds on loan, and wants to soon have her own capital so that her sales can increase, and this way she will be able to stock the pork rinds at a lower price and create greater demand for her products.

loans.use: to invest in the business

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a 35-year-old lady, married and blessed with two children who are in school.  She sells groundnuts to earn a living.  She has engaged in the business for a period of seven years. She has managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya.  She is advantaged because her business is located in a highly populated area and, therefore, she gets a good number of customers.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy groundnuts, a sufuria (cooking pot) and an umbrella. Since she does her business in the open air, she will use the umbrella to provide shade and the cooking pot for frying groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, a sufuria (cooking pot) and an umbrella.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (20201070050) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 07 (Nhóm 7).


D. is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, D. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  D. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,900,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,496,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital.  The loan will be her 4th loan taken out from SEDA.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  Nguyễn Thị N. (0) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Trương Thị D. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D. Nguyễn Thị (20201070050) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn nhóm 07 (7).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 2.900.000 VND.  Vào 2007, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.496.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Nguyễn Thị N. (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Trương Thị D. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Rio Bulay Group

texts.en:
Rio B., from the village of Locsoon,Tudela, Misamis Occidental is the 30-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member should delinquency or default occur. The official name of this borrowing group is Rio B. Group.

Rio, who is married and has one school-aged child, owns and operates a business growing crops for sale. Rio has been in business for over four years, earning approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

On June 18, 2009, Rio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, Rio is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and green crops to grow. This loan will be her second loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and green crops

loans.name: Santa Dorila

texts.es:
Santa de 49 años,  no está casada y tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos mantiene. Con la dedicación que les ha dado a sus hijos hace ya 27 años atrás ella comenzó a trabajar como comerciante informal vendiendo ropa, perfumes, cremas para poder mantenerlos con una economía estable. 

Viviendo en la Perimetral de Guayaquil una zona periurbana y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y rodeada de un estero ha podido mantener a sus hijos recorriendo estas calles y vendiendo a sus vecinos los productos para obtener un ingreso. En la actualidad vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y en ocasiones ropa trabajando independientemente en las mañanas y tardes. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene cuando trabaja es la columna que ya ha su edad le esta presentando molestias. 

Santa quiere seguir trabajando por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa, perfumes, cremas para asegurar su vejez. Tiene como meta mejorar su vivienda y poder incrementar la mercadería que tiene actualmente en venta.
texts.en:
Santa, 49, isn’t married but has four children.  She only supports two of them still.  Dedicated to her children, she started selling clothes, perfumes and creams 27 years ago to provide them with economic stability.

Living along Guayaquil’s beltway, a periurban area characterized by its unpaved streets and surrounded by a salt marsh, she has managed to support her children traversing the streets selling her products to her neighbors to earn income.   She currently sells perfumes, creams, deodorants and sometimes clothes.  She works independently mornings and afternoons.  One of the inconveniences she has to face while working is problems with her spinal column which at her age is starting to bother a little.

Santa wants to continue working so wants to use the loan to buy clothes, perfumes and creams to insure her old age.  Her goal is to improve her dwelling and increase the amount of merchandise she has on stock to sell.

loans.use: For perfumes, creams, clothes.

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter, tiene 31 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vende ropa y artículos navideños, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 10 y 7, quienes dependen económicamente de él, Walter se creció en el negocio con su madre y al momento de casarse lo hizo con alguien también se creció en el comercio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y artículos navideños, esto pues preparándose para el mes de diciembre que es cuando más demanda presenta estos artículos. Con este préstamo su inventario estará surtido y  preparado para atender a los clientes dándoles un mejor servicio.
Su propósito es aprovechar la temporada para aumentar sus ventas y recibir ingresos para ir ahorrando y en un futuro tener un negocio libre de préstamos.
texts.en:
Walter is 31 years old and lives in San Miguel. He sells clothing and Christmas commodities. He lives with his wife and their three children ages 12, 10 and 7. They depend on him economically.  Walter was raised in the business with his mother and at the time he was wed, he married someone who was also raised in business. 

He is currently asking for a loan to buy clothing and Christmas goods. This will allow him to prepare for the month of December, which is when there is the greatest demand for this kind of merchandise. With the loan, he will invest in increasing his surplus inventory to assist his clients giving them better service.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Omar Ali

texts.en:
Omar Ali M. is a 38-year-old man. He is married to Shaima, and together they have been blessed with three children. His wife is a businesswoman who owns a water kiosk, which brings in additional income. Omar Ali is a poultry farmer. He has been in this business for the last two years and the business is doing well.

This is his first loan from KADET, and Omar plans to purchase chicks and chicken feed. The anticipated profits from his expanded business will be used to expand his wife’s business.

His dream is to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang S. now weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She often makes over 100 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. Recently, Hang S. has run out of essential materials from her stock supply, and she hopes to acquire more raw materials to continue her work of making baskets. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance. Hang S. is a 28-year-old married woman blessed with three children, all of whom are single and still dependent.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making baskets for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cerveza y también se dedica a trabajar como docente del nivel primario en el distrito de Yucay, la socia por medio de este negocio y trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  cerveza al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion”, which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 47 years old, married, and has four children. Rosa divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beer. She also works as a teacher at the elementary level at a school in the District of Yucay. With this business, she is able to work so that her children can get ahead. Rosa wants to expand and improve her business of selling beer, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy beer in mass quantity.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase beer in mass quantity

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is the resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan and famous for its textile industry. She has been living there in Ghafary town with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 10 years. Asia has 4 sons, all of them attending a local school.  Her husband’s name is S. J..  He operates a barber shop in the market. He offers good quality hair cutting and hair dressing services to his clients and manages a good client base. 

Asia, herself, is a house wife, who stays at home and takes care of her children and does her household chores. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who wants to buy scissors and hair products, like creams and gels, etc., for his barbershop. He will also buy some chairs and a sofa to increase the sitting arrangements for his clients. He has been doing this business for the past 3 years, and Asia is hopeful that the investment will be a productive one for him. 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will bring positive financial changes to her family's financial life.

loans.use: To buy scissors, hair products, chairs and sofa for barber shop business

loans.name: Misma

texts.en: Misma is a 60-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Misma is borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Misma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
Maman Thérèse est âgée de 50 ans, mariée mère de 2enfants dont l’âge varie entre 30 et 35ans. Elle a commencée son restaurant en 2000 avec un capital de 15000F.
Son restaurant est situé à  l’angle de sa ruelle ou elle vend le matin avec la cafétéria et a partir de 11heures 30 le restaurant avec ses plats variés.
Ses recettes journalières sont  entre 45000F et 50000F.
L’expérience du prêt précédent lui a permis d’épargner et de comprendre son activité. Pour cela elle à améliorer les conditions de son coin restaurant en ajoutant un coté ou l’on mange sur place.
Avec le prêt 2 du cycle 2, elle va continuer à renforcer son stock de marchandise en achetant :
1sac de riz, 1panier de poisson fumé, 10kilos de viande de bœuf, 1bidon d’huile  végétale, 1 filet d’oignons, 1 carton de poisson salé morue, de la pâté d’arachide, de haricot, 1carton de tomates en boites.
 
Ses 2 enfants sont grande et indépendante car ils travaillent déjà, elle s’occupe et assiste scolairement les 2autres enfants qui sont à sa charge.
Elle pense que son activité prospère chaque jour et veux plus épargner pour acheter la parcelle de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mother Thérèse is a 50 year old married mother of two; her children are between 30 and 35. She started up her restaurant in 2000 with starting capital of 15,000 F. Her restaurant is on the corner of her street, and in the morning is a sort of cafeteria, then after 11:30 becomes a restaurant with various dishes. Her daily income is between 45,000 F and 50,000 F. 
Her previous loan allowed her to put some money aside for savings and to bolster her business. She improved her restaurant's facilities by adding a seating area inside.  With her second loan she aims to purchase: a bag of rice, a basket of smoked fish, 10kg of beef, 1 flask of oil, 1 string of onions, 1 tin of salted cod, peanut butter, beans and a tin of tomatoes. 
Her two children are grown up and independent, with their own jobs, and she pays for the schooling of two other children in her care. She thinks that her business is growing each day, and wishes to put some more money aside to buy a plot of land for her children.

loans.use: to purchase: tins of meat, a basket of smoked fish, a flask of oil, a bag of rice, a string of onions, a tin of salted fish, peanut butter, beans, and tins of tomatoes

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره 54 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع اللحم والطعام له في عمله 18 سنة يتميز الدقة والنظافة.وهو متميز كثيرا  حيث انه مقصد لزبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه يسعى الى تطوير العمل وتحسين وضعه المادي. يريد أن يحسن عيش أولاده. تاريخه جيد مع المجموعة وقد اثر القرض السابق على وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وكان يلقى الدعم المعنوي من عائلته لأنه ساعدهم في تطوير دراستهم. من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة يسعى محمد الى تقوية مصلحته وذلك بشراء لحوم نقداً بأسعار جيدة ليبيعها بأسعار تشجيعية، بالإضافة إلى صيانة صحية منزله. يطمح محمد دائما إلى الاعتماد على ذاته والعيش بشكل جيد.
texts.en: Mohammad is 54 years old and married with three children. He sells meat and other foodstuffs for a living, and he has been working in this field for 18 years. He stands out in his field because of his attention to detail and because of his establishment's cleanliness. He also stands out very much in his area in that he aims to serve customers from his community and from among his neighbors and relatives. He is doing what he can to develop his business and to improve his material position. He wants the best life possible for his children. His has a good history with al-Majmoua, and his previous loan from al-Majmoua positively affected his material circumstances and social standing. He also received the support of his family during his last loan as the loan helped his family members to progress in their studies. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to benefit himself and his family by maintaining the plumbing in his house, and also reinvest in stock for his business (meat), since he continually aspires to be self-reliant and to lead a good life.

loans.use: To Buy meat  with good price and invest in plumbing for his home

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higidia; ella es separada y tiene 44 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida y también se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y chanchos, el negocio de venta de comida lo realiza en el mercado de Andahuaylillas,ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios de venta de comida y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y alimentos para los animales.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de leche, tienda de abarrotes, venta de chicha, técnico electricista, mecánico y venta de pasto.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the village bank "Los Comerciantes de Andahuaylillas". This bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, which is in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco.

One member, Mrs. Higidia, is 44 years old, separated and has 5 children. She sells food and also raises animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. She sells food in the market of Andahuaylillas, working from 7:00am until 2:00pm. With these small businesses, she helps her children to get ahead. She wants to increase and improve her food sales and animal husbandry businesses. She asks for the loan to buy cooking products and animal feed. 

The other members sell milk, run grocery stores, sell chicha [a local beverage], work as electricians and mechanics and sell pasture.

She thanks those who are part of her dream by this means, and promises to comply with the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy cooking products and animal feed

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron todo lo referente a la agricultura y es así que en la actualidad se ha convertido en una fuente muy importante de ingresos para su familia. Cada día trabaja en compañía de su esposo, en donde vigilan sus terrenos de cultivo, procurar fertilizarlos para mejorar su producción anterior. Su fin es ganar dinero lo suficiente para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y ampliar sus terrenos para sembrar mayor variedad de productos entre tubérculos y cereales, por lo que se propone en ahorrar y planificar sus compras. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y  considera que ha tenido una experiencia exitosa el haber accedido a un crédito que le permite crecer en su actividad económica de la cual esta muy agradecida,  se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 40, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  Since childhood she’s farmed because her parents taught her everything related to agriculture and it’s now become a very important source of family income.  She works daily accompanied by her husband watching over their fields attempting to better fertilize them to improve on their previous production.  Her goal is to earn sufficient money to improve her house’s infrastructure and to expand her fields to plant a larger variety of products including tubers and cereals.  She, therefore, plans to save and plan her purchases.

This is her second loan with MFP and she considers that she’s had a successful experience having accessed a loan that makes it possible for her to grow in her economic activity for which she is very grateful and committed to be punctual with her payments.

She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana de 43 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, esta casada y tienen 3 hijos 2 mellizos de 23 años y 1 de 5 años. Tiene una tienda .

Ella comenzó en su negocio hace 20 años gracia a la motivación que le dio su padres, al inicio vendía caramelos pero con el tiempo lo fue surtiendo. Ella labora de 6H00 am a 10H00 pm. Ella vende pollos a $2,00 cada uno por 1.20 libras, arroz 30qq , azúcar 35qq. Con ala ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas productos para su negocio como verduras, abastos, pollos. En un futuro desea surtir mas su negocio y agrandarla y poner una papelería.
texts.en:
Juana, aged 43, lives in the built-up area of El Guasmo. (The name is derived from Guazuma ulmifolia, the scientific name of a species of trees that is known by the common name of bastard cedar or bay cedar.) El Guasmo was formerly a ranch. Now it is a working-class neighborhood of Guayaquil with people of humble origin. Juana lives in a house built with cement, where all basic utilities are available. She is married and the mother of three children, 23-year-old twins and one 5-year-old child.

Juana owns a store. She started her business 20 years ago, thanks to the motivation received from her parents. In the beginning she sold candy, but progressively she added more goods. She works from 6 am to 10 pm. She sells chickens (a chicken of 1.20 pounds for the price of $2.00), rice (30 quintals) and sugar (35 quintals). She wants to use her loan to buy more goods for her store, such as vegetables, basic provisions and chickens. In the future she wants to stock up more goods, expand her store and add a stationary section.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, basic provisions and chickens.

loans.name: Benkelema  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres de BENKELEMA 2 sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  5 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Konona, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur troisième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieur Sont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo, de pois de terre, etc.
MAYATOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 à 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the BENKELEMA 2 group are married women who have an average age of 34 years and 5 children and live in large traditional families in Konona, located approximately 30 km from the commune of Niena in the Sikasso region, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
These clients are on their third loan cycle campaign with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the need for means of production and agricultural fertilizer.  The previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid.
This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, ground peas etc.  MAYATOU plans to use her loan to buy two bags of urea, one bag of complex fertilizer and the remainder for labor and hoeing costs.  She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 to 25,000 CFA which will be used for the family’s household expenses.

loans.use: To buy agricultural fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Nenita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a mother of 4 children between 14 and 3 years old. She practices mixed farming with the help of two farmhands in her home area of Nyamira in South Rift Kenya. Her farm produces tea and maize. She also runs a restaurant at the local market.

Norah has  requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.   Norah says that the loan will help her family improve their standard of living and she will save to make sure she has at least two additional dairy cows.

Norah says that animal diseases and the lack of farm inputs such as fertilizer are her greatest challenges.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es:
El Buen Samaritano lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María Teresa quien inicio hace 16 años con un termo de café con leche y pan con las ganancias y los préstamos invirtió en la realización de comida. Ella con el crédito comprara arroz, frijoles, azúcar…etc. 

Los otros integrantes son Jamileth se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y Miguel Ángel tiene una zapatería.
texts.en:
The Good Samaritan consists of three hard-working, enterprising people.  One of them is María Teresa, who started 16 years ago with a thermos of coffee with milk and bread, and with her earnings and loans invested in meal preparation.  With the loan she will buy rice, beans, sugar, etc.

The other members are Jamileth, who sells used clothes, and Miguel Angel has a shoe-repair shop.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bales of used shoes and crates of water.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es: Martha Luz, de 54 años es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora, esta casada y viven en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos por quienes cada día se esfuerza para darles lo mejor en educación y calidad de vida.Martha tiene como actividad la venta de abarrotes en general, además de bebidas heladas y una productora de cigarros mapacho (un tipo de cigarro regional). Ella lleva 4 años con su bodega y  cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo con quienes se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que beneficia a todos.Lo que le gusta a Martha de su negocio es que dispone de su tiempo para poder hacer otras actividades. Este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre hay clientes interesados en su producto y vende al por mayor a los minoristas que tiene como clientes.Este es el décimo préstamo de Martha con MFP pues es socia muy antigua ya que lleva casi cinco años en el grupo en donde es conocida como una mujer responsable y paciente.Con los 2000 soles solicitados ella comprará productos para su bodega, entre ellos abarrotes y bebidas para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Martha Luz, age 54, is a hard-working and very enterprising woman.  She is married, and she lives in her own house with her two children.  She puts forth effort every day in order to give her children the best education and the best quality of life.

Martha sells general groceries.  She also sells cold drinks and “Mapacho” cigarettes (a type of regional cigarette).  She has had her store for four years, and her children and her husband help her.  She is happy to be able to share the business, which benefits all of them.

What Martha likes about the business is that she arranges her time to be able to do other activities.  This business generates good income for her because there are always customers interested in her products.  She sells wholesale to the retailers who are her customers.

This is Martha’s tenth loan with MFP.  She has been a member for a very long time.  She has been in the group for almost five years.  She is known in her group for being a responsible and patient woman.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy products for her store.  Among the things she will buy are groceries and drinks that she will sell later.

loans.use: to buy products like groceries and drinks to sell at her store.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas has been operating a boutique for the last year in Oloitoktok town.  She is 31 years old and married to John. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of trousers and shirts.

In future, Felicitas hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in Oloitoktok town.

loans.use: to add stock of trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abdoulaye a plus de 42 ans, marié et père de cinq enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants à Sikasso.
Monsieur  Abdoulaye  est un mécanicien de profession qui travaille au garage de Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (C.M.D.T.) de Sikasso, en plus de cette fonction, il mène  des activités d'embouche et  de commercialisation de bétails et de l’aviculture, il y a environ huit années, dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux améliorer ses activités d'embouche, afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y'a de cela quatre ans. Après 3 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, il  sollicite son quatrième prêt pour d’aménager son enclos d'embouche et acheter 5 bovins maigres. Il achète ses bétails dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso : Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni et Kolondièba. Monsieur Abdoulaye, qui nourrit et engraisse ses animaux avant la vente dans les différents marchés à bétails tels Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso), Ouangolo (en Côte d'Ivoire)et quelque fois à Sikasso ville, gagne beaucoup en  produits laitiers grâce à ses vaches de meilleure qualité. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de bouchers et de revendeurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 350.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye is over 42 years old, married and a father of five. He lives with his wife and their children in Sikasso.
Mr. Abdoulaye is a car mechanic by trade, who works at the car repair shop of the Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (Malian Company for Textile Development) in Sikasso. In addition to his job, he has had a business fattening and selling cattle and poultry for about eight years.
In order to improve his operation and to meet ever-growing customer demand, he decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After three loans, which all were repaid timely, he is requesting his fourth loan to increase his working capital and equip the enclosure in which the cattle is fattened, as well as to buy five lean oxes. He purchases his cattle in Sikasso's neighboring towns (Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni, etc.). Mr. Abdoulaye, who feeds and fattens his cattle before the sale, increases his dairy yield thanks to higher-quality cows.
With this loan, he is planning on making a monthly profit of 350,000 FCFA. This will mainly be used to increase his working capital, contribute to the family's expenses and repay his loan's interests.

loans.use: to buy oxes.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and married with four children. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, egg, noodles, spices, etc. 

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Maria Angélica, vive en casa propia, Maria ha logrado obtener desde hace 2 años su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva su esfuerzo constante por obtener diariamente nuevos clientes. El ingreso generado por ella es lo que provee el alimento diario de esta familia además sirve para pagos de los servicios básicos de agua y luz, dado que los ingresos que percibe su esposo son muy bajos para cubrir las necesidades de éste hogar. La actitud positiva, responsable y emprendedora es la que ha permitido que éste no sea primer crédito es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para la compra de lápiz labial, brillos, polvos, pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Angelica lives in her own home.  For the last two years Maria has been running her business of cosmetics and new clothing sales, through her constant effort to obtain new customers.  Her income provides the daily food for this family and also pays for the basic services such as water and light.  The income that her husband provides is not enough to cover the expenses of the family.  Her positive, responsible and enterprising attitude is what made her seek a loan in the past and what has brought her to ask for one now.  She will purchase lipsticks, lip glosses, powders, slacks, shirts, skirts among other items.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks,lips glosses, powders, slacks, shirts, skirts among others.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is  30 years old, married, and a mother of two children. Jackline sells clothes in Bombolulu, Mombasa.  

She  was recently introduced to KADET LTD and she has been in her business for the last two years. It has been a success. This marks her first time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase a bale of clothes for her business.


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and into the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Zuhrakhon

texts.ru: Зухрахон замужем имеет троих взрослых детей и невестку. Более 18 лет она вместе со своей семьей занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов на своем посевном земле. Отходы от сбора урожая идут на откорм скота. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса на приобретение мелкого рогатого скота. Она надеется получить займ.
texts.en: Zuhrakhon is married and has three adult children and a daughter-in-law.  Together with her family, she has been involved in growing agricultural crops on her sowable land for over 18 years.  The income from harvesting goes toward feeding livestock.  Zuhrakhon wants to obtain this loan to expand her business by purchasing small livestock.  She hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plated bracelets, earrings, chains, rings.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Marcelino es chofer asalariado en uno de los sindicatos de choferes de La Paz y su esposa es enfermera trabaja en un centro de salud. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Villa Tejada de la Ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en nuestra institución y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Marcelino is a salaried driver who belongs to one the driver unions of La Paz, and his wife is a nurse who works in a health center.  He is requesting a loan for maintenance of his vehicle.  

He lives in his in-laws' home, which is located in the Villa Tejada area in the city of El Alto.  He is married, and has three children.

This is the first time that this client is taking a loan through our institution and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for his vehicle for passenger transportation.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es: Edward de 48 años de edad convive con Benedicta de 38 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Edward es un hombre dedicado a su negocio quien trabaja juntamente con su querida esposa en la venta de pollos a la brasa en su propio local. En los primeros días no tenían muchas ventas, hasta que incluyo promocionar su negocio con volantes, así logró que la gente pudiera consumir su ricos y deliciosos pollos sazonados con condimentos especiales. Fue de esta manera que la polleria de Edward surgió, ganó mucha clientela en la actualidad cuenta una buena cartera de clientes. Edward agradece a MFP, por haberle facilitado el credito pues fue con esa ayuda que se compró su horno eléctrico, ahora con este nuevo crédito esta pensando en abrir un nuevo local en  el distrito de Pichari así realizar su anhelo de tener una cadena de pollerias. Él esta feliz con este negocio ya que gracias a ello que viene superándose económicamente. Este es su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Edward está contento con su banco comunal porque a aprendido a trabajar mejor en equipo. Con los 2,500 que solicita, alquilará un nuevo local en el distrito de Pichari.
texts.en:
